:   "*There is only* one *plan—one great design which shall govern the universe—*mine*.*"
:   ―Darth Sidious[[20]](#cite_note-SonOfDathomir4-20)

**Darth Sidious**, [born](/wiki/Reproduction "Reproduction") **Sheev Palpatine** and also simply known as the **Emperor**, was a [male](/wiki/Gender "Gender") [human](/wiki/Human "Human") [Dark Lord of the Sith](/wiki/Dark_Lord_of_the_Sith "Dark Lord of the Sith") and [Emperor](/wiki/Galactic_Emperor "Galactic Emperor") of the [Galactic Empire](/wiki/Galactic_Empire "Galactic Empire"), with his [reign](/wiki/Imperial_Era "Imperial Era") lasting from [19 BBY](/wiki/19_BBY "19 BBY") to [4 ABY](/wiki/4_ABY "4 ABY"). Rising to power in the [Galactic Senate](/wiki/Galactic_Senate "Galactic Senate") as the [senator](/wiki/Senator "Senator") of [Naboo](/wiki/Naboo "Naboo"), the secretive [Sith Lord](/wiki/Sith_Lord "Sith Lord") cultivated two identities, Sidious and Palpatine, using both to further his [political](/wiki/Politics "Politics") career and deceive his way into [accomplishing his goal](/wiki/Grand_Plan "Grand Plan"). He orchestrated the fall of the [Galactic Republic](/wiki/Galactic_Republic "Galactic Republic") and the [Jedi Order](/wiki/Jedi_Order "Jedi Order") through the [Clone Wars](/wiki/Clone_Wars "Clone Wars"), and then [established](/wiki/Proclamation_of_the_New_Order "Proclamation of the New Order") his reign over [the galaxy](/wiki/The_galaxy "The galaxy") which lasted until his [death](/wiki/Death "Death") at the [Battle of Endor](/wiki/Battle_of_Endor "Battle of Endor"). However, the [dark side of the Force](/wiki/Dark_side_of_the_Force "Dark side of the Force") gave rise to [powers](/wiki/Transference "Transference") which allowed him to [escape death](/wiki/Resurrection "Resurrection"), seeking further [immortality](/wiki/Immortality "Immortality") until the Emperor was eventually permanently destroyed and killed during the [Battle of Exegol](/wiki/Battle_of_Exegol "Battle of Exegol") by [Rey](/wiki/Rey_Skywalker "Rey Skywalker"), his granddaughter born from his [Strand-Cast](/wiki/Strand-Cast "Strand-Cast") clone [son](/wiki/Youngling "Youngling") [Dathan](/wiki/Dathan "Dathan") and his daughter-in-law [Miramir](/wiki/Miramir "Miramir").

Born on the [Mid Rim](/wiki/Mid_Rim_Territories "Mid Rim Territories") [planet](/wiki/Planet "Planet") Naboo in [84 BBY](/wiki/84_BBY "84 BBY") as the [High Republic Era](/wiki/High_Republic_Era "High Republic Era") ended, Sidious possessed a strong connection to [the Force](/wiki/The_Force "The Force"), and was secretly trained in the ways of the [Sith](/wiki/Sith "Sith") by [Darth Plagueis](/wiki/Darth_Plagueis "Darth Plagueis"). He eventually betrayed and killed his [Sith Master](/wiki/Sith_Master "Sith Master"), in order to train his own [Sith apprentice](/wiki/Sith_apprentice "Sith apprentice"), [Darth](/wiki/Darth "Darth") [Maul](/wiki/Maul "Maul"), for the [Rule of Two](/wiki/Rule_of_Two "Rule of Two") limited their ranks to two Sith [Lords](/wiki/Lord "Lord") at any given [time](/wiki/Time "Time"). As a result of the [Invasion of Naboo](/wiki/Invasion_of_Naboo "Invasion of Naboo"), a crisis orchestrated by Sidious, the Senate [elected](/wiki/Supreme_Chancellor_election,_32_BBY "Supreme Chancellor election, 32 BBY") Palpatine as [Supreme Chancellor](/wiki/Supreme_Chancellor "Supreme Chancellor"). The [Separatist Crisis](/wiki/Separatist_Crisis "Separatist Crisis") and the Clone Wars were masterminded by Sidious and his new apprentice, [Darth Tyranus](/wiki/Dooku "Dooku"), in an effort to achieve [galactic](/wiki/Galaxy "Galaxy") dominance. Following an attempt to [arrest the chancellor](/wiki/Duel_in_Palpatine%27s_office "Duel in Palpatine's office"), the [Great Jedi Purge](/wiki/Great_Jedi_Purge "Great Jedi Purge") commenced with Sidious enacting [Order 66](/wiki/Order_66 "Order 66").

With the [Jedi](/wiki/Jedi "Jedi") all but extinct, Sidious installed the [New Order](/wiki/New_Order "New Order") in the Republic's [place](/wiki/Republic_Era "Republic Era"), declaring himself Galactic [Emperor](/wiki/Emperor "Emperor") and bringing an end to the [millennia](/wiki/Millennium "Millennium") of [democracy](/wiki/Democracy "Democracy"). Shortly after betraying and causing the death of Tyranus, he took on a new apprentice, having lured the [Jedi Knight](/wiki/Jedi_Knight "Jedi Knight") [Anakin Skywalker](/wiki/Anakin_Skywalker "Anakin Skywalker") to the dark side and transforming him into Darth Vader. Their reign was virtually unchallenged for a generation until the formation of the [Alliance to Restore the Republic](/wiki/Alliance_to_Restore_the_Republic "Alliance to Restore the Republic"). During the [Galactic Civil War](/wiki/Galactic_Civil_War "Galactic Civil War"), the Emperor sought to betray Vader, by replacing him with the latter's son, [Luke Skywalker](/wiki/Luke_Skywalker "Luke Skywalker"). However, Sidious' plan backfired when Vader ultimately renounced the dark side and killed Sidious to protect Luke. Thus, with the Sith's destruction, the Force was brought back into balance, fulfilling Anakin's [destiny](/wiki/Destiny "Destiny") as the prophesied [Chosen One](/wiki/Chosen_One "Chosen One").

Through his master's teachings, however, Sidious transferred his essence to an imperfect [clone](/wiki/Cloning "Cloning") vessel that had been [modeled](/wiki/Clone_template "Clone template") on his original body. Anticipating the possibility of defeat, he created the [Contingency](/wiki/Contingency "Contingency") to [destroy](/wiki/Battle_of_Jakku "Battle of Jakku") the Galactic Empire and replace it with a new [Sith Empire](/wiki/Sith_Empire "Sith Empire"), in the event of such a setback. His plans culminated in the [destruction](/wiki/Hosnian_Cataclysm "Hosnian Cataclysm") of the [New Republic](/wiki/New_Republic "New Republic") and the [emergence](/wiki/First_Order-Resistance_War "First Order-Resistance War") of the [First Order](/wiki/First_Order "First Order"), the creation of [Supreme Leader](/wiki/Supreme_Leader "Supreme Leader") [Snoke](/wiki/Snoke "Snoke"), who turned [Ben Solo](/wiki/Ben_Solo "Ben Solo")—heir to the [Skywalker bloodline](/wiki/Skywalker_family "Skywalker family")—to the dark side, and the establishment of the [Final Order](/wiki/Final_Order "Final Order"). When the Emperor [announced](/wiki/Exegol_Broadcast "Exegol Broadcast") his return to the galaxy in [35 ABY](/wiki/35_ABY "35 ABY"), the [Resistance](/wiki/Resistance "Resistance") invaded the planet [Exegol](/wiki/Exegol "Exegol"), Sidious' [hidden stronghold](/wiki/Sith_Citadel "Sith Citadel") in the [Unknown Regions](/wiki/Unknown_Regions "Unknown Regions"). During the battle, the resurrected Emperor discovered a [dyad in the Force](/wiki/Force_dyad "Force dyad") in the form of the [bond](/wiki/Force-bond "Force-bond") between Solo and Rey, a [Padawan](/wiki/Padawan "Padawan") sired from the [Palpatine bloodline](/wiki/Palpatine_family "Palpatine family"). His lifelong dream of eternal rule was finally quashed when Rey called upon the strength of past Jedi to vanquish her grandfather by turning his own [power](/wiki/Force_lightning "Force lightning") against him, destroying Sidious and his [Sith Eternal](/wiki/Sith_Eternal "Sith Eternal") [cultists](/wiki/Sith_cultist "Sith cultist").

## Biography

### Early life and apprenticeship

:   "*My mentor taught me everything about the Force, even the nature of the dark side.*"
:   ―Darth Sidious, to Anakin Skywalker[[12]](#cite_note-Episode_III-12)

 [![Sheev Palpatine was secretly trained as a Sith Lord, taking the name of Darth Sidious.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/c/c4/DarthSidious-SWE.png/revision/latest?cb=20160910204854) [![Sheev Palpatine was secretly trained as a Sith Lord, taking the name of Darth Sidious.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/c/c4/DarthSidious-SWE.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20160910204854)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/c/c4/DarthSidious-SWE.png/revision/latest?cb=20160910204854) 

Sheev Palpatine was secretly trained as a Sith Lord, taking the name of Darth Sidious.

 

The origins of [Darth](/wiki/Darth "Darth") Sidious were closely guarded secrets that he took to his [grave](/wiki/Burial "Burial") more than once. He was [born](/wiki/Reproduction "Reproduction") on the [Mid Rim](/wiki/Mid_Rim_Territories "Mid Rim Territories") [planet](/wiki/Planet "Planet") [Naboo](/wiki/Naboo "Naboo") as Sheev Palpatine,[[8]](#cite_note-TSWB-8) [eighty-four](/wiki/84_BBY "84 BBY") [years](/wiki/Standard_year "Standard year") before the [Battle of Yavin](/wiki/Battle_of_Yavin "Battle of Yavin").[[2]](#cite_note-Timelines-2) The dynastic,[[21]](#cite_note-A_Family_at_War-21) [noble](/wiki/Noble "Noble") [Palpatine family](/wiki/Palpatine_family "Palpatine family") belonged to the affluent class in [Naboo society](/wiki/Naboo_(people) "Naboo (people)"),[[8]](#cite_note-TSWB-8) although throughout [several](/wiki/Republic_Era "Republic Era") [points](/wiki/Imperial_Era "Imperial Era") of [time](/wiki/Time "Time") of his life, Palpatine did not have any living family members as far as the public was aware,[[22]](#cite_note-RiseFall-22)[[19]](#cite_note-Aftermath:_Life_Debt-19) and no records of obituaries for his parents existed,[[22]](#cite_note-RiseFall-22) marking him as the last of his ancient family bloodline.[[23]](#cite_note-Odyssey-23) Palpatine was raised in the cultured [city](/wiki/City "City") of [Theed](/wiki/Theed "Theed"), his [homeworld](/wiki/Homeworld "Homeworld")'s [capital](/wiki/Capital "Capital"); he formed connections with a reputable host of credible [politicians](/wiki/Politics "Politics") produced over the [centuries](/wiki/Standard_century "Standard century"), all the while acquiring a great amount of knowledge on governance and the subtleties of power during his youth.[[24]](#cite_note-CL2016-24) As such, Palpatine had been skilled in manipulation since boyhood.[[25]](#cite_note-Queen's_Hope-25)

The details about how Sidious came to study under the [Sith](/wiki/Sith "Sith") were known by very few,[[14]](#cite_note-BioGal1-14) with it not even being known of when he did,[[8]](#cite_note-TSWB-8) but he became the [Sith apprentice](/wiki/Sith_apprentice "Sith apprentice") to[[15]](#cite_note-Tarkin-15) [Dark Lord of the Sith](/wiki/Dark_Lord_of_the_Sith "Dark Lord of the Sith") [Darth Plagueis](/wiki/Darth_Plagueis "Darth Plagueis") and took on the name Darth Sidious. As a [Sith Lord](/wiki/Sith_Lord "Sith Lord"), Sidious learned all his [Sith Master](/wiki/Sith_Master "Sith Master") knew about the [dark side of the Force](/wiki/Dark_side_of_the_Force "Dark side of the Force"),[[12]](#cite_note-Episode_III-12) following the tradition first set by the ancient [Darth Bane](/wiki/Darth_Bane "Darth Bane").[[26]](#cite_note-Geektionary-26) While apprenticed to Plagueis, Sidious constructed his own [Sith lightsabers](/wiki/Darth_Sidious%27_lightsabers "Darth Sidious' lightsabers").[[27]](#cite_note-Ultimate_Star_Wars-27) At the same time, little by little, he began to secure political power.[[28]](#cite_note-Saga_of_Rey-28)

As a young man, Palpatine had traveled throughout [the galaxy](/wiki/The_galaxy "The galaxy"), collecting art, at least some of which was connected to the dark side, while doing so. Unaware docents would have written off his collection as junk, but Palpatine knew better.[[29]](#cite_note-Queen's_Peril-29) He learned new tactics for how to spread his power during his travels that he kept secret for years to come.[[25]](#cite_note-Queen's_Hope-25) While training with Plagueis, Sidious was taught that two Sith were required for their perilous machinations. So, if they worked together in accordance to Darth Bane's [Rule of Two](/wiki/Rule_of_Two "Rule of Two"), with one of them serving as bait for the dark side of the Force and the other as a vessel, they would succeed in acquiring the ability to harness the full power of the dark side and rule [immortal](/wiki/Immortality "Immortality") for ten thousand years.[[15]](#cite_note-Tarkin-15)

Darth Sidious and Darth Plagueis worked together for years, trying to unlock the secrets to immortality, which was the obsession and longtime lust of Plagueis.[[15]](#cite_note-Tarkin-15) Sidious was eventually made aware of Plagueis' ability to manipulate the [midi-chlorians](/wiki/Midi-chlorian "Midi-chlorian") to create life, which his master employed to prevent the people he cared for from [dying](/wiki/Death "Death").[[12]](#cite_note-Episode_III-12) Plagueis believed the secret to immortality laid within science, and so conducted "unnatural" experiments with his rare ability to manipulate the midi-chlorians, as part of the pair's in depth studies into the biological underpinnings of life itself. Though they were incomplete, they were encouraging to Sidious.[[8]](#cite_note-TSWB-8) According to Darth Sidious' [book](/wiki/Book "Book"), *[The Secrets of the Sith](/wiki/The_Secrets_of_the_Sith "The Secrets of the Sith")*, written later on his life, Plagueis discovered a form of "immortality" through [transference](/wiki/Transference "Transference"), a [Force power](/wiki/Force_power "Force power") that allowed the user to transfer their spirit and consciousness to another body, essentially using bodies as vessels.[[5]](#cite_note-TROS_Expanded_Edition-5)[[30]](#cite_note-Secrets_of_the_Sith-30) This obsession with extending one's own life later passed onto Sidious[[7]](#cite_note-Episode_IX-7) from his time as[[31]](#cite_note-TROS_VD-31) [Galactic Emperor](/wiki/Galactic_Emperor "Galactic Emperor").[[32]](#cite_note-SWEYoda-32) Plagueis also attempted to create a [Force dyad](/wiki/Force_dyad "Force dyad") with Sidious, a unique [Force-bond](/wiki/Force-bond "Force-bond") as strong as life itself and which was predecessor to the Rule of Two. However, Plagueis was unable to form the dyad.[[5]](#cite_note-TROS_Expanded_Edition-5)

### Political career and double life

#### Senator of Naboo

:   "*As a dark apprentice, I sensed that the Galactic Republic was in disarray. Its delegates held no interest in the common good. They would be easy targets for my influence. Serving as a senator, I manipulated their greed in my favor. With each new act of legislation, I rose through their ranks. Total control of the galaxy's governing body drew ever closer.*"
:   ―Darth Sidious[[30]](#cite_note-Secrets_of_the_Sith-30)

 [![Senator Palpatine represented his homeworld Naboo in the Galactic Senate while keeping his Sith identity a secret.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/0e/Rise-of-Palpatine.png/revision/latest?cb=20210906014529) [![Senator Palpatine represented his homeworld Naboo in the Galactic Senate while keeping his Sith identity a secret.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/0e/Rise-of-Palpatine.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20210906014529)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/0e/Rise-of-Palpatine.png/revision/latest?cb=20210906014529) 

Senator Palpatine represented his homeworld Naboo in the Galactic Senate while keeping his Sith identity a secret.

 

In his public persona as Sheev Palpatine, Sidious took a great interest in politics and the public life of Naboo.[[33]](#cite_note-Complete-33) In [65 BBY](/wiki/65_BBY "65 BBY")[[34]](#cite_note-Nexus-34) he was part of the officials attending the opening ceremony of the [Theed power generator](/wiki/Theed_power_generator "Theed power generator"), with attendees noting his interest in the complex's deep-pit design.[[33]](#cite_note-Complete-33) His embarkment on a career in politics was further aided by his master, who arranged for him to be raised[[28]](#cite_note-Saga_of_Rey-28) to the position of [senator](/wiki/Senator "Senator") for his homeworld in the [Galactic Republic](/wiki/Galactic_Republic "Galactic Republic") [Senate](/wiki/Galactic_Senate "Galactic Senate")[[15]](#cite_note-Tarkin-15) as part of the [Naboo delegation](/wiki/Naboo_delegation "Naboo delegation"),[[29]](#cite_note-Queen's_Peril-29) being elected in [52 BBY](/wiki/52_BBY "52 BBY").[[2]](#cite_note-Timelines-2) His role also made him the senator for the rest of the [Chommell sector](/wiki/Chommell_sector "Chommell sector"),[[29]](#cite_note-Queen's_Peril-29) meaning he represented a total of thirty-six planets.[[35]](#cite_note-TPM_Graphic_Novel-35) Once elected, Palpatine quickly joined incumbent [Supreme Chancellor](/wiki/Supreme_Chancellor "Supreme Chancellor") [Skor Kalpana](/wiki/Skor_Kalpana "Skor Kalpana")'s ruling party. He was followed by a grouping of aides who loyally followed him since his days on Naboo. He noticed the fervent bickering and corruption that mired the Republic. He began to establish relations with those who would become his future collaborators, such as [Wilhuff Tarkin](/wiki/Wilhuff_Tarkin "Wilhuff Tarkin"). The duo met for the first time when Tarkin was still a cadet of the [Sullust Sector Spacefarers Academy](/wiki/Sullust_Sector_Spacefarers_Academy "Sullust Sector Spacefarers Academy"), and while Palpatine was still apprenticed to Plagueis.[[15]](#cite_note-Tarkin-15)

Taking an interest in the younger man, Senator Palpatine resolved to help him to join the [Judicial Department](/wiki/Judicial_Department "Judicial Department"), according to Tarkin's desire but advised him to also consider a political career. In the following years, their relationship became more and more confidential. Palpatine often lauded Tarkin for his talents and skills and remarked they were very similar: they both came from planets at the edge of the galaxy but were destined to have great repercussions on the [history of the galaxy](/wiki/Timeline_of_galactic_history "Timeline of galactic history") itself. Tarkin eventually became one of the few people who called Palpatine by his first name.[[15]](#cite_note-Tarkin-15)

Keeping his Sith identity a secret from the public eye, Sidious took it upon himself to execute the [Sith's long-percolating plan](/wiki/Grand_Plan "Grand Plan") of supplanting the Republic with a new [Sith Empire](/wiki/Galactic_Empire "Galactic Empire"), as well as destroying the [Jedi Order](/wiki/Jedi_Order "Jedi Order"). In the process, he would deceive the Senate, Republic and Jedi.[[36]](#cite_note-SWESidious-36) In his days as a senator, Palpatine was known to have the backing of mysterious friends and allies who he might reference but never name; for example, even Tarkin did not know who specifically worked with Palpatine in the shadows, even if Palpatine often referenced them. Trying to speculate as to who his secret supporters were, Palpatine's political enemies knew he had secret contacts aside from his loyal Naboo followers and the senatorial cabal he was often grouped within. Rumors swirled that shadowy organizations and figures who worked out of the public eye—including industrialists, financiers and bankers from the galaxy's most major sectors—were linked to the senator of Naboo.[[15]](#cite_note-Tarkin-15)

#### Training a Sith apprentice

:   "*For many years, Darth Maul trained in secrecy. But as my plans for galactic dominance began to unfold, the time came to make his presence known.*"
:   ―Darth Sidious[[30]](#cite_note-Secrets_of_the_Sith-30)

Seeking a Sith apprentice, Sidious traveled to the planet [Dathomir](/wiki/Dathomir "Dathomir") and met with the [Dathomirian](/wiki/Dathomirian "Dathomirian") [Nightsister](/wiki/Nightsisters "Nightsisters") [Mother](/wiki/Mother_(title) "Mother (title)") [Talzin](/wiki/Talzin "Talzin"). Intermingling his knowledge of the dark side of the Force with Talzin's knowledge of Nightsister [magicks](/wiki/Magick "Magick"), Sidious had considered to make Talzin his apprentice and right hand. However, Sidious chose her infant son, the [Zabrak](/wiki/Zabrak "Zabrak") [Nightbrother](/wiki/Nightbrothers "Nightbrothers") who would become his true Sith apprentice, [Darth Maul](/wiki/Maul "Maul").[[37]](#cite_note-SonOfDathomir3-37) When Sidious visited Talzin, Maul always hid in his room, afraid of the man and worried about Talzin's increasing bond with him.[[38]](#cite_note-UnwillingApprentice-38) Sidious was drawn to Maul for his inability to control his anger.[[29]](#cite_note-Queen's_Peril-29) Eventually, Sidious ordered Talzin to give up Maul to a [keeper](/wiki/Unidentified_Nightbrother_keeper "Unidentified Nightbrother keeper"), threatening to not follow through on his promise to make her his apprentice. She reluctantly agreed, and Maul ran into the forest angrily, overhearing the conversation from behind his door. When he returned the next morning, a Nightbrother took him and threw him in a pit, not allowing him to say goodbye to his own mother.[[38]](#cite_note-UnwillingApprentice-38)

 [![Sidious killed his Sith Master Darth Plagueis, and under the Rule of Two, trained Darth Maul as his Sith apprentice.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/2/2b/Sidious_Maul.png/revision/latest?cb=20201008105820) [![Sidious killed his Sith Master Darth Plagueis, and under the Rule of Two, trained Darth Maul as his Sith apprentice.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/2/2b/Sidious_Maul.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20201008105820)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/2/2b/Sidious_Maul.png/revision/latest?cb=20201008105820) 

Sidious killed his Sith Master Darth Plagueis, and under the Rule of Two, trained Darth Maul as his Sith apprentice.

 

Over the course of months, Maul was put through relentless domestic abuse, all orchestrated by Sidious as a test. With the influence of his keeper's sons beating him and the abuse, Sidious' wish for Maul came true; Maul's perceptions, and his love for his mother eventually turned into resentment and hatred for abandoning him. Maul's hatred started manifesting through the Dark Side, and he would practice using the dark side of the Force every chance he got; eventually, the two brothers stopped beating him after seeing that their provocations were no longer affecting him. Sidious eventually orchestrated a selection to gain himself an apprentice. At the Selection Arena, Sidious witnessed Maul after he was initially prevented from participating. In a sudden burst of anger, he used the dark side of the Force to [Force choke](/wiki/Force_choke "Force choke") the two brothers, and then the keeper, all in front of Sidious and Talzin. Beyond pleased at Maul's progress and potential, Sidious declared Maul the winner and his new apprentice, much to Talzin's dismay.[[38]](#cite_note-UnwillingApprentice-38)

As such, instead of following through on his promise of giving the apprenticeship to Talzin, Sidious stole her son from her and left Dathomir, leaving the Nightsister longing for revenge against the Sith Lord.[[37]](#cite_note-SonOfDathomir3-37) Following the traditions set forth by the Rule of Two[[8]](#cite_note-TSWB-8) as it demanded only two Sith,[[39]](#cite_note-Sacrifice-39) and deciding that Plagueis had outlived his usefulness, Sidious betrayed his master by breaking into his [apartment](/wiki/Darth_Plagueis%27_apartment "Darth Plagueis' apartment") and murdering him in his [sleep](/wiki/Sleep "Sleep").[[40]](#cite_note-Emperor_Palpatine-40) Sidious remembered with fondness the moment he realized he was more powerful than Plagueis and could kill the man who had trained him. He later reflected that "Master" was the first title of power he claimed for himself.[[41]](#cite_note-Masters_short_story-41) Now the Sith Master himself, Sidious brutally trained Maul to be a weapon of the Sith,[[37]](#cite_note-SonOfDathomir3-37) viewing Maul's prowess and combat abilities as an invaluable asset to his Grand Plan.[[42]](#cite_note-SWEMaul-42)

At some point while training Maul, Sidious took his apprentice to [Malachor](/wiki/Malachor "Malachor") to bear witness to a [great battle](/wiki/Great_Scourge_of_Malachor "Great Scourge of Malachor") that occurred there between the Jedi and the Sith. He forced Maul to breathe in the ashes of [Sith warriors](/wiki/Sith_warrior "Sith warrior"), slain when an ancient weapon was activated in the [Sith temple](/wiki/Malachor_Sith_Temple "Malachor Sith Temple") on the planet. While breathing in this ash, Maul had visions of members of the Sith order being struck down by the Jedi. He felt the slash of saber after saber as he felt the death of his Sith brethren.[[43]](#cite_note-Darth_Maul_2-43) These visions, in tandem with his training, made Maul long for revenge against the Jedi Order,[[42]](#cite_note-SWEMaul-42) which had defeated the Sith a millennium earlier.[[44]](#cite_note-DBBane-44) Thus motivated, Darth Maul would serve as a powerful weapon in Sidious' plans to destroy the Jedi and restore the Sith to galactic power.[[42]](#cite_note-SWEMaul-42)

#### Preparations and manipulation

:   "*Because something dangerous is brewing in our little corner of the Outer Rim. Discontent is on the rise, as are criminal enterprises and mercenary groups in the employ of self-serving corporations. In the Seswenna sector, several lommite mining concerns are vying for the attention of the Trade Federation, which is determined to forge a monopoly in the free trade zones. Even on my own Naboo, the king finds himself embroiled with the Trade Federation and off world bankers with regard to our plasma exports. Ours are remote worlds, but what transpires in those sectors of the Outer Rim could very well have galactic repercussions.*"
:   ―Senator Sheev Palpatine, to Governor-to-be Wilhuff Tarkin[[15]](#cite_note-Tarkin-15)

 [![Darth Sidious lived a double life as Sheev Palpatine, using both identities to further his plans of galactic domination.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/2/28/Senator_palpatine.png/revision/latest?cb=20201008105709) [![Darth Sidious lived a double life as Sheev Palpatine, using both identities to further his plans of galactic domination.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/2/28/Senator_palpatine.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20201008105709)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/2/28/Senator_palpatine.png/revision/latest?cb=20201008105709) 

Darth Sidious lived a double life as Sheev Palpatine, using both identities to further his plans of galactic domination.

 

In [42 BBY](/wiki/42_BBY "42 BBY"),[[45]](#cite_note-Dooku_leaving_date-45) Palpatine was introduced to [Dooku](/wiki/Dooku "Dooku"), a Jedi, by the latter's former Padawan [Rael Averross](/wiki/Rael_Averross "Rael Averross"), after the former [Jedi Master](/wiki/Jedi_Master "Jedi Master") delivered an address to the Galactic Senate on Coruscant. Following the [invasion of Serenno](/wiki/Incident_on_Serenno "Incident on Serenno"), Dooku left the Jedi Order to claim the title of [planetary count](/wiki/Count_of_Serenno "Count of Serenno"),[[46]](#cite_note-Dooku_Jedi_Lost-46) but Sidious eventually recruited Dooku to the Sith[[47]](#cite_note-TCW_Lost_Missions_Q&A-47) by exploiting his anger with the Republic[[48]](#cite_note-Rise-48) despite also having Maul under his wing.[[47]](#cite_note-TCW_Lost_Missions_Q&A-47) Indeed, Dooku would not yet become a Sith apprentice.[[30]](#cite_note-Secrets_of_the_Sith-30) To fulfill Sidious' plans, Dooku [betrayed and orchestrated](/wiki/Mission_to_Oba_Diah_(Sifo-Dyas) "Mission to Oba Diah (Sifo-Dyas)") the death of Jedi Master [Sifo-Dyas](/wiki/Sifo-Dyas "Sifo-Dyas") and took over his clientele for the commission of a [clone](/wiki/Cloning "Cloning") army produced on [Kamino](/wiki/Kamino "Kamino"); the event was subsequently covered up when Dooku erased all records of Kamino from the [Jedi Archives](/wiki/Jedi_Archives "Jedi Archives").[[49]](#cite_note-TLO-49)

All the while, Palpatine maintained a faithful correspondence with Wilhuff Tarkin—whose service in the Judicial Department kept them from meeting face-to-face often—and supported bills in the Senate that would aid Eriadu and the Seswenna sector, Tarkin's homeworld and its sector, respectively. After Valorum's re-election, something Palpatine attributed to senatorial special interest groups who needed a weak chancellor, whispers began to swirl Valorum would be unable to hold onto power, with Palpatine's name emerging as a possible successor to the Chancellery. Around that time, Palpatine also met with Tarkin—who had grown disillusioned with the Judicial force—in his Coruscant office in one of their rare person-to-person meetings, where Palpatine urged Tarkin to enter planetary politics as Eriadu's new governor. Warning him something dark was brewing in their corner of the galaxy and promising Tarkin the support of himself and his shadowy allies, Palpatine convinced Tarkin, who promised to do whatever was best for Eriadu and the Republic in any manner Palpatine wished it to be done.[[15]](#cite_note-Tarkin-15)

In need of pawns for his plans[[50]](#cite_note-Star_Pilot-50) but preferring a mysterious, hooded presence through [holographic](/wiki/Hologram "Hologram") transmissions[[51]](#cite_note-BioGal2-51) rather than direct communication,[[36]](#cite_note-SWESidious-36) Sidious contacted the galaxy's most powerful beings and convinced them to do his bidding with promises and threats.[[51]](#cite_note-BioGal2-51) To that end, Sidious was also able to manipulate [Nute Gunray](/wiki/Nute_Gunray "Nute Gunray")'s rise to the position of [Viceroy of the Trade Federation](/wiki/Viceroy_of_the_Trade_Federation "Viceroy of the Trade Federation").[[52]](#cite_note-On_the_Front_Lines-52) Gunray was able to arise to that position thanks to the [Eriadu Conference](/wiki/Eriadu_Conference "Eriadu Conference"), where an effort to end the squabbles between the [Trade Federation](/wiki/Trade_Federation "Trade Federation") and Republic ended in disaster; the [Nebula Front](/wiki/Nebula_Front "Nebula Front") attacked the conference and successfully wiped out the [Federation directorate](/wiki/Directors_of_the_Trade_Federation "Directors of the Trade Federation"), creating a power vacuum for Gunray to step into, while Valorum escaped and was able to secure a brief boost in popularity, with which he pushed through taxation legislation.[[48]](#cite_note-Rise-48) Convincing the Trade Federation to obey him by promising wealth, Sidious odered the Federation to construct a [droid army](/wiki/Trade_Federation_Droid_Army "Trade Federation Droid Army"),[[50]](#cite_note-Star_Pilot-50) Sidious also helped the [Geonosian](/wiki/Geonosian "Geonosian") [Poggle the Lesser](/wiki/Poggle_the_Lesser "Poggle the Lesser") rise to the position of [Archduke](/wiki/Archduke "Archduke") of [Geonosis](/wiki/Geonosis "Geonosis") and [controller](/wiki/Controller "Controller") of their [droid foundries](/wiki/Geonosis_droid_factories "Geonosis droid factories").[[53]](#cite_note-Poggle_card-53) With Sidious' backing, Poggle produced millions of [B1-series battle droids](/wiki/B1-series_battle_droid "B1-series battle droid") for the [Trade Federation military](/wiki/Trade_Federation_military "Trade Federation military").[[27]](#cite_note-Ultimate_Star_Wars-27)

In need of someone to lead the the Droid Army for their planned war,[[54]](#cite_note-SW_Book-54) Sidious and Dooku eventually took notice of and realized the promise in [Grievous](/wiki/Grievous "Grievous"), a [Kaleesh](/wiki/Kaleesh "Kaleesh") warlord[[55]](#cite_note-HC_8-55) once known as Qymaen jai Sheelal[[56]](#cite_note-Build_R2-D2_57-56) who led his fellow Kaleesh warriors in the [war against](/wiki/Kaleesh-Yam%27rii_war "Kaleesh-Yam'rii war") the neighboring[[55]](#cite_note-HC_8-55) and technologically superior[[57]](#cite_note-The_Separatists-57) [Yam'rii](/wiki/Yam%27rii "Yam'rii") species.[[55]](#cite_note-HC_8-55) After the Republic[[48]](#cite_note-Rise-48) and the Jedi intervened[[55]](#cite_note-HC_8-55) to support the Yam'rii,[[48]](#cite_note-Rise-48) the Kaleesh had been punished, with hundreds of thousands dying of starvation. Sidious and Dooku, who had important plans for Grievous, took notice of his exploits as he became one of IGBC's most valuable resources.[[57]](#cite_note-The_Separatists-57) Also interested in how technologically advanced beings could be deployed, the Sith offered Grievous a chance to be converted into a cyborg[[58]](#cite_note-The_Dark_Side-58) and hoped to recruit Grievous to command the droid armies.[[8]](#cite_note-TSWB-8)

After Grievous agreed to the surgeries[[58]](#cite_note-The_Dark_Side-58) to boost his own power[[59]](#cite_note-CVD-59) and underwent his transformation over a period of time,[[54]](#cite_note-SW_Book-54) Dooku [orchestrated a shuttle crash](/wiki/Sabotage_of_Grievous%27_shuttle "Sabotage of Grievous' shuttle")[[55]](#cite_note-HC_8-55) that destroyed[[60]](#cite_note-Alien_Archive-60) whatever remained[[58]](#cite_note-The_Dark_Side-58) of Grievous's organic body.[[60]](#cite_note-Alien_Archive-60) Extensive surgery[[61]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_100_Objects-61) performed by [cybernetics experts](/wiki/Cyberneticist "Cyberneticist") and Geonosian biotechnicians,[[55]](#cite_note-HC_8-55) with assistance from medical droids, including the [FX-9 surgical assistant](/wiki/FX-9_surgical_assistant "FX-9 surgical assistant") [FX-6](/wiki/FX-6 "FX-6"),[[58]](#cite_note-The_Dark_Side-58) was required to save Grievous's life. The operation resulted in Grievous physically being drastic changed.[[61]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_100_Objects-61)

#### Holding back Maul

:   "*Remember that your anger is a tool. It is not your master."  
    "No. You are.*"
:   ―Darth Sidious and Darth Maul[[62]](#cite_note-AoR_Maul-62)

 [![Darth Sidious worked to curb Darth Maul's overenthusiasm to fight the Jedi lest his apprentice unwittingly ruin his carefully-laid plans and destroy them both.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/1/11/AoR-DarthMaul-C-art.png/revision/latest?cb=20190626132733) [![Darth Sidious worked to curb Darth Maul's overenthusiasm to fight the Jedi lest his apprentice unwittingly ruin his carefully-laid plans and destroy them both.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/1/11/AoR-DarthMaul-C-art.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20190626132733)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/1/11/AoR-DarthMaul-C-art.png/revision/latest?cb=20190626132733) 

Darth Sidious worked to curb Darth Maul's overenthusiasm to fight the Jedi lest his apprentice unwittingly ruin his carefully-laid plans and destroy them both.

 

In [33 BBY](/wiki/33_BBY "33 BBY"),[[63]](#cite_note-Maul_5_Date-63) Sidious met with Maul in his hideout, the old [LiMerge Power Building](/wiki/Inquisitorius_Headquarters "Inquisitorius Headquarters") in [the Works](/wiki/The_Works "The Works") industrial zone of Coruscant, to chide him on allowing Jedi to sense his presence. Sidious told his apprentice he did not care about his impatience, warning Maul that ruining his master's long-term plans would have severe consequences. Sidious then sent Maul to deal with a [group of pirates](/wiki/Unidentified_pirate_faction "Unidentified pirate faction") harassing their [secret mining facilities](/wiki/Kellux_mining_facilities "Kellux mining facilities") in the [Kellux system](/wiki/Kellux_system "Kellux system").[[64]](#cite_note-Darth_Maul_1-64) Sidious was secretly testing Maul's loyalty by setting him up with the opportunity to face a [Jedi Padawan](/wiki/Eldra_Kaitis "Eldra Kaitis"). Maul proceeded to unwittingly follow the path laid out for him and [slew](/wiki/Skirmish_on_the_moon_of_Drazkel "Skirmish on the moon of Drazkel") the Jedi. After his apprentice's return to Coruscant, Sidious revealed his knowledge of all of Maul's actions, asking if his apprentice was satisfied with having killed a Jedi. Sidious was pleased when Maul replied that he was not.[[65]](#cite_note-Darth_Maul_5-65)

Not long after, during the course of activities in the [Coruscant underworld](/wiki/Coruscant_Underworld "Coruscant Underworld"), Maul killed a [Force-sensitive thief](/wiki/Zek_Peiro "Zek Peiro") in an attempt to assuage his thirst to fight Jedi. Sidious called attention to the foolishness of such behavior, but Maul insisted that he had been careful enough to avoid leaving evidence that could alert the Jedi to the continued existence of the Sith. Sidious complimented Maul's anger but warned him that he needed to temper it with patience, which Maul responded to with frustration at still being held in check. Sidious reminded him that his training was not as complete as he assumed, taking him back to Malachor to revisit the site where years before Maul had undergone visions of the Sith being wiped out by the Jedi. Sidious instructed Maul to once again instigate another vision by breathing in the ashes of dead Sith warriors. Through the vision, Maul learned the value of patience since rage alone was not enough for he and and his master to defeat the combined might of the Jedi Order. Pleased, Sidious pointed out that a combination of patient planning with the power granted by the dark side would, in time, see them successfully destroy the Jedi.[[62]](#cite_note-AoR_Maul-62)

#### Meeting with the Jedi

:   "*Why* this *shade of blue?"  
    "There's no accounting for taste. I sometimes wonder what it would look like in red.*"
:   ―Adi Gallia and Sheev Palpatine[[66]](#cite_note-The_Living_Force-66)

Around this time,[[67]](#cite_note-TLFDate-67) Palpatine met, as he frequently did, with Chancellor Valorum and  [Jedi Masters](/wiki/Jedi_Master "Jedi Master") [Yoda](/wiki/Yoda "Yoda") and [Adi Gallia](/wiki/Adi_Gallia "Adi Gallia") to discuss diplomatic matters of relevance to the Republic and the Jedi Order. One item of interest were the labor strikes on [Garqi](/wiki/Garqi "Garqi") and [Chamble](/wiki/Chamble "Chamble"); for the latter, Palpatine suggested that the Jedi stage a training mission there. Another topic was how to handle a shipment of garish boots sent by the new member world [Hafernia](/wiki/Hafernia "Hafernia") as a gift for the Order. Gallia was uncomfortable at the idea of accepting them, stating that Jedi did not endorse products. Palpatine replied that they *did* endorse the Republic and good governance. Ultimately, the group decided that the Order would accept the boots in name only.[[66]](#cite_note-The_Living_Force-66)

Gallia was then briefly called away to speak with Jedi Master [Qui-Gon Jinn](/wiki/Qui-Gon_Jinn "Qui-Gon Jinn"). When she returned, Palpatine handed her a datapad outlining the actions he and Valorum had proposed thus far. Before rejoining the main conversation, the two covertly discussed their aesthetic disagreement with the deep shade of blue that Valorum had chosen post-reelection, with Palpatine wondering what the room would look like in red. Shortly after, Palpatine and Valorum became aware of the [Jedi Council](/wiki/Jedi_High_Council "Jedi High Council")'s plan to visit [Kwenn](/wiki/Kwenn "Kwenn") and contacted Master [Mace Windu](/wiki/Mace_Windu "Mace Windu") to discuss the matter.[[66]](#cite_note-The_Living_Force-66)

#### Eliminating a pawn

:   "*You are old. Too old, to be of much further service to the Jedi—or me. And besides, my interests have changed."  
    "What do you mean?"  
    "The pieces are almost in place for the grand game. The Republic, the Trade Federation, the rest—all are poised to play their roles. It serves me to have the Jedi Order constantly moving around, following the whims of commerce and the Senate. Shuffling forces and dividing their attention.*"
:   ―Darth Sidious and Voh[[66]](#cite_note-The_Living_Force-66)

After the Jedi Council's [defense of Kwenn](/wiki/Mission_to_Kwenn "Mission to Kwenn") from pirate forces commanded by the [Riftwalker](/wiki/Riftwalkers "Riftwalkers") leader [Zilastra](/wiki/Zilastra "Zilastra") and the destruction of the Order's [Sanctuary Mount](/wiki/Sanctuary_Mount "Sanctuary Mount") [outpost](/wiki/Jedi_outpost "Jedi outpost"), Sidious contacted the installation's former [Seneschal](/wiki/Seneschal "Seneschal"), an elderly [Bimm](/wiki/Bimm "Bimm") named [Voh](/wiki/Voh "Voh"), by holocomm. Sidious had, in the guise of Senator Palpatine, made an arrangement with Voh to maintain the Senate's interest in Kwenn, such that the Jedi kept the outpost open, in exchange for Jedi texts from its library that Sidious considered important. They had also agreed that anything Palpatine was not interested in would be destroyed to help obscure the fact that they were missing. However, Sidious discovered that Voh had instead sold off the remaining material, unable to bring himself to eradicate historical documents; and that during the Council's time on Kwenn, Master [Eeth Koth](/wiki/Eeth_Koth "Eeth Koth") had discovered items were missing from the library and located some of the minor ones in a [local shop](/wiki/Lamplighter_Boutique "Lamplighter Boutique"). When presented with this, Voh argued that the evidence of the theft was gone with the outpost and that he could finagle his way into a position at another outpost and continue supplying Palpatine with Jedi works.[[66]](#cite_note-The_Living_Force-66)

However, Sidious was not interested in continuing to deal with Voh and stated as much. The Sith Lord explained to the confused Bimm that he was no longer interested in Kwenn, in fact that he was pleased to see the Jedi closing outposts and moving around the galaxy in a reactionary manner, all of which would benefit plans he would soon put into effect involving the Republic and the Trade Federation. Sidious stated that Zilastra's scheme had impressed him and that she would be of further interest, although he was not surprised that she had ultimately failed in her endeavor against the Jedi. The Sith Lord also pointed out that Voh was too old to be of much further use to himself or the Jedi. When the bewildered Bimm asked why Palpatine had so radically changed his attitude and why he was telling him all of this, Sidious replied that it was for another being's ears, indicating his apprentice Darth Maul, who had entered the room and proceeded to deal with the former Seneschal.[[66]](#cite_note-The_Living_Force-66)

### War on Naboo

#### Invasion of Naboo

:   "*Orchestrating a conflict on my homeworld of Naboo, I sowed the seeds of civil unrest. Chaos erupted within the Senate—a chaos I controlled on every front.*"
:   ―Darth Sidious[[30]](#cite_note-Secrets_of_the_Sith-30)

 [![Sidious orchestrated the Invasion of Naboo by the Trade Federation, which was under his influence.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/52/Tey_How_Gunray_Haako_and_Sidious.png/revision/latest?cb=20180519083749) [![Sidious orchestrated the Invasion of Naboo by the Trade Federation, which was under his influence.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/52/Tey_How_Gunray_Haako_and_Sidious.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20180519083749)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/52/Tey_How_Gunray_Haako_and_Sidious.png/revision/latest?cb=20180519083749) 

Sidious orchestrated the Invasion of Naboo by the Trade Federation, which was under his influence.

 

Sidious, as Palpatine, moved to seize power from Supreme Chancellor [Finis Valorum](/wiki/Finis_Valorum "Finis Valorum"), who had virtually no political power and counted Palpatine as a close friend and ally, allowing for Sidious to easily manipulate him.[[68]](#cite_note-SWEValorum-68) In the Senate, Sidious secretly ensured that the Senate repeatedly battled over bills concerning taxation, bringing about voting sessions that ended in both Federation defeats and victories, while Gunray falsely believed Sidious was working towards Federation victories all the time. Following a discussion in his [office](/wiki/Emperor%27s_office "Emperor's office") about the [latest version of the bill](/wiki/Prop_31-814D "Prop 31-814D"), Valorum requested Palpatine to stay behind and confided in him that he was considering having a Jedi step in to serve as an independent moderator, which Palpatine appeared to be surprised by before requesting he hold off on that option for the time being. Moving up his plans upon being told of the [Chommell sector summit](/wiki/Chommell_sector_summit "Chommell sector summit") that threatened to strengthen the sector,[[29]](#cite_note-Queen's_Peril-29) Sidious used holographic communication to convince Gunray to blockade the planet Naboo, making it seem as though it was in protest of the Senate's taxation of trade routes to outlying [star systems](/wiki/Star_system "Star system"). Eventually, driven to desperation by the inactivity of the Senate, Valorum secretly dispatched two [Jedi Knights](/wiki/Jedi_Knight "Jedi Knight")—Master Qui-Gon Jinn and his [Padawan](/wiki/Padawan "Padawan") [Obi-Wan Kenobi](/wiki/Obi-Wan_Kenobi "Obi-Wan Kenobi")—as [ambassadors](/wiki/Ambassador "Ambassador") to negotiate with the Trade Federation's [Neimoidian](/wiki/Neimoidian "Neimoidian") leaders.[[1]](#cite_note-Episode_I-1)

With Sidious pleasantly surprised at the ingenuity the Geonosians had shown in creating the Federation's battle droid army,[[29]](#cite_note-Queen's_Peril-29) the Trade Federation initiated the [Invasion of Naboo](/wiki/Invasion_of_Naboo "Invasion of Naboo") on the orders of Sidious, who also instructed Gunray to kill Chancellor Valorum's Jedi ambassadors. When Gunray questioned the legality of the invasion, Sidious simply stated that he would make it legal. The Neimoidians acted accordingly, but the Jedi survived the [assassination](/wiki/Assassin "Assassin") attempt and [escaped](/wiki/Escape_from_the_Saak%27ak "Escape from the Saak'ak") the [Federation ship](/wiki/Lucrehulk-class_battleship "Lucrehulk-class battleship"). After Sidious terminated his communication with Gunray, [Queen](/wiki/Queen "Queen") [Padmé Amidala](/wiki/Padm%C3%A9_Amidala "Padmé Amidala") contacted him concerning the Federation's denial that the Chancellor had sent ambassadors to speak with them as promised. Sidious, as Palpatine, feigned concern at this supposed revelation, but was cut off mid-sentence by the Trade Federation's communication blackout, notifying the Naboo to their invasion.[[1]](#cite_note-Episode_I-1)

#### The Queen's escape

:   "*At last, we will reveal ourselves to the Jedi. At last, we will have revenge.*"
:   ―Darth Maul, to Darth Sidious — ![20?cb=20250116042720](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/ee/Quote-audio.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/20?cb=20250116042720) [Link](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/6b/RevengeAtLast-TPM.flac/revision/latest?cb=20250307223813)▶️ ([file info](/wiki/File:RevengeAtLast-TPM.flac "File:RevengeAtLast-TPM.flac"))[[1]](#cite_note-Episode_I-1)

The Federation's [droid](/wiki/Droid "Droid") army proceeded with their assault. Within a day, the army [occupied](/wiki/Capture_of_Theed "Capture of Theed") the planet's capital city and its surrounding regions. Additionally, Amidala and her retinue were captured and presented with a treaty that would bring an air of legitimacy to their invasion. However, the Jedi arrived to rescue them, and they successfully evaded the blockade aboard the queen's [starship](/wiki/J-type_327_Nubian_royal_starship "J-type 327 Nubian royal starship").[[1]](#cite_note-Episode_I-1)

 [![Queen Padmé Amidala escaped from the Trade Federation, causing Sidious to send Maul after her.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/91/Sith_Lords_Trade_Federation.png/revision/latest?cb=20201008105922) [![Queen Padmé Amidala escaped from the Trade Federation, causing Sidious to send Maul after her.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/91/Sith_Lords_Trade_Federation.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20201008105922)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/91/Sith_Lords_Trade_Federation.png/revision/latest?cb=20201008105922) 

Queen Padmé Amidala escaped from the Trade Federation, causing Sidious to send Maul after her.

 

When Gunray informed Sidious of Amidala's failure to sign the treaty, the livid Sith [Lord](/wiki/Lord "Lord") introduced them to Darth Maul, whom he dispatched to find and recapture Amidala. Due to Amidala's ship sustaining damage in the escape, the queen opted to land on [Tatooine](/wiki/Tatooine "Tatooine"), an obscure desert world in the [Outer Rim Territories](/wiki/Outer_Rim_Territories "Outer Rim Territories"), to repair the ship. Maul managed to ascertain the queen's location, and assured his master that his search on the sparsely populated world would be a short one. Sidious told him to move against the Jedi first, and then take the queen once they were dead. Maul left for Tatooine, but he [failed](/wiki/Duel_on_Tatooine "Duel on Tatooine") to kill the Jedi or retrieve Amidala. Sidious knew she would come to Coruscant if Maul failed.[[1]](#cite_note-Episode_I-1)

#### The Senate

:   "*Enter the bureaucrats, the true rulers of the Republic, and on the payroll of the Trade Federation, I might add. This is where Chancellor Valorum's strength will disappear.*"
:   ―Sheev Palpatine, to Padmé Amidala[[1]](#cite_note-Episode_I-1)

While waiting for Amidala to reach Coruscant, Sidious found he had little to do, although he made sure to go to the Senate to vote on its current matters, even though he did not care for them. With nothing else to do, Palpatine took to looking through his catalogue of art, having run out of space in his office to store the rest of his collection. He stopped his scrolling when he saw a black statue known as the [Yonta Prime](/wiki/Yonta_Prime "Yonta Prime"), which, despite being one of his favorite pieces, he found he could not fit into his office without looking careless. He resolved to take it out of storage, ordering it to be taken to his [apartment](/wiki/Palpatine%27s_apartment "Palpatine's apartment"), so he could place it into the Supreme Chancellor's office when his current plan had finished.[[29]](#cite_note-Queen's_Peril-29)

 [![Senator Palpatine personally welcomed Queen Amidala to Coruscant, the capital world of the Galactic Republic.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/95/Amidala_arrives_on_Coruscant.png/revision/latest?cb=20201017163415) [![Senator Palpatine personally welcomed Queen Amidala to Coruscant, the capital world of the Galactic Republic.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/95/Amidala_arrives_on_Coruscant.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20201017163415)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/95/Amidala_arrives_on_Coruscant.png/revision/latest?cb=20201017163415) 

Senator Palpatine personally welcomed Queen Amidala to Coruscant, the capital world of the Galactic Republic.

 

Despite these setbacks, Palpatine was able to convene with Amidala on [Coruscant](/wiki/Coruscant "Coruscant"), where she intended to plead her case to Chancellor Valorum before the Galactic Senate. Bringing Amidala to his apartment for an audience, Palpatine told the queen that the senate was long past caring about the common good, while Valorum was essentially powerless against them. With both the Senate and Valorum closed off to her as options, Palpatine offered her two choices: she could move for a [Vote of No Confidence](/wiki/Vote_of_No_Confidence "Vote of No Confidence") in Chancellor Valorum, and push for the election of a more effective leader; or she could take the matter to the courts, which would take even longer. Hoping still to reach some resolution to the matter in the Senate, Amidala opted to attend the special session of the body the next day.[[1]](#cite_note-Episode_I-1)

 [![Faced with a growing crisis on Naboo, Amidala heeded Palpatine's advice, calling for stronger leadership in the Senate.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/ef/Amidalabeforesenate.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20111008200123) [![Faced with a growing crisis on Naboo, Amidala heeded Palpatine's advice, calling for stronger leadership in the Senate.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/ef/Amidalabeforesenate.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20111008200123)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/ef/Amidalabeforesenate.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20111008200123) 

Faced with a growing crisis on Naboo, Amidala heeded Palpatine's advice, calling for stronger leadership in the Senate.

 

During the awaited Senate session, Amidala attempted to make her case for Republic intervention to stop the Trade Federation's occupation of her world. However, the Federation representative [Lott Dod](/wiki/Lott_Dod "Lott Dod") fervently objected to the "accusations" levied against the Federation, citing that there was no proof that an invasion or occupation had even occurred. He recommended that a commission be sent to Naboo to ascertain the truth of the situation, a motion that was seconded by the senator from [Malastare](/wiki/Malastare "Malastare"), [Aks Moe](/wiki/Aks_Moe "Aks Moe"). [Vice Chair](/wiki/Vice_Chair "Vice Chair") [Mas Amedda](/wiki/Mas_Amedda "Mas Amedda") conferred quietly with Valorum for a few moments, and Palpatine took the opportunity to predict that the Chancellor, shackled to Senatorial procedure at the behest of bureaucrats who were more than likely on the payroll of the Federation, would fail to help Naboo. When Valorum reluctantly admitted that the Federation was within their rights to request a commission, an outraged Amidala realized that Palpatine was right; Valorum was too weak and ineffectual to provide her world with the help it needed. As such, she took Palpatine's advice and publicly moved for a Vote of No Confidence in the Chancellor. Within moments, hundreds of Senators began demanding for an immediate vote, leaving Valorum thunderstruck.[[1]](#cite_note-Episode_I-1)

The sudden power vacuum led to Palpatine's nomination as Supreme Chancellor alongside [Bail Antilles](/wiki/Bail_Antilles "Bail Antilles") of [Alderaan](/wiki/Alderaan "Alderaan") and [Ainlee Teem](/wiki/Ainlee_Teem "Ainlee Teem") of Malastare. When he announced his nomination to Amidala, however, the queen declared her intention to return to Naboo and reclaim it from the Trade Federation by whatever means she could. Palpatine made a show of concern and tried halfheartedly to convince her to stay on Coruscant. She left regardless, taking both Jinn and Kenobi with her for protection and wishing Palpatine success in the [election](/wiki/Supreme_Chancellor_election,_32_BBY "Supreme Chancellor election, 32 BBY").[[1]](#cite_note-Episode_I-1)

#### Battle of Naboo

:   "*Wipe them out.* All *of them.*"
:   ―Darth Sidious, to Nute Gunray[[1]](#cite_note-Episode_I-1)

 [![Sidious ordered the Trade Federation to eradicate the Gungan army upon learning of their alliance with Queen Amidala.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/52/Sidious_hologram.png/revision/latest?cb=20200921210616) [![Sidious ordered the Trade Federation to eradicate the Gungan army upon learning of their alliance with Queen Amidala.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/52/Sidious_hologram.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20200921210616)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/52/Sidious_hologram.png/revision/latest?cb=20200921210616) 

Sidious ordered the Trade Federation to eradicate the Gungan army upon learning of their alliance with Queen Amidala.

 

Sidious contacted the Neimoidians on Naboo, instructing them to kill Amidala upon arrival, and sent Maul to accompany them with orders to make certain the Neimoidians killed the queen, and that the Jedi fell by his own hand. Even while he managed the election on Coruscant, he made time to go over the Neimoidians' progress. Against his expectations, he learned that Amidala not only managed to escape Gunray's reach but also forged an alliance with the [Gungans](/wiki/Gungan "Gungan") and assembled an [army](/wiki/Gungan_Grand_Army "Gungan Grand Army") in the planet swamp in preparation for a strike against the Federation occupation force. He doubted she would last even five minutes in such a contest, and gave his approval to Gunray's plan to [meet](/wiki/Battle_of_Naboo "Battle of Naboo") the Gungans head-on.[[1]](#cite_note-Episode_I-1)

#### Confrontation in the LiMerge Power building

:   "*Sifo-Dyas, Kamino, the clones. I have betrayed everyone and everything I know.*"  
    "*No, you have been loyal to a greater cause.*"  
    "*How many have died because of my actions?*"  
    "*Such is the price of freedom.*"
:   ―Dooku and Darth Sidious[[69]](#cite_note-The_Sith_Lord-69)

However, the Federation army was defeated, Gunray was captured by Amidala's forces, and Maul met his presumed death at the hands of the Jedi Obi-Wan Kenobi, though not before striking down Qui-Gon Jinn. Darth Sidious showed no remorse towards the Zabrak warrior and prepared to take on a new Sith apprentice to advance in his plans. Having learned of Jinn's death, [Count](/wiki/Count "Count") Dooku traveled to their meeting place, the LiMerge Power Building in the Works, to confront Sidious, infuriated that his ally's schemes had resulted in the death of his former apprentice.[[69]](#cite_note-The_Sith_Lord-69)

 [![Count Dooku met with Darth Sidious on Coruscant, where his alliance with the Sith Lord would be discovered by Jedi Master Yaddle.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/7e/Sidious_Watches_Dooku_Yaddle_Duel.png/revision/latest?cb=20230913023800) [![Count Dooku met with Darth Sidious on Coruscant, where his alliance with the Sith Lord would be discovered by Jedi Master Yaddle.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/7e/Sidious_Watches_Dooku_Yaddle_Duel.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20230913023800)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/7e/Sidious_Watches_Dooku_Yaddle_Duel.png/revision/latest?cb=20230913023800) 

Count Dooku met with Darth Sidious on Coruscant, where his alliance with the Sith Lord would be discovered by Jedi Master Yaddle.

 

As Dooku accused Sidious of making him betray everything and everyone he had known, Sidious affirmed that Dooku's actions had been in the service of a greater good, and the galaxy required sacrifices in order to be remade. Dooku pondered that Qui-Gon Jinn could have been a powerful ally, in which Sidious acknowledged the truth, conceding that it would have indeed been advantageous for Dooku. Despite everything Dooku has done for him, Sidious admitted that he always questioned his loyalty, much to Dooku's disturbance. Defending his commitment, Dooku pointed out that he had carried out every task entrusted to him. Sidious then revealed that even greater demands lay ahead if they were to achieve their goals.[[69]](#cite_note-The_Sith_Lord-69)

Unbeknownst to them, [Yaddle](/wiki/Yaddle "Yaddle") had followed Dooku in secret, and urged Dooku to surrender and help her defeat Sidious. Dooku hesitated initially but then, on Sidious' orders, [engaged](/wiki/Duel_in_the_Works "Duel in the Works") Yaddle in a [lightsaber duel](/wiki/Lightsaber_duel "Lightsaber duel") as a final test of loyalty. In spite of Yaddle's great effort, Dooku's unrivaled dueling capabilities quickly began to overwhelm her. Yaddle called out to Dooku, admitting that the [Jedi High Council](/wiki/Jedi_High_Council "Jedi High Council") had been wrong and informing him that as a result, she had stepped down from her position on the Council. Her last attempt at persuading Dooku failed, and they dueled once more, as Sidious watched and cackled manically.[[69]](#cite_note-The_Sith_Lord-69)

 [![Sidious took Dooku as his new Sith apprentice after the fallen Jedi killed Yaddle.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/a0/Sidious-Tyranus-TotJ.png/revision/latest?cb=20230913024028) [![Sidious took Dooku as his new Sith apprentice after the fallen Jedi killed Yaddle.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/a0/Sidious-Tyranus-TotJ.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20230913024028)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/a0/Sidious-Tyranus-TotJ.png/revision/latest?cb=20230913024028) 

Sidious took Dooku as his new Sith apprentice after the fallen Jedi killed Yaddle.

 

As Dooku knocked Yaddle into the frame of the large doorway, he used the Force to flip the lever controlling the door, which came crashing down onto his former friend. Collapsing in sorrow over what he had just done, Dooku was reassured by Sidious, who congratulated his "friend" and apprentice. To their shock, Yaddle suddenly lifted the doorway off in one final display of her immense Force power. Lying defenseless and exhausted at Dooku's feet, Dooku impaled her with his [lightsaber](/wiki/Dooku%27s_lightsaber "Dooku's lightsaber").[[69]](#cite_note-The_Sith_Lord-69) As Sidious' new Sith apprentice, Dooku adopted the secret name of Darth Tyranus.[[70]](#cite_note-Dooku_DB-70)

Ultimately, Palpatine won the election for Supreme Chancellor, and later attended at the [funeral of Jinn](/wiki/Funeral_of_Qui-Gon_Jinn "Funeral of Qui-Gon Jinn"). Palpatine also learned that the Naboo owed their victory to the unexpected intervention of [Anakin Skywalker](/wiki/Anakin_Skywalker "Anakin Skywalker"), a young, freed slave from Tatooine who was highly attuned to the Force, fueling the belief that he was the [Chosen One](/wiki/Chosen_One "Chosen One") of Jedi prophecy who would bring balance to the Force. After much debate, the Jedi Council decided that Skywalker would be apprenticed to Kenobi as a Jedi. Palpatine personally congratulated the two Jedi during the celebration on Naboo, telling young Skywalker that his career would be watched with "great interest."[[1]](#cite_note-Episode_I-1)

### Further preparations

#### Preparing for war

:   "*They said Master Sifo-Dyas placed an order for a clone army at the request of the Senate almost ten years ago. I was under the impression that he was killed before that.*"
:   ―Obi-Wan Kenobi, to Mace Windu and Yoda regarding the Kaminoans[[13]](#cite_note-Episode_II-13)

 [![Sidious orchestrated the Separatist Crisis to destabilize the Republic, all the while training Darth Tyranus as his new apprentice.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/ac/Sidious_Tyranus.png/revision/latest?cb=20140722221449) [![Sidious orchestrated the Separatist Crisis to destabilize the Republic, all the while training Darth Tyranus as his new apprentice.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/ac/Sidious_Tyranus.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20140722221449)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/ac/Sidious_Tyranus.png/revision/latest?cb=20140722221449) 

Sidious orchestrated the Separatist Crisis to destabilize the Republic, all the while training Darth Tyranus as his new apprentice.

 

Over the next ten years,[[71]](#cite_note-explEPII-71) Supreme Chancellor Palpatine amassed a favorable reputation as a mild-mannered servant of the common good, and the public remained oblivious to his true, insidious persona.[[9]](#cite_note-SWEPalpatine-9)[[13]](#cite_note-Episode_II-13) He kept one of his lightsabers hidden in a statue of[[72]](#cite_note-FF_117_Palpatine-72) [Sistros Nevet](/wiki/Sistros_Nevet "Sistros Nevet"),[[73]](#cite_note-Dok_Den-73) which was coated in [neuranium](/wiki/Neuranium "Neuranium") and thus protected from scans, while the other was kept in an unknown hiding place.[[72]](#cite_note-FF_117_Palpatine-72) As Anakin Skywalker grew older, his relationship with Palpatine deepened; on many occasions, Palpatine lauded Skywalker as the most gifted Jedi he had ever encountered, one who would surpass even Yoda, the [Grand Master](/wiki/Grand_Master "Grand Master") of the Jedi Council. Skywalker, who grew increasingly frustrated with the strict lifestyle of the Jedi under his master Kenobi's guidance, appreciated Palpatine's praise and greatly took to his counsel. In truth, this was all part of Sidious' plan to gain Skywalker's trust and groom him into his eventual Sith apprentice.[[9]](#cite_note-SWEPalpatine-9)[[13]](#cite_note-Episode_II-13)

However, Sidious was well aware that his plan to turn Skywalker to the dark side could not bear fruit for many years to come, and with Maul presumed dead, Sidious needed an apprentice in the interim. As such, he turned to Dooku to fill that role,[[74]](#cite_note-SWEDooku-74) making the former Jedi his interim apprentice under the name Darth Tyranus.[[30]](#cite_note-Secrets_of_the_Sith-30) Sidious and Tyranus gained control of a [behavioral modification biochip](/wiki/Behavioral_modification_biochip "Behavioral modification biochip") that Sifo-Dyas wanted instilled in each clone as a safeguard against [rogue Jedi](/wiki/Dark_Jedi "Dark Jedi"),[[75]](#cite_note-Conspiracy-75) and the two then retooled the chip for Sidious' purpose.[[30]](#cite_note-Secrets_of_the_Sith-30) Subsequently, [bounty hunter](/wiki/Bounty_hunter "Bounty hunter") [Jango Fett](/wiki/Jango_Fett "Jango Fett") was hired as the [genetic template](/wiki/Clone_template "Clone template") for the clone army on Kamino,[[13]](#cite_note-Episode_II-13) and the clones were fitted with the Sith's retooled biochip, the latter containing a [protocol](/wiki/Order_66 "Order 66") that would ensure their total obedience to Sidious when the time came for it.[[30]](#cite_note-Secrets_of_the_Sith-30)

In [26 BBY](/wiki/26_BBY "26 BBY"),[[76]](#cite_note-AoR_Dooku_Year-76) Sidious sent Tyranus to [Sullust](/wiki/Sullust "Sullust") to negotiate with the [SoroSuub Corporation](/wiki/SoroSuub_Corporation "SoroSuub Corporation"). Tyranus soon reported back that a [Jedi Knight](/wiki/Jak%27zin "Jak'zin") was present on the planet. Uncertain as to what the Jedi's purpose there was, Sidious told his apprentice to uncover the reason for his presence and to keep the Jedi from discovering the alliances Count Dooku was forging on behalf of the Sith, ostensibly for Serenno. Tyranus was successful in this endeavor and also covertly eliminated the Jedi, under the guise of helping him investigate the [Kaldana Syndicate](/wiki/Kaldana_Syndicate "Kaldana Syndicate").[[77]](#cite_note-AoR_Dooku-77)

#### Galli and the Contingency

:   "*You will go back to Jakku. The spot there in the dirt where my droids were operating is precious. Not just to me, but to the galaxy at large. It is significant… You will go back there and you will monitor my droids excavating the ground. Then I will send more droids and they will build something there below the ground. I want you to guard this space. Can you do that?*"
:   ―Darth Sidious, to Galli[[19]](#cite_note-Aftermath:_Life_Debt-19)

 [![Sidious discovered Galli, an orphan who grew up to become Gallius Rax, while visiting the frontier world of Jakku.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/59/Jakku_view.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20160402051953) [![Sidious discovered Galli, an orphan who grew up to become Gallius Rax, while visiting the frontier world of Jakku.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/59/Jakku_view.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20160402051953)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/59/Jakku_view.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20160402051953) 

Sidious discovered Galli, an orphan who grew up to become Gallius Rax, while visiting the frontier world of Jakku.

 

In [25 BBY](/wiki/25_BBY "25 BBY"),[[78]](#cite_note-Galli_Date-78) Sidious and his Adviser [Yupe Tashu](/wiki/Yupe_Tashu "Yupe Tashu") traveled to the barren [Inner Rim](/wiki/Inner_Rim_Territories "Inner Rim Territories") planet of [Jakku](/wiki/Jakku "Jakku"), which lay at the edge of the [Unknown Regions](/wiki/Unknown_Regions "Unknown Regions"). After landing his yacht *[Imperialis](/wiki/Imperialis "Imperialis")* in the [Plaintive Hand plateau](/wiki/Plaintive_Hand_plateau "Plaintive Hand plateau"), Tashu ordered a detachment of six droids to begin excavating. The yacht soon left off-world but a local twelve-year-old boy named [Galli](/wiki/Gallius_Rax "Gallius Rax") snuck aboard the *Imperialis*. Sidious sensed his presence and gave the boy the choice of dying or serving him. Sidious then instructed Galli to return to the excavation site and guard it against any intruders. He stressed that intruders should not be allowed to taint the site and ordered Galli to kill them. Sidious then introduced himself on a first-name basis as Sheev.[[19]](#cite_note-Aftermath:_Life_Debt-19)

For the next ten years, Galli guarded the Plaintive Hand excavation site. In [15 BBY](/wiki/15_BBY "15 BBY"), Sidious returned and invited the boy aboard the *Imperialis* this time as a guest of honor. By that stage, work on the [Jakku Observatory](/wiki/Jakku_Observatory "Jakku Observatory") had been completed. Using a game of [Shah-tezh](/wiki/Shah-tezh "Shah-tezh") as an illustration, Sidious explained that his future Galactic Empire could not be allowed to outlive its [Emperor](/wiki/Emperor "Emperor") should he die prematurely. To demonstrate his seriousness, Sidious Force choked Galli. He tasked Galli with executing his secret [Contingency](/wiki/Contingency "Contingency") plan and inducted the boy into Imperial service.[[79]](#cite_note-Empire's_End-79) Galli subsequently joined the [Naval Intelligence Agency](/wiki/Naval_Intelligence_Agency "Naval Intelligence Agency") as a [commander](/wiki/Commander "Commander")[[19]](#cite_note-Aftermath:_Life_Debt-19) and adopted the name Gallius Rax.[[79]](#cite_note-Empire's_End-79)

#### Laying the foundations

:   "*You don't need guidance, Anakin. In time, you will learn to trust your feelings. Then, you will be invincible. I have said it many times, you are the most gifted Jedi I have ever met.*"  
    "*Thank you, Your Excellency.*"  
    "*I see you becoming the greatest of all the Jedi, Anakin. Even more powerful than Master Yoda.*"
:   ―Sheev Palpatine and Anakin Skywalker[[13]](#cite_note-Episode_II-13)

 [![Sidious, as Palpatine, befriended Anakin Skywalker, knowing the young Jedi had the potential to become a powerful Sith.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/2/24/DarthSidiousAndFutureApprentice-ObiWanAnakin3.png/revision/latest?cb=20210623053328) [![Sidious, as Palpatine, befriended Anakin Skywalker, knowing the young Jedi had the potential to become a powerful Sith.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/2/24/DarthSidiousAndFutureApprentice-ObiWanAnakin3.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20210623053328)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/2/24/DarthSidiousAndFutureApprentice-ObiWanAnakin3.png/revision/latest?cb=20210623053328) 

Sidious, as Palpatine, befriended Anakin Skywalker, knowing the young Jedi had the potential to become a powerful Sith.

 

As Anakin Skywalker grew older, the relationship between Palpatine and the young Jedi greatly deepened. On many occasions, the Chancellor attended the boy's training at the [Jedi Temple](/wiki/Imperial_Palace "Imperial Palace"), expressing appreciation for the progress reached by the young Padawan in [lightsaber combat](/wiki/Lightsaber_combat "Lightsaber combat"). Seeing that the boy was deeply conditioned by his emotions, Palpatine asked Master Mace Windu to send Skywalker to him, saying he could help with the boy's formation.[[80]](#cite_note-O&A_I-80) When Skywalker arrived in the company of his Master Obi-Wan Kenobi, Palpatine asked to be accompanied by Skywalker for an errand in the lower levels of Coruscant. Dismissing Master Kenobi's reminder that Skywalker was not yet a Jedi and dangers could lie ahead, the Chancellor brought Skywalker to [Level 2685](/wiki/Level_2685 "Level 2685"). Both disguised as travellers, Palpatine told the youth that he himself frequented the area when his duties permitted it—to try to do some good. Eventually, the duo arrived at [Club Kasakar](/wiki/Club_Kasakar "Club Kasakar").[[81]](#cite_note-O&A_II-81)

There, Palpatine expressed some form of envy in the life of young Jedi Padawans, that was already decided from an early age, in difference with his political life, one of troubling choices and difficult decisions. He also explained that the Club was full of Senators. In particular, he pointed out Senator [Colandrus](/wiki/Colandrus "Colandrus"), a [Tarsunt](/wiki/Tarsunt "Tarsunt") who often went there for gambling. While the Tarsunt senator was betting at a game table, Palpatine said that Colandrus was corrupt, but there were no proofs of it. Inspired by the unflattering description, Anakin used Jedi [telekinesis](/wiki/Telekinesis "Telekinesis") to rig Colandrus' last [die](/wiki/Chance_cube "Chance cube"), making him lose large sums of [money](/wiki/Galactic_Credit_Standard "Galactic Credit Standard"). Hearing the disguised Palpatine laugh at his misfortune, Colandrus sicced his [bodyguard](/wiki/Bodyguard "Bodyguard") on him, but the Chancellor defused the situation by explaining that "his son" had just made a joke, and promised that they would leave at once. Still unconvinced, Colandrus nevertheless allowed the cloaked nuisances to go freely.[[82]](#cite_note-O&A_III-82)

 [![Skywalker's potential convinced Palpatine that the young Padawan could become the greatest of all the Jedi.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/2/22/Sith_to_be.png/revision/latest?cb=20230517194529) [![Skywalker's potential convinced Palpatine that the young Padawan could become the greatest of all the Jedi.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/2/22/Sith_to_be.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20230517194529)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/2/22/Sith_to_be.png/revision/latest?cb=20230517194529) 

Skywalker's potential convinced Palpatine that the young Padawan could become the greatest of all the Jedi.

 

Once the duo returned back to the Chancellor's office, Palpatine "apologized" to Anakin for involving him in a Senate matter. Anakin said the Jedi could arrest Senator Colandrus, but Palpatine replied that the Jedi were not required to obey him because if they did, he would be like a dictator and that wasn't his wish. He also told the boy not to talk about what had happened to them with his masters and further asked if Anakin was happy in the temple. When the Padawan answered positively, Palpatine felt the truth of it through the Force. Eventually, Palpatine thanked him for his decisive role in the Battle of Naboo, and said there would always be a place for Anakin near him, and that he could make extraordinary use of a young man like Anakin.[[83]](#cite_note-O&A_IV-83)

Palpatine continued to act as a confidant to Skywalker, providing guidance to the young Padawan who trained to become a true Jedi.[[13]](#cite_note-Episode_II-13) Skywalker was grateful to Palpatine, and viewed the chancellor as a mentor as well as a friend.[[12]](#cite_note-Episode_III-12) In private, Palpatine expressed to Skywalker his confidence in him, including his belief that Skywalker's power would eventually eclipse the combined strength of the Jedi Order, including Grand Master Yoda.[[13]](#cite_note-Episode_II-13)

### The Clone Wars

#### Early campaigns

##### Separatist crisis

:   "*I love democracy. I love the Republic. The power you give me I will lay down when this crisis has abated. And as my first act with this new authority, I will create a grand army of the Republic to counter the increasing threats of the separatists.*"
:   ―Sheev Palpatine[[13]](#cite_note-Episode_II-13)

 [![Sidious' public façade required him to work with the leaders of the Jedi Order, the ancient enemies of the Sith.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/6e/Chancellors_Office.png/revision/latest?cb=20161015185023) [![Sidious' public façade required him to work with the leaders of the Jedi Order, the ancient enemies of the Sith.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/6e/Chancellors_Office.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20161015185023)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/6e/Chancellors_Office.png/revision/latest?cb=20161015185023) 

Sidious' public façade required him to work with the leaders of the Jedi Order, the ancient enemies of the Sith.

 

Under Sidious' direction, Tyranus rallied several thousand solar systems into declaring independence from the Galactic Republic, [instead joining](/wiki/Separatist_Crisis "Separatist Crisis") the [Confederacy of Independent Systems](/wiki/Confederacy_of_Independent_Systems "Confederacy of Independent Systems") with himself as its leader.[[13]](#cite_note-Episode_II-13) Two years after the Confederacy [was founded](/wiki/Raxus_Address "Raxus Address"),[[48]](#cite_note-Rise-48) civil war seemed to be imminent and the Jedi's numbers were too few to maintain galactic peace. The Senate pushed for a vote to [create](/wiki/Military_Creation_Act "Military Creation Act") a [Grand Army of the Republic](/wiki/Grand_Army_of_the_Republic "Grand Army of the Republic"). Keeping his true motives a secret,[[13]](#cite_note-Episode_II-13) Palpatine resisted all of the Senate's attempts to create an army and the push to go to war with the Confederacy.[[84]](#cite_note-Catalyst:_A_Rogue_One_Novel-84) Around [23 BBY](/wiki/23_BBY "23 BBY"),[[85]](#cite_note-23Date-85) Dooku's sister [Jenza](/wiki/Jenza "Jenza"), who had become aware of his dealings with Sidious but only knew him as "the hooded man," urged her brother to abandon his plans, warning him that Sidious was corrupting him. Dooku instead ordered his assassin and apprentice [Asajj Ventress](/wiki/Asajj_Ventress "Asajj Ventress"), who at that time was unaware of Sidious's existence, to kill his sister, which she reluctantly followed through with.[[46]](#cite_note-Dooku_Jedi_Lost-46)

In [22 BBY](/wiki/22_BBY "22 BBY"),[[2]](#cite_note-Timelines-2) after arriving on Coruscant to vote on the creation of an army, former Queen Padmé Amidala—by that time the Senator of Naboo—narrowly avoided an [assassination attempt](/wiki/Plot_to_assassinate_Senator_Amidala "Plot to assassinate Senator Amidala") carried out by [Zam Wesell](/wiki/Zam_Wesell "Zam Wesell") on behalf of the vengeful Nute Gunray. Palpatine had the vote delayed and placed the senator under the protection of Obi-Wan Kenobi and Anakin Skywalker, her old allies from the Battle of Naboo.
