The Emperor made haste to Mustafar, accompanied by[[12]](#cite_note-Episode_III-12) a [squad](/wiki/Thire%27s_squad "Thire's squad") of the best shock troopers under the authority of Commander [Thire](/wiki/Thire "Thire").[[149]](#cite_note-HC_38-149) On planet, he found that Vader had been dismembered, horrifically burned, and left for dead by Obi-Wan Kenobi after the conclusion of their duel. He ordered the clones accompanying him to prepare a medical capsule for his apprentice. As they left to obey his instructions, the Emperor crouched beside his fallen apprentice, determined to find a way to keep him alive.[[12]](#cite_note-Episode_III-12)

The Emperor was keenly aware that, without Vader, the foundations of his newfound power would be badly shaken; he needed an apprentice capable of ensuring that his Empire would survive the inevitable challenges that would rise up against it. To make certain that Vader would be capable of remaining a powerful apprentice, the Emperor contacted the boldest scientists he could, those whose practices would have been frowned on by the Jedi and the Republic. Among these scientists was an expert in [cybernetics](/wiki/Cybernetics "Cybernetics") named Doctor [Cylo](/wiki/Cylo "Cylo").[[150]](#cite_note-Darth_Vader_20-150)

The Emperor brought Vader to the Grand Medical Facility, far above Coruscant's surface as a storm raged across the capital. A strenuous night followed during which the scientists, their droids and their technology worked to save the critically injured Vader before he died. The new Sith apprentice was kept awake for the whole procedure, feeling the pain that came with saving his life.[[12]](#cite_note-Episode_III-12) Cylo and the other scientists[[150]](#cite_note-Darth_Vader_20-150) designed a suit of [armor](/wiki/Darth_Vader%27s_armor "Darth Vader's armor") that would protect his weakened body and allow his scorched lungs to breathe. Cybernetic limbs were added to replace the legs and the arm that Kenobi had taken.[[12]](#cite_note-Episode_III-12)

 [![Returning to Coruscant, Sidious had Vader rebuilt with cybernetic and life support technology.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/8a/VaderSidious-ROTS.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20200826090849) [![Returning to Coruscant, Sidious had Vader rebuilt with cybernetic and life support technology.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/8a/VaderSidious-ROTS.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20200826090849)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/8a/VaderSidious-ROTS.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20200826090849) 

Returning to Coruscant, Sidious had Vader rebuilt with cybernetic and life support technology.

 

After what the Emperor would call a "long night,"[[150]](#cite_note-Darth_Vader_20-150) Skywalker was surgically reconstructed as a cyborg and encased in the armor and mask that would forever hide away who he had once been from the galaxy. As the procedure ended and the Sith apprentice rose, the Emperor approached him. Vader's first query was to know whether or not his wife was safe. The Emperor told him that he had killed Amidala in his anger. This final loss sent Vader over the edge of pure wrath and anguish, completing his transition into the apprentice Sidious had spent decades grooming. In his rage, Vader used his new limbs to tear away the restraints that held him to the operating table and the Force to destroy the droids who had just saved his life, before stepping unsteadily onto his new legs and screaming his despair to the galaxy as a satisfied Sidious looked on with a devilish smile. Having Force choked Amidala on Mustafar,[[12]](#cite_note-Episode_III-12) Vader remembered that he had, indeed, attacked his wife and thus believed the Emperor's claim that he had killed her.[[141]](#cite_note-Certain_POV_193-141)

Vader then turned his rage onto the Emperor, throwing him into the wall of the operating room with the Force. He angrily berated his master for promising that he could save his wife from death. The Emperor conceded that he had failed him in that regard but countered that, with her death, Amidala had given him something so much stronger: pain. This pain would fuel his power for decades and make him the dreaded Sith apprentice that Sidious had always coveted. It would also allow him to live. After a tense few moments, Vader released his master and proclaimed that he would live. Satisfied, the Emperor then assaulted Vader with Force lightning, pointing out his apprentice's lack of a lightsaber. Afterward, Sidious warned Vader never to use the Force against him in such a way again, or he would finish what Kenobi would not.[[147]](#cite_note-Dark_Lord_1-147)

Believing he had killed his wife[[141]](#cite_note-Certain_POV_193-141) and accepting Sidious's claim that the pain it brought him was a gift that would usher in his new life,[[147]](#cite_note-Dark_Lord_1-147) Vader invested himself entirely in Sidious, just as the Sith Lord had hoped. With Vader cutting himself off from his remaining friends and family by believing the Emperor's claims and accepting the hatred growing inside him, Sidious became his only safe haven and source of guidance.[[141]](#cite_note-Certain_POV_193-141) Further, Sidious elected to maintain the illusion of friendship between them both for at least the time being. Meanwhile, having demonstrated his apprentice's need for a new lightsaber, Sidious showed Vader a [ceremony](/wiki/Celebration_marking_the_eradication_of_the_Jedi_Order "Celebration marking the eradication of the Jedi Order") during which many of the weapons looted from the Jedi Temple were incinerated. Sidious also explained the red color of [Sith lightsabers](/wiki/Sith_lightsaber "Sith lightsaber"), obtained through the process of [bleeding](/wiki/Bleeding "Bleeding") a kyber crystal taken from a slain Jedi. He then dispatched Vader to obtain one for himself. Vader proceeded to hunt down and kill Jedi Master [Kirak Infil'a](/wiki/Kirak_Infil%27a "Kirak Infil'a") on [Al'doleem](/wiki/Al%27doleem "Al'doleem"), taking his [lightsaber](/wiki/Kirak_Infil%27a%27s_lightsaber "Kirak Infil'a's lightsaber"). At Sidious' direction, he returned to Mustafar, bleeding his new crystal there in a [dark side cave](/wiki/Sith_cave "Sith cave"). Sidious was in the middle of a meeting with Wilhuff Tarkin when a battle-damaged Vader returned, bursting into the room and presenting the new weapon to his master.[[147]](#cite_note-Dark_Lord_1-147)[[151]](#cite_note-Dark_Lord_4-151)[[152]](#cite_note-Dark_Lord_5-152)

#### Personal and political projects

##### Search for ultimate power

:   "*For a Sith Lord craves absolute power, and nothing will stop me from attaining it. Not even death itself.*"
:   ―Darth Sidious[[30]](#cite_note-Secrets_of_the_Sith-30)

 [![Sidious converted the Jedi Temple into the Imperial Palace, his official residence on Coruscant.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/5b/ThrawnMeetsPalpatine-Thrawn1.png/revision/latest?cb=20180218044823) [![Sidious converted the Jedi Temple into the Imperial Palace, his official residence on Coruscant.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/5b/ThrawnMeetsPalpatine-Thrawn1.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20180218044823)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/5b/ThrawnMeetsPalpatine-Thrawn1.png/revision/latest?cb=20180218044823) 

Sidious converted the Jedi Temple into the Imperial Palace, his official residence on Coruscant.

 

After the creation of his Sith Empire, Sidious established himself in the old Jedi Temple on Coruscant,[[15]](#cite_note-Tarkin-15) transforming the most famous of the Jedi Order's temples[[153]](#cite_note-Secrets_of_the_Jedi-153) into his Imperial Palace. The Jedi had built the palace atop an ancient [Sith shrine](/wiki/Shrine_in_the_Depths "Shrine in the Depths"), in order to neutralize and cap the dark power that sprang from its depths. Sidious entrusted the reopening and restoration of the ancient temple to droids under the supervision of [11-4D](/wiki/11-4D "11-4D"), a protocol droid inherited from Darth Plagueis.[[15]](#cite_note-Tarkin-15)

Secure in power as Emperor of the galaxy, Sidious pursued his obsession with immortality;[[8]](#cite_note-TSWB-8) leaving the bureaucratic work of the government to his followers, which further allowed Sidious to enjoy ruling the galaxy without concerning himself with the more boring aspects of administration,[[154]](#cite_note-Rewind_of_the_Jedi-154) he mostly withdrew from the public eye to probe the secrets of the dark side and study his Sith arcana extensively to unlock the ability to live forever. He prepared the ancient Sith world of Exegol, constructing a base of power within the [Sith Citadel](/wiki/Sith_Citadel "Sith Citadel") located on the surface, planning to claim the ancient throne of the Sith as his permanent seat of power. His loyal cult following, the [Sith Eternal](/wiki/Sith_Eternal "Sith Eternal"), began to experiment with technology and genetic cloning science to expand his lifespan. Exegol was also home to his most promising experimentations within a [vergence](/wiki/Vergence "Vergence") of the Force.[[8]](#cite_note-TSWB-8)

 [![With the Empire established, Sidious concentrated on achieving his goal of immortality through the power of the dark side.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/0b/UnlimitedPower-2020DarthVader11.png/revision/latest?cb=20210623042250) [![With the Empire established, Sidious concentrated on achieving his goal of immortality through the power of the dark side.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/0b/UnlimitedPower-2020DarthVader11.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20210623042250)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/0b/UnlimitedPower-2020DarthVader11.png/revision/latest?cb=20210623042250) 

With the Empire established, Sidious concentrated on achieving his goal of immortality through the power of the dark side.

 

The planet [Byss](/wiki/Byss "Byss") in the [Deep Core](/wiki/Deep_Core "Deep Core") was of great importance to Palpatine.[[155]](#cite_note-BTM_36-155) Ultimately, Palpatine's true goal was for the [Death Star](/wiki/Death_Star "Death Star") to take over as the symbol of fear that would keep the galaxy in line, giving himself and Vader the freedom to pursue the deepest secrets of the dark side. Beyond simple immortality, Sidious sought the power to [alter reality](/wiki/Alter_Reality "Alter Reality") itself and bring every living being under his dark control.[[15]](#cite_note-Tarkin-15) As such, he was searching for immortality only as a way to prevent anything, even death itself, from standing between himself and ultimate power.[[30]](#cite_note-Secrets_of_the_Sith-30)

Over many years, Sidious sent explorers to unmapped regions of space to search for the source of the dark side, believing it lay there. These explorers built communication stations and [labs](/wiki/Laboratory "Laboratory") on distant moons and asteroids.[[156]](#cite_note-Aftermath-156) As part of his planned Contingency, Sidious had Imperial scouts explore the Unknown Regions while also utilizing extensive resources to seed laboratories, shipyards, and observatories within that same region. This arrangement would continue over a period of decades and would be known solely by him and the elect.[[156]](#cite_note-Aftermath-156)[[157]](#cite_note-TLJ_Expanded_Edition-157)

##### Unnatural fatherhood

:   "*Using a technique known as Strand-Casting, countless modified clone bodies were produced from my genetic template. All but one of them were utter failures. The lone subject that survived the cloning process lacked any connection to the Force. I rejected this useless creature, but I chose to let it live. Even if this 'son' was undeserving of my legacy, I surmised that the Palpatine blood rushing through its veins might someday become useful.*"
:   ―Darth Sidious[[30]](#cite_note-Secrets_of_the_Sith-30)

 [![Born through his genetic experiments on Exegol, Palpatine's "son" was a strandcast cloned from his genetic template, who failed to inherit the force-sensitivity of his "father](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/ad/DathanBestoonLegacy-TROS.png/revision/latest?cb=20211020233020) [![Born through his genetic experiments on Exegol, Palpatine's "son" was a strandcast cloned from his genetic template, who failed to inherit the force-sensitivity of his "father](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/ad/DathanBestoonLegacy-TROS.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20211020233020)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/ad/DathanBestoonLegacy-TROS.png/revision/latest?cb=20211020233020) 

Born through his genetic experiments on Exegol, Palpatine's "son" was a strandcast cloned from his genetic template, who failed to inherit the force-sensitivity of his "father."

 

The Sith Eternal utilized a method of cloning known as Strand-Casting[[30]](#cite_note-Secrets_of_the_Sith-30) in addition to modified Kaminoan cloning technology,[[21]](#cite_note-A_Family_at_War-21) producing countless modified cloned bodies of Sidious' original in the attempt to give him a vessel worthy of containing and preserving his essence, so he could ultimately obtain immortality.[[30]](#cite_note-Secrets_of_the_Sith-30) In [12 BBY](/wiki/12_BBY "12 BBY"),[[158]](#cite_note-Dathan_birth_date-158) the [only survivor](/wiki/Dathan "Dathan") of this process,[[30]](#cite_note-Secrets_of_the_Sith-30) that grew and aged normally, was created.[[159]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith-159) Designed and assembled from Sidious' clone tissue samples and other donated blood cells,[[21]](#cite_note-A_Family_at_War-21) the artificial construct[[8]](#cite_note-TSWB-8) was thriving in health[[5]](#cite_note-TROS_Expanded_Edition-5) and had the Palpatine bloodline rushing through his veins.[[30]](#cite_note-Secrets_of_the_Sith-30) The unnamed strandcast[[159]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith-159) was the Dark Lord's "son."[[5]](#cite_note-TROS_Expanded_Edition-5) The strandcast, not a direct cloned replicate of Sidious,[[159]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith-159) so nor entirely identical in appearance,[[5]](#cite_note-TROS_Expanded_Edition-5) was ultimately be a source of disappointment for Sidious. Sidious was disgusted with the son he sired through science;[[21]](#cite_note-A_Family_at_War-21) the boy possessed no force-sensitivity like his father,[[30]](#cite_note-Secrets_of_the_Sith-30) and Sidious, who relished the powers of the Force,[[21]](#cite_note-A_Family_at_War-21) immediately rejected the "useless creature" that was his son.[[30]](#cite_note-Secrets_of_the_Sith-30) Sidious deemed the boy an example of such "disappointing ordinariness," unable to bare even looking upon him,[[5]](#cite_note-TROS_Expanded_Edition-5) the inferior child spawned from his flesh undeserving of his legacy.[[30]](#cite_note-Secrets_of_the_Sith-30)

But the Sith Lord surmised, that because the boy possessed his blood, he might still produce some usefulness at some point.[[30]](#cite_note-Secrets_of_the_Sith-30) Therefore, Sidious chose to permit his son to continue living, the clone's health providing Sidious the means to continue on his bloodline and possibly yield more promising results for producing a vessel for his spirit through more natural means.[[5]](#cite_note-TROS_Expanded_Edition-5) For this reason, Sidious granted his cloned progeny protection from the Sith Eternal cultists, them being unable to "recycle" him as a failed experiment, and allowing him to live on Exegol.[[159]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith-159) Sidious neglected his son,[[21]](#cite_note-A_Family_at_War-21) ignoring him like the cultists, never naming him, and hardly acknowledging his existence. However, Sidious made his son aware of the Force and its nature as the mystical energy of the galaxy that surrounded all life, particularly the dark side, as well as the Sith who wielded them.[[159]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith-159)

##### The Tarkin Initiative

 [![Sidious had long supported the career of Wilhuff Tarkin, who became a Grand Moff in the Galactic Empire.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/b6/Moff_Tarkin.png/revision/latest?cb=20130208042141) [![Sidious had long supported the career of Wilhuff Tarkin, who became a Grand Moff in the Galactic Empire.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/b6/Moff_Tarkin.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20130208042141)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/b6/Moff_Tarkin.png/revision/latest?cb=20130208042141) 

Sidious had long supported the career of Wilhuff Tarkin, who became a Grand Moff in the Galactic Empire.

 

In his early days as Senator Palpatine, Sidious had closely associated with Wilhuff Tarkin, whom he encouraged to pursue a career in politics after his training with the Judicials was completed. Tarkin went on to become Governor of [Eriadu](/wiki/Eriadu "Eriadu") and one of the Republic's foremost military leaders during the Clone Wars. Sidious had learned of Tarkin's upbringing on Eriadu, where he had been trained in harsh conditions through a brutal initiation in the wild [Carrion Plateau](/wiki/Carrion_Plateau "Carrion Plateau") of his homeworld. Tarkin had been taught to hunt savage creatures and emerged from his training with the belief that only the brutal application of the law and the fear of force could keep beings in line with a central galactic government. Although Tarkin lacked Force-sensitivity, Sidious identified him as one whose mindset was very close to that of the Sith.[[15]](#cite_note-Tarkin-15)

During the early days of the Empire, making a rare public address, Sidious claimed the Empire would do whatever was needed to ensure a lasting reconciliation now that the Clone Wars had ended.[[84]](#cite_note-Catalyst:_A_Rogue_One_Novel-84) At some point during the Imperial Era, Sidious created an Imperial [hunter droid](/wiki/Hunter_droid "Hunter droid") named [M-OC](/wiki/M-OC "M-OC"); additionally the B1 battle droid [R0-GR](/wiki/R0-GR "R0-GR") of the [Freemakers](/wiki/Freemakers "Freemakers") later claimed to have fought Sidious.[[160]](#cite_note-Droidography-160) The [Ehllo family](/wiki/Ehllo_family "Ehllo family") was an influential political dynasty during the Imperial Era, with Palpatine personally knowing Captain [Cerasus Ehllo](/wiki/Cerasus_Ehllo "Cerasus Ehllo")'s [father](/wiki/Cerasus_Ehllo%27s_father "Cerasus Ehllo's father"). As such, Captain Ehllo was able to make a [*Raider*-class corvette](/wiki/Raider-class_corvette "Raider-class corvette"), the *[King's Ransom](/wiki/King%27s_Ransom "King's Ransom")*, into his flagship.[[161]](#cite_note-Sana_Starros_1-161)

##### The Inquisitorius

:   "*My Lord, am I to be Sith?*"  
    "*Oh, no, my child. But you will serve the greater cause.*"
:   ―Iskat Akaris and Darth Sidious[[86]](#cite_note-Inquisitor:_Rise_of_the_Red_Blade-86)

 [![Darth Vader and the Grand Inquisitor led a unit of Jedi hunters, known as the Inquisitorius, in the Emperor's name.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/6f/Inquisitorius-2017DarthVader6.png/revision/latest?cb=20180429025857) [![Darth Vader and the Grand Inquisitor led a unit of Jedi hunters, known as the Inquisitorius, in the Emperor's name.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/6f/Inquisitorius-2017DarthVader6.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/260?cb=20180429025857)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/6f/Inquisitorius-2017DarthVader6.png/revision/latest?cb=20180429025857) 

Darth Vader and the Grand Inquisitor led a unit of Jedi hunters, known as the Inquisitorius, in the Emperor's name.

 

Within his first year as Emperor of the Galactic Empire, Sidious brought to fruition an old idea[[96]](#cite_note-Children_of_the_Force-96) with the formation of the [Inquisitorius](/wiki/Inquisitorius "Inquisitorius"), an [organization](/wiki/Organization "Organization") composed of [dark side adepts](/wiki/Dark_side_adept "Dark side adept") and tasked with hunting down surviving Jedi. The [Inquisitors](/wiki/Inquisitor "Inquisitor") were primarily captured Jedi who had been tortured until they turned to the dark side. However, a few, such as the [the Grand Inquisitor](/wiki/The_Grand_Inquisitor "The Grand Inquisitor") and the [Fifth Brother](/wiki/Fifth_Brother "Fifth Brother"), joined the Inquisitorius of their own accord.[[58]](#cite_note-The_Dark_Side-58)[[162]](#cite_note-Battle_Scars-162) Another was the former Jedi Knight Iskat Akaris, who Sidious spoke to in the Inquisitorius Headquarters on Coruscant, not long after she had received her uniform. He tested her willingness to continue her training in the dark side and made sure she understood that she and her fellow Inquisitors were substantially inferior to him. Sidious was impressed by Akaris' wits, as she had quickly realized that he was a Sith Lord and had by now identified the [agent](/wiki/Heezo "Heezo") he had assigned to help nudge her away from the Jedi over the course of the Clone Wars. He then told her to choose her path carefully before turning her over to the Fifth Brother.[[86]](#cite_note-Inquisitor:_Rise_of_the_Red_Blade-86)

##### The hunt for Jocasta Nu

:   "*She is ancient. Middling in the Force. Barely competent with a lightsaber. And yet, that crone could end everything we are trying to do. For you see, Jocasta Nu knows everything.*"
:   ―Darth Sidious, to Darth Vader[[163]](#cite_note-Dark_Lord_7-163)

 [![Darth Sidious feared the repository of knowledge kept by the Jedi Chief Librarian Jocasta Nu could be used against him.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/1/17/JocastaNu-Db.png/revision/latest?cb=20230812014243) [![Darth Sidious feared the repository of knowledge kept by the Jedi Chief Librarian Jocasta Nu could be used against him.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/1/17/JocastaNu-Db.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20230812014243)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/1/17/JocastaNu-Db.png/revision/latest?cb=20230812014243) 

Darth Sidious feared the repository of knowledge kept by the Jedi Chief Librarian Jocasta Nu could be used against him.

 

Sometime after his duel with Kirak Infil'a, Vader reported to Sidious on the ongoing training of the Inquisitors while also asking why Master [Jocasta Nu](/wiki/Jocasta_Nu "Jocasta Nu") was considered a priority among the list of surviving Jedi. Sidious explained that the threat she posed was that of knowledgeable scholar, one with access to a library of secrets and Force artifacts to rival any other. Additionally, Nu possessed the Jedi catalogue of Force-sensitive children in the galaxy. Sidious emphasized to his apprentice the need to capture her alive, insisting that they could use Nu's knowledge but could not afford to let her fall into the hands of others.

Thus, he ordered Vader to utilize the Inquisitors in his search but to keep the true nature of Nu's threat hidden from them.[[163]](#cite_note-Dark_Lord_7-163) In a later meeting, Vader Force choked an [officer](/wiki/Barokki "Barokki") for giving a poor report until Sidious commanded him to release the man. While he could sympathize with his apprentice's frustration at the lack of Jedi to eliminate, Sidious warned Vader to avoid unnecessary killing of their inferiors.[[164]](#cite_note-Dark_Lord_8-164) Not long after, Vader contacted Sidious to report that Nu had died while attempting to escape his custody, a development Sidious considered regrettable.[[165]](#cite_note-Dark_Lord_10-165)

#### The Imperial military

##### Establishing the hierarchy

:   "*This is Lord Vader. He speaks with my voice. A command from him is as a command from me. Pass this information down to your men. All must understand.*"
:   ―Emperor Palpatine[[166]](#cite_note-Dark_Lord_12-166)

 [![With the Emperor's permission, Vader choked several Imperial officers to death via the Force.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/b4/ChockedOfficers-2017DarthVader12.png/revision/latest?cb=20240112003935) [![With the Emperor's permission, Vader choked several Imperial officers to death via the Force.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/b4/ChockedOfficers-2017DarthVader12.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20240112003935)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/b4/ChockedOfficers-2017DarthVader12.png/revision/latest?cb=20240112003935) 

With the Emperor's permission, Vader choked several Imperial officers to death via the Force.

 

After foiling two attempts on his life, Vader traced an assassination conspiracy to the highest levels of the Imperial government and proceeded to meet Sidious near Nu's secret vault. Despite his apprentice's failure to capture Nu alive, Sidious was pleased with the artifacts recovered from her hoard. In response to Vader's suspicion of him, Sidious took a moment to examine his apprentice's rebuilt [lightsaber](/wiki/Darth_Vader%27s_lightsaber "Darth Vader's lightsaber"), nodding in approval over the change from Kirak Infil'a's original hilt. He then pointed out that he had no need to hire mercenaries to eliminate Vader if he had wanted him dead. Sidious told Vader that dealing with the plot was his own responsibility, warning him that with great power come infinite enemies to destroy.[[166]](#cite_note-Dark_Lord_12-166)

Vader soon identified one of the conspirators, an Imperial officer, and sought the Emperor's permission to make an example to solidify his role in the Empire's hierarchy. Sidious agreed, telling him that he could kill any officer but Tarkin. Later, the Emperor gathered the [Imperial Officer Corps](/wiki/Imperial_Officer_Corps "Imperial Officer Corps"), presenting his apprentice to them and telling them that they were to treat Vader as they would him. Vader then called for the known conspirator and four random officers to step forward, before Force choking them to death in front of the assembly.[[166]](#cite_note-Dark_Lord_12-166)

##### Replacing the clone army

:   "*Perhaps, it is time for a change. Now more than ever, building a strong galaxy requires protection and security. Due to the nefarious actions of Admiral Rampart, and the immediacy of the bill on the floor today, it is my opinion that this legislation is our future. With this momentous act, we shall usher in a new era. Heralded by the Imperial stormtrooper.*"
:   ―Emperor Palpatine, to the Imperial Senate[[167]](#cite_note-Truth_and_Consequences-167)

Around the same time, Sidious saw fit to finally replace the outdated Clone Army with a new conscripted military that would be loyal to him. However, in spite of his power in reality being absolute, he continued using the Senate as a puppet to make it seem that his role as Emperor was not particularly different from when he was Chancellor. Therefore, Sidious relied on people interested in sharing in his power, such as Admiral [Edmon Rampart](/wiki/Edmon_Rampart "Edmon Rampart"): idealistic followers that could serve as scapegoats while furthering the Sith Lord's plans. Governor Tarkin had perceived the clones to be twice as expensive as a proposed new militaristic force and deemed them less capable as tools to keep the order.[[168]](#cite_note-Kamino_Lost-168) Already that year,[[169]](#cite_note-TBB_Date-169) the stage was secretly being set to replace the clones with an army of volunteers and conscripts from across the galaxy. The Kaminoans clung to the fact that their skills as cloners was the only thing of relevance to the Empire. However, their overall use was terminated when Admiral Rampart ordered the destruction of Tipoca City after clearing out it of valuables.[[168]](#cite_note-Kamino_Lost-168)

Following the successful orbital bombardment of Tipoca City, the Empire's official explanation was that the cloning facilities had been sunk down to the oceans by a harsh storm, despite the structures having been built to endure Kamino's extreme climate. By the next year, new legislation of interest to Sidious lay before the Senate: the [Imperial Defense Recruitment Bill](/wiki/Imperial_Defense_Recruitment_Bill "Imperial Defense Recruitment Bill"), a formalization of the Clone Army's decommissioning and the shift to an Imperial Military. Sidious preferred not to deal with the issue directly, having Vice Chair Mas Amedda preside over Senate sessions with Rampart pushing for the bill. A major opponent of the proposed legislation was Senator [Riyo Chuchi](/wiki/Riyo_Chuchi "Riyo Chuchi") who sought to provide missing representation for the clones in the development of the bill. During a Senate session, Senator Organa asked Mas Amedda what the absent Emperor's position on the bill was; the Vice Chair replied that the Emperor preferred to remain neutral, trusting the Senate to act in the best interests of Imperial citizens. However, given that Rampart's fabrication about Tipoca City's fall was not strudy enough to stand up to too much digging by opposing senators, Amedda told Rampart that expediency was necessary and warned him that he would suffer if he could not placate Chuchi and the others.[[170]](#cite_note-The_Clone_Conspiracy-170)

Despite Rampart's efforts to appease his detractors and obfuscate independent investigation, the bill was rejected twice in preliminary hearings, the harshest criticisms being voiced by Senators Chuchi, Organa and Pamlo. When the bill was at last about brought before the chamber for a vote with Rampart having satisfied Chuchi's demands for a fair retirement for the clones, the Pantoran Senator interjected again, bringing forward former Kaminoan Senator Halle Burtoni to testify how Rampart had reappropriated Senate funds designated for Kamino directly into financing his own projects and recruitments. As Rampart attempted to explain this away, Senator Organa entered and played a command log taken from Rampart's own Venator showing the entire Senate how Tipoca City really fell.[[167]](#cite_note-Truth_and_Consequences-167)

 [![With the Emperor's support, the Imperial Senate voted to pass the recruitment bill after learning that clones destroyed the facilities on Kamino.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/c/cd/HoloDestructionTipocaCity.png/revision/latest?cb=20230209175913) [![With the Emperor's support, the Imperial Senate voted to pass the recruitment bill after learning that clones destroyed the facilities on Kamino.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/c/cd/HoloDestructionTipocaCity.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20230209175913)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/c/cd/HoloDestructionTipocaCity.png/revision/latest?cb=20230209175913) 

With the Emperor's support, the Imperial Senate voted to pass the recruitment bill after learning that clones destroyed the facilities on Kamino.

 

Faced with a drastic situation, the Emperor saw fit to finally attend a [Senate](/wiki/Imperial_Senate "Imperial Senate") hearing in person and arose in his Chancellor's podium, which caused the entire [Senate hall](/wiki/Imperial_Senate_Building "Imperial Senate Building") to fall silent as their leader made one of his few appearances since the Empire's foundation. Fraught with overwhelming evidence, the Emperor decided that Rampart's value had ceased and had Mas Amedda direct guards to arrest him. Not allowing this to stop his plans to remove the clones, the Emperor spoke out with the same mannerisms as when he was Chancellor and voiced his surprise at Admiral Rampart's acts of transgression against the Kaminoans. He promised that the admiral would be punished for his treachery.[[167]](#cite_note-Truth_and_Consequences-167)

Now faced with a golden opportunity, the Emperor manipulated the situation to benefit his own position by reminding the Senators that Rampart did not act alone; that the clones aboard the Venators willingly unleashed carnage upon their own home without hesitation. Providing sound argument that security in the galaxy was needed more than ever and recognizing the bill's immediate necessity, the Emperor stated his belief that the Imperial Defense Recruitment Bill was their future. Despite framing this as more of a suggestion than an order, the Emperor displayed how supreme his authority was as the bill was immediately passed.[[167]](#cite_note-Truth_and_Consequences-167)

Although he had presented a compelling narrative, many senators remained skeptical. Nonetheless, Palpatine had made a crucial step in further facilitating his power in the Empire and control over the galaxy, confirming the phasing out of the clone army and eliminating another crucial remnant of the Republic, with only the Senate remaining. The age of the Imperial [stormtrooper](/wiki/Stormtrooper "Stormtrooper") had now begun.[[167]](#cite_note-Truth_and_Consequences-167)

##### Invasion of Mon Cala

:   "*Mon Cala. They may serve well as an example--the price of defiance. The military power of the Empire has grown significantly in these past months. It is time to reveal that strength.*"
:   ―Darth Sidious[[171]](#cite_note-Dark_Lord_13-171)

 [![Sidious sent the Imperial fleet under Tarkin and the Inquisitorius under Vader to subjugate Mon Cala.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/95/MonCalaISDs-2017DarthVader15.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20230330202538) [![Sidious sent the Imperial fleet under Tarkin and the Inquisitorius under Vader to subjugate Mon Cala.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/95/MonCalaISDs-2017DarthVader15.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20230330202538)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/95/MonCalaISDs-2017DarthVader15.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20230330202538) 

Sidious sent the Imperial fleet under Tarkin and the Inquisitorius under Vader to subjugate Mon Cala.

 

Sidious soon chose to demonstrate the power of the revamped [Imperial Military](/wiki/Imperial_Military "Imperial Military") by invading [Mon Cala](/wiki/Mon_Cala "Mon Cala"). Since [Project Stardust](/wiki/Project_Stardust "Project Stardust") was far from complete, he opted to send a task force commanded by Tarkin to occupy the planet. Suspecting that a surviving Jedi had been advising [King](/wiki/King "King") [Lee-Char](/wiki/Lee-Char "Lee-Char"), Sidious sent Vader and the Inquisitorius along to root out and eliminate the threat.[[171]](#cite_note-Dark_Lord_13-171) The ensuing battle ended in an Imperial victory after Tarkin ordered an orbital bombardment which compelled Lee-Char to surrender. At the same time, the Jedi [Ferren Barr](/wiki/Ferren_Barr "Ferren Barr") confronted Vader, revealing that he had helped orchestrate events leading to the Imperial genocide of Mon Cala after having foreseen the role the [Mon Calamari](/wiki/Mon_Calamari "Mon Calamari") would later play in defeating the Empire. Shortly thereafter, Barr was slain by the Sith Lord in a lightsaber duel.[[172]](#cite_note-Dark_Lord_17-172)

Later that same year,[[173]](#cite_note-DVA2_Date-173) Tarkin contacted Sidious when Vader entered the [Scarif vault](/wiki/Scarif_vault "Scarif vault") without authorization to learn more for himself about Project Stardust. Sidious ordered Vader to help Tarkin by rooting out saboteurs whose work was slowing down the project's progress, sending him to Geonosis. He also put Vader under the Governor's command.[[174]](#cite_note-Dark_Lord_Annual_2-174)

##### Visit to Mount Tantiss

:   "*It is imperative that this facility remain hidden and secure. There are many, even within our own ranks, who would consider much of your work an abomination. But they lack the vision we possess. Your brilliance is a great asset to this Empire.*"
:   ―Emperor Palpatine, to Doctor Hemlock[[171]](#cite_note-Dark_Lord_13-171)

 [![Sidious was pleased with the progress Royce Hemlock had made on Project Necromancer.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/4/45/HemlockAdmiresPalps-TBB-SoT.png/revision/latest?cb=20240228103620) [![Sidious was pleased with the progress Royce Hemlock had made on Project Necromancer.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/4/45/HemlockAdmiresPalps-TBB-SoT.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/275?cb=20240228103620)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/4/45/HemlockAdmiresPalps-TBB-SoT.png/revision/latest?cb=20240228103620) 

Sidious was pleased with the progress Royce Hemlock had made on Project Necromancer.

 

Six months after the Senate voted to replace the clone army,[[175]](#cite_note-SoT_Date-175) the Emperor made a surprise visit to the secret [Mount Tantiss](/wiki/Mount_Tantiss "Mount Tantiss") [facility](/wiki/Tantiss_Base "Tantiss Base") on [Wayland](/wiki/Wayland "Wayland") to review the progress Doctors [Royce Hemlock](/wiki/Royce_Hemlock "Royce Hemlock") and Nala Se had made on [Project Necromancer](/wiki/Project_Necromancer "Project Necromancer"). Hemlock gave him a tour of the site, ending with a [tightly guarded chamber](/wiki/Tantiss_vault "Tantiss vault") containing specimens crucial to the project. The doctor stated that with more time and resources, he was confident that they would be able to successfully replicate M-counts. Considering their work of paramount importance, the Emperor assured Hemlock that he would have whatever he required for the project.[[176]](#cite_note-Shadows_of_Tantiss-176)

On the landing pad, en route to his shuttle, the Emperor stressed to Hemlock the need to keep the existence of the base a secret, warning that many beings, even other Imperials, would not look kindly upon the research being performed there. Palpatine then complimented the doctor on his brilliance, with Hemlock responding that, with an appointment to scientific minister, he would be able to bring his abilities to bear upon the entire scientific corps. The Emperor warned him to be patient before departing.[[176]](#cite_note-Shadows_of_Tantiss-176)

##### The Chiss from the Unknown Regions

 [![Sidious gained a talented servant in Mitth'raw'nuruodo "Thrawn," a Chiss officer from the Unknown Regions.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/f/f3/EmperorsThroneRoom-Thrawn1.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20180220134421) [![Sidious gained a talented servant in Mitth'raw'nuruodo "Thrawn," a Chiss officer from the Unknown Regions.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/f/f3/EmperorsThroneRoom-Thrawn1.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20180220134421)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/f/f3/EmperorsThroneRoom-Thrawn1.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20180220134421) 

Sidious gained a talented servant in Mitth'raw'nuruodo "Thrawn," a Chiss officer from the Unknown Regions.

 

During the Empire's reign, Sidious' interest in the Unknown Regions continued. This came to a head when the crew of the *Venator*-class Star Destroyer *[Strikefast](/wiki/Strikefast "Strikefast")*, under the command of Captain [Voss Parck](/wiki/Voss_Parck "Voss Parck"), encountered the [Chiss](/wiki/Chiss "Chiss") known as [Thrawn](/wiki/Mitth%27raw%27nuruodo "Mitth'raw'nuruodo") in [Wild Space](/wiki/Wild_Space "Wild Space"). Many years earlier, Anakin Skywalker told Palpatine of this alien and how they worked together. This alien claimed to have a great deal of knowledge on the Unknown Regions. Thrawn was then brought before the Emperor on Coruscant in order to be questioned. Thrawn told the Emperor of threats lurking within the Unknown Regions and how they might one day find the Empire and offered his military skills. The Emperor then deduced that Thrawn's intentions were to help protect his people from these threats. Thrawn assured the Emperor that his allegiance would be to the Empire. Thrawn then revealed that he had known Anakin Skywalker during the Clone Wars, thus proving who he was to the Emperor.[[177]](#cite_note-Thrawn-177)

For their service, the Emperor promised Captain Parck and his crew rewards. Thrawn however, requested that his translator [Eli Vanto](/wiki/Eli_N._Vanto "Eli N. Vanto") stay with him. The Emperor then asked Thrawn to walk with him outside. In his personal garden, the Emperor told the Chiss of his interest in the Unknown Regions. Thrawn then warned that there was great danger to be found there, however, he assured the Emperor that he would share his knowledge of the Unknown Regions. The Emperor ordered that Eli Vanto would be transferred to Thrawn's side and that they would both undergo training at the [Royal Imperial Academy](/wiki/Royal_Imperial_Academy "Royal Imperial Academy").[[177]](#cite_note-Thrawn-177)

#### Mission to Ryloth

##### An official visit

 [![Sidious and Vader visited Ryloth, the Twi'lek homeworld that the Empire occupied after the Clone Wars.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/c/ca/LessuEmpire-DD.png/revision/latest?cb=20220112030348) [![Sidious and Vader visited Ryloth, the Twi'lek homeworld that the Empire occupied after the Clone Wars.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/c/ca/LessuEmpire-DD.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20220112030348)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/c/ca/LessuEmpire-DD.png/revision/latest?cb=20220112030348) 

Sidious and Vader visited Ryloth, the Twi'lek homeworld that the Empire occupied after the Clone Wars.

 

[Five years](/wiki/14_BBY "14 BBY") after the end of the Clone Wars, [Cham Syndulla](/wiki/Cham_Syndulla "Cham Syndulla"), a war hero who liberated [Ryloth](/wiki/Ryloth "Ryloth") from the Separatist forces during the war, organized and led the [Free Ryloth Movement](/wiki/Free_Ryloth_Movement "Free Ryloth Movement") in order to liberate his homeworld once again, this time from an Imperial military occupation. Sidious summoned the Senator of Ryloth, [Orn Free Taa](/wiki/Orn_Free_Taa "Orn Free Taa"), in order to incorporate the senator into his plan to eradicate the "terrorists." He ordered the [Twi'lek](/wiki/Twi%27lek "Twi'lek") to accompany him and his right-hand man, Darth Vader, for an official [visit](/wiki/Mission_to_Ryloth "Mission to Ryloth") to Ryloth. Once Sidious dismissed Taa, Vader asked him why he couldn't simply wipe out the Senator along with his entire staff, in which the two Sith suspected there were one or more traitors, who provided aid to the terrorist movement. But the Emperor wished to find the roots of the treachery, eliminate them and make of it an example for the entire galaxy. Eventually, he ordered Vader to inform the [Moff](/wiki/Moff "Moff") of Ryloth, [Delian Mors](/wiki/Delian_Mors "Delian Mors"), of the arrival of Senator Orn Free Taa, but not of the two of them.[[178]](#cite_note-LOTS-178)

##### Assassination attempt on the *Defiance*

While on the way to Ryloth aboard the Star Destroyer *[Perilous](/wiki/Perilous "Perilous")*, Sidious instructed the ship to stop at the [Denon](/wiki/Denon "Denon") [system](/wiki/Denon_system "Denon system") for a meeting on the training cruiser [*Defiance*](/wiki/Obedience "Obedience") with several [Imperial Navy](/wiki/Imperial_Navy "Imperial Navy") chiefs to discuss a realignment of the Imperial Naval Academy. Sidious ordered Darth Vader to oversee training exercises conducted by [Commandant](/wiki/Commandant "Commandant") [Pell Baylo](/wiki/Pell_Baylo "Pell Baylo") while the Emperor was in his meeting with the naval chiefs. During one such exercise, Baylo set a [hyperspace](/wiki/Hyperspace "Hyperspace") route that would have crashed the *Defiance* into [Christophsis' sun](/wiki/Christophsis%27_sun "Christophsis' sun"). [Cadet](/wiki/Cadet "Cadet") [Rae Sloane](/wiki/Rae_Sloane "Rae Sloane") and Darth Vader uncovered this assassination attempt and redirected the *Defiance*. Baylo confronted the Emperor, accusing the Galactic Empire of being a hostile force that had taken over the Galactic Republic. Vader killed Baylo, which upset Sidious, who wanted Baylo to suffer as the Navy becomes something he hated and watch as the *Defiance* was decommissioned and turned into "cafeteria trays." Instead, the *Defiance* was renamed *Obedience* as a final jab at Baylo and a not-so-subtle reminder toward Vader to remember his place, and Sidious and Vader re-boarded the *Perilous* and continued on their way to Ryloth.[[179]](#cite_note-Orientation-179)

##### The fall of the *Perilous*

 [![Sidious was the target of assassination plots throughout his reign.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/3/33/EmperorAmused-Orientation.png/revision/latest?cb=20190425003939) [![Sidious was the target of assassination plots throughout his reign.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/3/33/EmperorAmused-Orientation.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20190425003939)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/3/33/EmperorAmused-Orientation.png/revision/latest?cb=20190425003939) 

Sidious was the target of assassination plots throughout his reign.

 

The two Sith and Senator Taa came to the [Ryloth system](/wiki/Ryloth_system "Ryloth system") aboard *Perilous*. When the ship exited from the hyperspace, they found themselves in the middle of a minefield: Syndulla was waiting for them. The Twi'lek wished to eliminate them to strike at the heart of the Empire. However, Sidious was unperturbed by the ambush, having evidently foreseen such an occurrence. When the shields were overwhelmed, Sidious remained on the bridge, while Vader took off with his fighter leading a squadron to deal with a swarm of [vulture droids](/wiki/Vulture-class_starfighter "Vulture-class starfighter"). The former Separatist fighters released thousands of explosive [buzz droids](/wiki/Pistoeka_sabotage_droid "Pistoeka sabotage droid") which further damaged the Star Destroyer. Vader returned aboard the *Perilous* where he met the Emperor and Senator Taa after finding that the Emperor's personal shuttle had been destroyed in the attack. Because he suspected there was a traitor in the Senator's staff, Sidious ordered to isolate them in their own quarters and deny them access to any communications equipment.[[178]](#cite_note-LOTS-178)

In the meantime, a Twi'lek task force reached the ship disguised as a repair team and placed explosive charges in the [hyperdrive](/wiki/Hyperdrive "Hyperdrive") chamber, to trigger a chain reaction. After discovering the sabotage and realizing that the ship was doomed, Vader contacted the Emperor. The Emperor informed Vader that he had prepared a second shuttle either as a contingency or because he had foreseen the destruction of the first shuttle and told Vader to meet him there. However, Vader delayed his arrival by a few minutes in an attempt to find and eliminate the saboteurs. The Twi'lek rebels just barely managed to escape, and so Vader hurried to the Emperor's shuttle, which departed as soon as Vader was aboard. A few minutes later, the *Perilous* exploded. Once in space, the fugitive task force searched for the Imperial shuttle and caught up with it. Vader Force choked the resistance pilot of the pursuing ship through the shuttle viewport. In a desperate attempt to get free from Vader's grasp and to kill both him and the Emperor, the Twi'leks rammed the stolen starship into the Imperial shuttle, critically damaging the latter. Vader attempted to regain control of the shuttle while Sidious remembered they had already been in situations like this. Thanks to the piloting skills of Vader the shuttle crash-landed on Ryloth's surface, in the middle of a forest.[[178]](#cite_note-LOTS-178)

##### Isolated on the planet

:   "*We are all of us, always being tested, my friend. Tests make us stronger, and strength is power, and power is the* point*. We must pass all the tests we face… Or die in the effort.*"
:   ―Darth Sidious, to Darth Vader[[178]](#cite_note-LOTS-178)

 [![Sidious and Vader were stranded on Ryloth with only a few Royal Guards.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/e2/Imperial_Royal_Guards_Unit_Expansion_art.png/revision/latest?cb=20250610121200) [![Sidious and Vader were stranded on Ryloth with only a few Royal Guards.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/e2/Imperial_Royal_Guards_Unit_Expansion_art.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/224?cb=20250610121200)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/e2/Imperial_Royal_Guards_Unit_Expansion_art.png/revision/latest?cb=20250610121200) 

Sidious and Vader were stranded on Ryloth with only a few Royal Guards.

 

Once on the planet surface, Sidious noted with mild annoyance that the landing had been far beneath what he knew Vader to be capable of and that Vader's lapse had left four corpses in the rear compartment of the shuttle. Vader admitted to having been distracted by thoughts of his past and attempted to dismiss it as nothing. Sidious however, was unconvinced, though he shelved the matter and proceeded with Vader into the rear compartment. There, three of the shuttle's occupants, [Sergeant](/wiki/Sergeant "Sergeant") [Erstin Deez](/wiki/Erstin_Deez "Erstin Deez"), his captain, and another member of the [Imperial Guard](/wiki/Emperor%27s_Royal_Guard "Emperor's Royal Guard") had survived the crash, though one was badly injured and unconscious. Vader noted with mild surprise that the Emperor appeared to have been wrong; there were only three corpses in the compartment. One of the conscious guards noted that his injured comrade had not strapped himself in during the landing, and as a result had been thrown about the compartment when the ship had crashed. However, the Emperor, apparently already aware of the semi-conscious guard, had him executed for his stupidity, leaving the fourth corpse he had mentioned earlier.[[178]](#cite_note-LOTS-178)

The survivors exited in the night, and while the two guards who survived were checking the survival kits, Vader asked his master if he was testing him. Sidious answered they were always being tested, and they must pass all tests to gain strength and power. Meanwhile, the guards had activated the generator and the communication array to call for help. At that moment the Sith sensed that two Twi'lek ships were approaching and prepared themselves for a confrontation. The Twi'lek rebel's ships fired upon them, while Vader, immersed in the Force, deflected the laser beams with his lightsaber.[[178]](#cite_note-LOTS-178)

The captain suggested to take cover in the woods, but the Emperor refused and instead, removed his cloak, and ignited his lightsaber. The two Sith spun their red blades, turning every shot back at the ships. When the enemy ships engines were hit and began to explode in flames and smoke, Sidious unleashed a bolt of Force lightning on their hulls and then, with the Force, drove one of the ships to the ground, while Vader did the same with the other. The two freighters exploded, and Vader sent Deez to check for survivors. They realized the rebels had jammed the communication network and that they were hunting for them.[[178]](#cite_note-LOTS-178)

##### Hunted

 [![Sidious fended off a horde of lyleks with Vader's help.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/b5/Lylek-SWGA.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20170214090658) [![Sidious fended off a horde of lyleks with Vader's help.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/b5/Lylek-SWGA.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20170214090658)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/b5/Lylek-SWGA.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20170214090658) 

Sidious fended off a horde of lyleks with Vader's help.

 

They walked for a long time into the depths of the forest. Sidious went forward in the darkness seeing through the Force while testing Vader's loyalty once again until he decided to stop for a while. While the guards were eating, the two Sith began to meditate. The Emperor sensed his apprentice's murderous feelings towards him. When Vader ended his meditation, Sidious told him what he had sensed, but the former Jedi pledged his loyalty to his Sith Master. At that moment, the guards, whom the Emperor had sent away, had returned, pursued by a horde of [lyleks](/wiki/Lylek "Lylek"). The Emperor remained calm, sending torrents of Force lightning against the predators, and began to advance back-to-back with Vader, their lightsabers ignited.[[178]](#cite_note-LOTS-178)

While Vader and the guardsmen held back the advancing lyleks with their weapons, Sidious used the Force to topple trees over the advancing lylek horde. Through the Force, Sidious sensed a tunnel a hundred meters away. The four retreated into the tunnel with the lyleks in pursuit. This tunnel turned out to be the home of the lylek horde, and the four Imperials were forced to fight through hundreds of the creatures. The guards used their blasters and [grenades](/wiki/Grenade "Grenade") while the two Sith Lords used the Force and their lightsabers to fight through the horde.[[178]](#cite_note-LOTS-178)

As they waded deeper into the cave, Sidious realized that the lyleks were herding the intruders towards their queen. At Vader's instigation, the four resolved to kill all their opponents with the Emperor activating his red blade. After a fierce battle with the lyleks, Sidious and Vader found themselves back-to-back. When Sidious asked his apprentice whether he had ever toyed with the idea of letting his Emperor die to fulfill his own ambitions, Vader admitted he had entertained such thoughts but reassured his master it was only for a moment. Sidious accepted Vader's loyalty and the two joined forces to tackle the lylek queen.[[178]](#cite_note-LOTS-178)

Following a savage battle, Vader managed to kill the queen; scattering the remaining lyleks. However, the royal guard captain was killed, leaving only Sidious, Vader, and Sergeant Deez. Based on their battle with the lyleks, master and apprentice quickly surmised that Cham and his rebels were trying to kill them to bring about the Empire's destruction. Having triumphed over the lylek horde, the three Imperials found an opening at the end of the tunnel which led back to the forest.[[178]](#cite_note-LOTS-178)

##### Death and fate

 [![On Sidious' order, Vader slaughtered a village of Twi'leks that provided them with shelter.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/95/Drua_s_village.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20161230174938) [![On Sidious' order, Vader slaughtered a village of Twi'leks that provided them with shelter.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/95/Drua_s_village.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/200?cb=20161230174938)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/95/Drua_s_village.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20161230174938) 

On Sidious' order, Vader slaughtered a village of Twi'leks that provided them with shelter.

 

While Sidious and his companions were traveling through the forest, they encountered a young Twi'lek girl named [Drua](/wiki/Drua "Drua"). Sidious made a move to kill her, but Vader blocked his master's death blow and convinced Sidious that she could lead them to a settlement where they could contact reinforcements. Drua led them to [her village](/wiki/Drua%27s_Village "Drua's Village"), which was home to escaped Twi'lek slaves. When the village head [Narmn](/wiki/Narmn "Narmn") asked for their identities, Sidious introduced himself, Vader, and Deez as "Krataa," "Irluuk," and the Sergeant. Sidious and Vader alone knew that their pseudonyms stood for "death" and "fate."[[178]](#cite_note-LOTS-178)

Sidious warned Vader that his act of mercy towards Drua would cost both her and her fellow villagers their lives. Vader then managed to win over the villagers by offering to repair an ancient communications device. Once Vader had fixed the machine, Sidious ordered Deez to contact Moff Mors; whom he knew to be loyal. After re-establishing contact with the two Sith Lords, Mors took steps to eliminate the Imperial traitor [Colonel](/wiki/Colonel "Colonel") [Belkor Dray](/wiki/Belkor_Dray "Belkor Dray"), who was secretly aiding Cham's rebels. She foiled Belkor's plot to order V-wing fighters to strike Drua's Village and the massed Free Ryloth forces in a nearby quarry. After executing Belkor, Moff Mors sent her forces to rendezvous with Sidious and Vader at the Twi'lek village.[[178]](#cite_note-LOTS-178)

 [![The Empire crushed the Ryloth insurgency under the leadership of the Sith.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/d/de/Lords_of_the_Sith_art.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20150614210642) [![The Empire crushed the Ryloth insurgency under the leadership of the Sith.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/d/de/Lords_of_the_Sith_art.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/200?cb=20150614210642)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/d/de/Lords_of_the_Sith_art.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20150614210642) 

The Empire crushed the Ryloth insurgency under the leadership of the Sith.

 

Cham's forces, unwilling to harm the villagers, fired warning shots so that the villagers would flee the scene of the upcoming battle. The villagers reacted by fleeing to a nearby mine shaft, a sanctuary in time of danger. However, Sidious, Vader, and Deez stood their ground at the center of the village. Before Cham's forces could launch their attack, Moff Mors' forces arrived in two transport vessels and trapped the rebel fighters. With many of the Free Ryloth fighters killed, Cham narrowly managed to avoid capture at the hands of Vader. Under the orders of Sidious, Mors's Imperial forces massacred the surviving Free Ryloth fighters. Following a brief exchange with Cham's lieutenant [Isval](/wiki/Isval "Isval"), Sidious ordered Vader to execute her and then afterward, the surviving Twi'lek villagers hiding in the mine shaft as well, in order not to leave any witnesses. After a brief moment of hesitation, Vader complied with his master's orders and massacred the villagers.[[178]](#cite_note-LOTS-178)

### Growing rebellion

#### Berch Teller's campaign

In 14 BBY,[[180]](#cite_note-Tarkin_date-180) the secret Death Star project was still being constructed above Geonosis and was supplied by a series of marshaling stations. The Empire faced a new threat in the form of [Berch Teller](/wiki/Berch_Teller "Berch Teller"), a former [Republic Intelligence](/wiki/Republic_Intelligence "Republic Intelligence") agent who opposed the Empire. He led a [rebel cell](/wiki/Berch_Teller%27s_rebel_cell "Berch Teller's rebel cell") consisting of survivors and witnesses of the [Antar Atrocity](/wiki/Antar_Atrocity "Antar Atrocity"), a mass crackdown on [Antar 4](/wiki/Antar_4 "Antar 4") following the Clone Wars that had seen the killing of innocent [Gotal](/wiki/Gotal "Gotal") and [Koorivar](/wiki/Koorivar "Koorivar") loyalists. Teller had a special animus for Tarkin, the architect of the Antar Atrocity. He was secretly aided and equipped by [Vice Admiral](/wiki/Vice_Admiral "Vice Admiral") [Dodd Rancit](/wiki/Dodd_Rancit "Dodd Rancit"), the Director of the Naval Intelligence Agency and a rival of Tarkin.[[15]](#cite_note-Tarkin-15)

 [![Tarkin and Vader worked together in service to the Emperor.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/6f/Mission_to_Murkhana.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20141106052208) [![Tarkin and Vader worked together in service to the Emperor.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/6f/Mission_to_Murkhana.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20141106052208)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/6f/Mission_to_Murkhana.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20141106052208) 

Tarkin and Vader worked together in service to the Emperor.

 

Following Teller's [attack](/wiki/Attack_on_Sentinel_Base "Attack on Sentinel Base") on [Sentinel Base](/wiki/Sentinel_Base "Sentinel Base"), the Emperor convened a meeting of his [Ruling Council](/wiki/Ruling_Council "Ruling Council") to discuss the discovery of a cache of communications jammers on the planet [Murkhana](/wiki/Murkhana "Murkhana"). The [Imperial Security Bureau](/wiki/Imperial_Security_Bureau "Imperial Security Bureau") had purportedly discovered the cache and feared that dissidents were planning to disrupt the Imperial [HoloNet](/wiki/HoloNet "HoloNet"); echoing the Separatist [Shadowfeed](/wiki/Shadowfeed "Shadowfeed") broadcasts during the Clone Wars. The Emperor dispatched both Moff Tarkin and Lord Vader to [investigate](/wiki/Mission_to_Murkhana "Mission to Murkhana") the matter. However, this played into Teller's hands and allowed the insurgents to steal Tarkin's corvette *[Carrion Spike](/wiki/Carrion_Spike "Carrion Spike")*, which they intended to turn into a symbol of resistance against the Empire.[[15]](#cite_note-Tarkin-15)

After being briefed about the theft of the *Carrion Spike*, Vice Admiral Rancit suggested that the ship's thieves were the same people who attacked Sentinel Base earlier. In response, the Emperor ordered Rancit to divert Imperial forces in the [Belderone system](/wiki/Belderone_system "Belderone system") to aid Tarkin and Lord Vader. While Tarkin and Vader pursued the insurgents, the Emperor chaired another meeting of the Ruling Council. During the meeting, Rancit advocated diverting more Imperial forces to reinforcing Imperial facilities across the [Perlemian Trade Route](/wiki/Perlemian_Trade_Route "Perlemian Trade Route") and [Hydian Way](/wiki/Hydian_Way "Hydian Way"). The Council also learned that Teller' insurgents had [attacked](/wiki/Attack_on_Lucazec "Attack on Lucazec") the [TaggeCo](/wiki/Tagge_Corporation "Tagge Corporation") mining facilities on [Lucazec](/wiki/Lucazec "Lucazec") and were transmitting [holovids](/wiki/Holovid "Holovid") of their attacks on the HoloNet.[[15]](#cite_note-Tarkin-15)

 [![Having supported Sidious' rise to power, Mas Amedda secured his position in the New Order as the Emperor's Grand Vizier.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/85/Grand_Vizier_Amedda.png/revision/latest?cb=20141001212617) [![Having supported Sidious' rise to power, Mas Amedda secured his position in the New Order as the Emperor's Grand Vizier.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/85/Grand_Vizier_Amedda.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20141001212617)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/85/Grand_Vizier_Amedda.png/revision/latest?cb=20141001212617) 

Having supported Sidious' rise to power, Mas Amedda secured his position in the New Order as the Emperor's Grand Vizier.

 

Following a [skirmish](/wiki/Battle_in_the_Phindar_system "Battle in the Phindar system") in the [Phindar system](/wiki/Phindar_system "Phindar system") between Imperial forces and the stolen *Carrion Spike*, Rancit convinced the Emperor to deploy [interdictor](/wiki/Interdictor "Interdictor") vessels against the insurgents. Grand Vizier Amedda then informed the Emperor that the Murkhana communications jammers had been discovered by an ISB asset tasked with investigating the find by his case officer. Acting on this information, Sidious interrogated the Koorivar [ISB](/wiki/Imperial_Security_Bureau "Imperial Security Bureau") asset [Bracchia](/wiki/Bracchia "Bracchia") and his case officer [Stellan](/wiki/Stellan "Stellan"), who revealed that they had been tipped about the discovery by Naval Intelligence. After viewing the holovid, the Emperor determined that the communications cache had been planted by a high–level Imperial official who was aiding the insurgents.[[15]](#cite_note-Tarkin-15)

Meanwhile, Lord Vader discovered that Rancit was the Imperial traitor and executed him. While Tarkin led Imperial forces against Teller's insurgents in a [space battle](/wiki/Battle_near_the_Gulf_of_Tatooine "Battle near the Gulf of Tatooine") near the [Gulf of Tatooine](/wiki/Gulf_of_Tatooine "Gulf of Tatooine"), Darth Sidious mediated on his quest for galactic dominance. Following the defeat of Teller's insurgency, Tarkin and Vader spent the next three weeks hunting down Teller's collaborators and contacts in a ruthless crackdown. The two briefed the Emperor, who appointed Tarkin as [Grand Moff](/wiki/Grand_Moff "Grand Moff"), in which capacity he would serve as [governor](/wiki/Governor "Governor") of the Outer Rim Territories and stand in charge of the Death Star project. The Emperor also reshuffled the Ruling Council in the wake of Rancit's execution, folded Naval Intelligence back into [Imperial Intelligence](/wiki/Imperial_Intelligence "Imperial Intelligence"),[[15]](#cite_note-Tarkin-15) and established the [Council of Moffs](/wiki/Council_of_Moffs "Council of Moffs").[[40]](#cite_note-Emperor_Palpatine-40)

By 14 BBY,[[181]](#cite_note-Fallen_Order_date_note-181) Sidious had also ordered for [Project Auger](/wiki/Project_Auger "Project Auger") to begin on the planet [Zeffo](/wiki/Zeffo "Zeffo"), which had been home to the [Zeffonian](/wiki/Zeffonian "Zeffonian") before their hubris nearly destroyed them. The project saw Imperial mining begin on Zeffo to locate artifacts. The commanding officer, [Krane](/wiki/Krane "Krane"), kept one uncovered artifact secret in order to win support from Sidious by giving it to him personally. However, she died when the cave she chose to hide it in collapsed.[[182]](#cite_note-Jedi_Fallen_Order-182)

#### A reward for Vader

:   "*I think, one way or another, you will learn a great deal. That is good. After all, your power is my power.*"
:   ―Darth Sidious, to Darth Vader[[183]](#cite_note-Dark_Lord_21-183)

Shortly after [he killed](/wiki/Hunt_for_Eeth_Koth "Hunt for Eeth Koth") Eeth Koth,[[184]](#cite_note-Dark_Lord_19-184) Vader attacked the Thirteenth Sister for committing treason. Confused, her [partner](/wiki/Tualon_Yaluna "Tualon Yaluna") tried to defend her before they both fled Inquisitorius Headquarters across Coruscant. The Sith Lord eventually caught up with the couple and slew them. However, the destruction caused by the chase and resultant death of [Senator](/wiki/Senator "Senator") [Maklooq](/wiki/Maklooq "Maklooq"), who was important to one of Sidious' schemes, led the Emperor to order the Inquisitorius to be relocated. Their [new base](/wiki/Fortress_Inquisitorius "Fortress Inquisitorius") was built on [Nur](/wiki/Nur "Nur").[[185]](#cite_note-Dark_Lord_20-185)[[86]](#cite_note-Inquisitor:_Rise_of_the_Red_Blade-86) Pleased with the death of Koth, Sidious gifted Vader the former royal vessel of Queen Amidala. With few Jedi left to deal with, Sidious was about to send his apprentice on other missions when Vader asked for a world of his own: Mustafar.[[185]](#cite_note-Dark_Lord_20-185) Sidious granted the request but demanded to know why his apprentice had chosen the site of his greatest defeat. Vader explained that he believed that the dark side locus there could give him access to the dead Amidala. Sidious encouraged him, satisfied that whatever knowledge or power his apprentice gained there would ultimately be his. He gave Vader one final gift, the mask of [Darth Momin](/wiki/Darth_Momin "Darth Momin"), before sending him to Mustafar with the architect Colonel [Brenne](/wiki/Alva_Brenne "Alva Brenne") to design a [fortress](/wiki/Fortress_Vader "Fortress Vader") for him.[[183]](#cite_note-Dark_Lord_21-183)

By [12 BBY](/wiki/12_BBY "12 BBY"),[[186]](#cite_note-FortressVaderDate-186) the construction of Fortress Vader was complete, the eight previous versions all having failed in some manner.[[187]](#cite_note-Dark_Lord_23-187) Vader contacted Sidious, who was surprised to hear from him after so long, but eager to send him out on more missions for the Empire. When Sidious asked him if he had learned what he needed, Vader confirmed as much with a simple "yes" and no elaboration.[[188]](#cite_note-Dark_Lord_25-188)

Sometime around or after this,[[189]](#cite_note-KX_Parade_Date-189) the Emperor was present at a parade that included two hundred [KX-series security droids](/wiki/KX-series_security_droid "KX-series security droid"), among them [K2-SO](/wiki/K-2SO "K-2SO").[[190]](#cite_note-Who_Else_Knows?-190)

#### New threats

##### From the past to the present

:   "*I wonder if your thoughts are clear on this, Lord Vader. Perhaps your feelings for your old master have left you weakened. If your past cannot be overcome…*"
:   ―Darth Sidious, to Darth Vader[[191]](#cite_note-Part_VI-191)

 [![Following Darth Vader's defeat by Obi-Wan Kenobi, Darth Sidious counseled his apprentice against allowing his emotions to weaken him.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/76/EmperorPalpatine-OWKpVI.png/revision/latest?cb=20220805050409) [![Following Darth Vader's defeat by Obi-Wan Kenobi, Darth Sidious counseled his apprentice against allowing his emotions to weaken him.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/76/EmperorPalpatine-OWKpVI.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20220805050409)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/76/EmperorPalpatine-OWKpVI.png/revision/latest?cb=20220805050409) 

Following Darth Vader's defeat by Obi-Wan Kenobi, Darth Sidious counseled his apprentice against allowing his emotions to weaken him.

 

In [9 BBY](/wiki/9_BBY "9 BBY"),[[192]](#cite_note-KenobiDate-192) Darth Vader[[193]](#cite_note-Part_II-193) and the Inquisitorius engaged in a [hunt for Obi-Wan](/wiki/Hunt_for_Obi-Wan "Hunt for Obi-Wan") Kenobi, who had been engineered to come out of hiding in order to rescue [Princess](/wiki/Princess "Princess") [Leia Organa](/wiki/Leia_Skywalker_Organa_Solo "Leia Skywalker Organa Solo") of Alderaan.[[194]](#cite_note-Kenobi_Part_I-194) Though the search had been fabricated by the [Third Sister](/wiki/Reva_Sevander "Reva Sevander") to kill Vader, her attempts failed,[[195]](#cite_note-Part_V-195) and Vader and Kenobi engaged in a [lightsaber duel](/wiki/Fight_on_a_barren_moon "Fight on a barren moon") on a [barren moon](/wiki/Unidentified_barren_moon "Unidentified barren moon") as a result. Kenobi bested Vader, damaging his armor in the process, and he managed to evade the Imperials on his tail. Not long after, Vader, whose armor was since repaired, reached out to his master via a hologram at Fortress Vader,[[191]](#cite_note-Part_VI-191) his castle on Mustafar.[[196]](#cite_note-Databank_Vader-196) He informed Sidious he had dispatched [probe droids](/wiki/Probe_droid "Probe droid") to continue the search for Kenobi, adding that he would not evade him once again. Picking up on Vader's agitation, Sidious questioned if Vader's thoughts on the matter were clear, continuing that perhaps has feelings for his former master had left him weakened. As Sidious asked if Vader could not overcome his past, Vader declared that Kenobi meant nothing, for he only served Sidious.[[191]](#cite_note-Part_VI-191)

With the Jedi mostly defeated, Sidious felt secure behind his huge galactic military and dominion over most of the known galaxy. Despite this, remaining Separatist holdouts and surviving Jedi would gnaw at his confidence of the longevity of his new Empire. Seeking to secure the center, the Emperor supported mass military excursions into the Outer Rim Territories in an effort to bring more systems under his fold. With his ultimate goal of bending reality into something of his own creation, an omnipotent Empire would allow all the galaxy's inhabitants to be held in his dark embrace.[[15]](#cite_note-Tarkin-15) Despite the Jedi being all but extinct, Force-sensitive children were still being born across the galaxy. In an effort to combat this threat, Sidious commanded his apprentice, Lord Vader, to contact [the Grand Inquisitor](/wiki/The_Grand_Inquisitor "The Grand Inquisitor") to hunt them down and destroy them if they did not serve the Empire.[[197]](#cite_note-Spark_of_Rebellion-197)

Following the [raid](/wiki/Aldhani_heist "Aldhani heist") on the Imperial [garrison](/wiki/Aldhani_Garrison "Aldhani Garrison") on [Aldhani](/wiki/Aldhani "Aldhani")[[198]](#cite_note-The_Eye-198) in [5 BBY](/wiki/5_BBY "5 BBY"),[[199]](#cite_note-Kassa-199) Palpatine spoke with Colonel Yularen, giving the ISB direct control of operations going forward and the authority to arrest anyone who was considered a disrupter to the Empire. The next day, the Emperor convened an emergency session of the Senate in order to propose a legislative package of bills and amendments and to officially invoke the [Public Order Resentencing Directive](/wiki/Public_Order_Resentencing_Directive "Public Order Resentencing Directive").[[200]](#cite_note-Announcement-200)

##### Targets on Ghorman and Lothal

:   "*I believe the apprentice of Anakin Skywalker lives and is in league with these rebels."  
    "Are you certain?"  
    "It was* her*."  
    "This is an opportunity we cannot let* pass*. Skywalker's apprentice could lead us to* other *lost Jedi.*"
:   ―Darth Vader and Darth Sidious[[201]](#cite_note-The_Siege_of_Lothal-201)

In [4 BBY](/wiki/4_BBY "4 BBY"),[[202]](#cite_note-Andor_2.1_Date-202) the Emperor met with [Director](/wiki/Director_of_Advanced_Weapons_Research "Director of Advanced Weapons Research") [Orson Krennic](/wiki/Orson_Callan_Krennic "Orson Callan Krennic"), stating to him the importance of his energy initiative. The next day, Krennic secretly met with a number of Imperial officials, among them ISB and Navy, off record at the [Maltheen Divide](/wiki/Maltheen_Divide "Maltheen Divide"), putting them in charge of the [Ghorman project](/wiki/Ghorman_project "Ghorman project"): the planned suppression of the [Ghormans](/wiki/Ghorman_(people) "Ghorman (people)") and the heavy mining of the essential mineral [kalkite](/wiki/Kalkite "Kalkite") from the [planet](/wiki/Ghorman "Ghorman"). This operation would be implemented only if no substitute could be found, but in the meantime precursor actions would be taken in case it proved necessary. Krennic stated that this would support the Emperor's dream of energy independence while also reiterating that their circle was to be free of leaks, adding that any violation would be brought to the Emperor's personal attention. Two of the officials present, [Dee Shambo](/wiki/Dee_Shambo "Dee Shambo") and [Nisus Osar](/wiki/Nisus_Osar "Nisus Osar") from the [Ministry of Enlightenment](/wiki/Ministry_of_Enlightenment "Ministry of Enlightenment"), were placed in charge of spreading anti-Ghorman propaganda. ISB Major [Lio Partagaz](/wiki/Lio_Partagaz "Lio Partagaz") was present as was his protégé [Supervisor](/wiki/Supervisor "Supervisor") [Dedra Meero](/wiki/Dedra_Meero "Dedra Meero"), who was secretly placed in charge of running Ghorman while publicly being given a discommendation.[[203]](#cite_note-One_Year_Later-203)

 [![Darth Sidious believed that capturing Ahsoka Tano would give the Empire the opportunity to eliminate more surviving Jedi.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/72/Ahsoka_Tano_hero_profile.png/revision/latest?cb=20160401180850) [![Darth Sidious believed that capturing Ahsoka Tano would give the Empire the opportunity to eliminate more surviving Jedi.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/72/Ahsoka_Tano_hero_profile.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20160401180850)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/72/Ahsoka_Tano_hero_profile.png/revision/latest?cb=20160401180850) 

Darth Sidious believed that capturing Ahsoka Tano would give the Empire the opportunity to eliminate more surviving Jedi.

 

During the fifteenth [Empire Day](/wiki/Empire_Day "Empire Day"), celebrating the anniversary of the Empire's rise to power, the Emperor presided over the Imperial Senate on Coruscant with his Royal Guards, and invited [Lothal](/wiki/Lothal "Lothal") governor [Arihnda Pryce](/wiki/Arihnda_Pryce "Arihnda Pryce") to celebrate with him.[[204]](#cite_note-Empire_Day-204) After the Grand Inquisitor's death at the hands of Kanan Jarrus and his Padawan [Ezra Bridger](/wiki/Ezra_Bridger "Ezra Bridger"), the Emperor dispatched his apprentice to Lothal as an "alternative solution" to the growing rebel problem.[[205]](#cite_note-Fire_Across_the_Galaxy-205) The Emperor was contacted by Darth Vader after he had [defeated](/wiki/Attack_on_Phoenix_Squadron_(4_BBY) "Attack on Phoenix Squadron (4 BBY)") the Rebel fleet in the [Lothal system](/wiki/Lothal_system "Lothal system"). Vader informed his master that he had discovered that his former Jedi apprentice, Ahsoka Tano, still lived. The Emperor was pleased with the news that Tano possibly knew the location of other hidden Jedi believed that capturing her would allow the Empire to find them and destroy them before they became threats. Although Vader was more interested in finding his former Master Obi-Wan Kenobi, the Emperor told his apprentice to have patience and to send an Inquisitor to hunt down Tano and the other Jedi discovered on Lothal.[[201]](#cite_note-The_Siege_of_Lothal-201)

By [3 BBY](/wiki/3_BBY "3 BBY"),[[206]](#cite_note-Andor_2.4_Date-206) anti-Ghorman proganda had proved effective, including the idea that the Ghor were arrogant and mocked Emperor Palpatine.
