However, it had merged with a [droid disc](/wiki/Unidentified_droid_(Fermata_Cage) "Unidentified droid (Fermata Cage)") and the resultant [intelligence](/wiki/Scourge "Scourge") proceeded to possess the droids of the accompanying Star Destroyer and use them to kill everyone aboard.[[271]](#cite_note-Dark_Droids_1-271) At some point that year, Rebel Intelligence confirmed that the Emperor and Darth Vader were aboard the *Executor* somewhere in the Mid Rim.[[272]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_(2020)_28-272) Sometime after, Lady Qi'ra launched a campaign aimed at destroying the Sith: while "[the Archivist](/wiki/The_Archivist "The Archivist")" led a group tasked with unlocking the recently recovered[[269]](#cite_note-Crimson_Reign_5-269) Fermata Cage, secret Crimson Dawn agents across the galaxy were activated and utilized to spread chaos throughout the Empire by such means as espionage, sabotage and assassination.[[270]](#cite_note-Hidden_Empire_1-270)

Around this time, with the aid of the [Eye of Webbish Bog](/wiki/Eye_of_Webbish_Bog "Eye of Webbish Bog") on Mustafar, Vader experienced Force visions the dark side, several of the potential future involving Sidious. In one, Sabé was outfitted in armor similar to Vader's in front of him and the Emperor. In another, Sidious contacted him on Mustafar to inform him that Lady Qi'ra claimed to have the [Fermata Cage](/wiki/Fermata_Cage "Fermata Cage") and sent him to recover it. In a third, Sidious contacted him aboard the *Executor*, revealing that the Fermata Cage was designed by Darth Momin and explaining that it was capable of holding a being in stasis outside of time. In yet another, Sidious was killed by Qi'ra.[[273]](#cite_note-Revelations_(2022)_1-273)

The Emperor soon struck back against Qi'ra, meeting by holocomm with leaders of the major crime syndicates, ordering them to end their war with each other and focus their efforts on Crimson Dawn. Meanwhile, Imperial forces, including [Inferno Squad](/wiki/Inferno_Squad "Inferno Squad") and Lord Vader worked to root out the Crimson Dawn agents while the fleet soon discovered where Qi'ra and her flagship, the *[Vermillion](/wiki/Vermillion_(Crimson_Dawn) "Vermillion (Crimson Dawn)")*, were hiding. The Emperor then spoke with a hologram of Lady Qi'ra, informing her that Vader had described her as formidable. Sidious expressed his regret that she seemed foolish enough to desire the enmity of the Sith. He attempted to chide her, stating that Maul had undoubtedly taught her a healthy fear of the Sith, but Qi'ra retorted that Maul had taught her *many* things.[[270]](#cite_note-Hidden_Empire_1-270)

Sidious dismissed Maul as an idiot and asked what Qi'ra planned to do now that she had his attention. She replied that she would do whatever she had to and when Sidious learned that Qi'ra was at that moment preparing to attack his ships, he told her not to throw away her life, insisting that her capabilities made her of possible use to him. Qi'ra told the Sith that he didn't understand: she didn't recognize his authority. Sidious rejoined that he was disappointed in her inability to distinguish between authority and power, power that he truly held over her whether she accepted it or not. The Sith proceeded to claim that Qi'ra's history was tainted by that of her teacher, Maul, who had never been quite good enough. Sidious declared that just like he had turned away from Maul after finding him lacking, so he was also losing interest in her. Qi'ra remarked that he would see.[[270]](#cite_note-Hidden_Empire_1-270)

At that moment, Sidious felt a disturbance in the Force, one that he knew Qi'ra was in some way responsible for. Unsettled by this, he demanded to know what Qi'ra had done. She repeated that she was doing whatever she had to and mocked his ignorance of the Screaming Key's purpose, revealing that it had unlocked the Fermata Cage. A disbelieving Sidious proceeded to Force choke Qi'ra, claiming that she was lying, but soon released her when she said she was the only way for him to discover the truth. Qi'ra told Sidious that a Sith Lord was suspended inside the Fermata Cage and that Maul had found them, hoping to release the Sith Lord upon Sidious. Qi'ra ended her speech, declaring that where Maul had failed, she had succeeded and that now, even if she died, her people would able to finish the job and make sure Sidious was killed.[[270]](#cite_note-Hidden_Empire_1-270)

Meanwhile, battle had been joined between the *Vermillion* and the Imperial fleet. The Crimson Dawn flagship rammed an [*Interdictor*-class Star Destroyer](/wiki/Interdictor-class_Star_Destroyer "Interdictor-class Star Destroyer"), destroying both as Qi'ra's hologram terminated. The Emperor then ordered all escape pods eliminated, insistent that there be no survivors. Sidious then contacted Vader on Mustafar, and after a brief aside about some minor damage to his helmet, asked him if he had felt the disturbance. Vader stated that he had, describing it as a storm in the dark side. Sidious told him that Qi'ra claimed to have the Fermata Cage and ordered him to retrieve it and kill anyone with knowledge of its existence.[[273]](#cite_note-Revelations_(2022)_1-273)[[270]](#cite_note-Hidden_Empire_1-270) Elsewhere, the bounty hunter Chanath Cha asked Qi'ra if she thought Palpatine realized she was never aboard the *Vermillion*; Qi'ra replied that if he hadn't, he eventually would.[[270]](#cite_note-Hidden_Empire_1-270)

Later, during a mission in [No-Space](/wiki/No-Space "No-Space"), Leia Organa referred to the Emperor as a tyrant and Lando Calrissian stated the strong likelihood that the Rebel Alliance would lose the war with the Emperor having them executed. After they left No-Space, Leia speculated to Luke Skywalker that the [Force Wave](/wiki/Force_Wave "Force Wave") that they had been feeling could prove distracting for the Emperor and Darth Vader.[[274]](#cite_note-Star_Wars_(2020)_33-274)

#### Downfall of the Sith

##### Schemes against the Rebellion

:   "*I wonder if your feelings on this matter are clear, Lord Vader.*"  
    "*They are clear, my master.*"  
    "*Then you must go to the sanctuary moon and wait for him.*"  
    "*He will come to me?*"  
    "*I have foreseen it. His compassion for you will be his undoing. He will come to you... and then you will bring him before me.*"  
    "*As you wish.*"
:   ―Darth Sidious and Darth Vader[[4]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-4)

 [![The Emperor tricked the Alliance into attacking the second Death Star, using himself as bait.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/bb/SidEmp.png/revision/latest?cb=20201008110258) [![The Emperor tricked the Alliance into attacking the second Death Star, using himself as bait.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/bb/SidEmp.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20201008110258)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/b/bb/SidEmp.png/revision/latest?cb=20201008110258) 

The Emperor tricked the Alliance into attacking the second Death Star, using himself as bait.

 

In the months after the events on Bespin, Luke Skywalker would continue to hone his skills in the [light side of the Force](/wiki/Light_side_of_the_Force "Light side of the Force"); nonetheless, Sidious still believed Skywalker liable to turn to the dark side.[[4]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-4)

In an attempt to gain a new Sith apprentice as well as end the Galactic Civil War, Sidious purposely allowed the Rebels to obtain the plans of the new Death Star under construction over the forest moon of [Endor](/wiki/Endor "Endor").[[4]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-4) Following the presumed destruction of a vast majority of the Rebellion in a doomed confrontation against an unknowingly armed and operational Death Star, Sidious planned on commencing the deployment of some of the largest invasion fleets known in galactic history to blockade the known rebel strongholds of [Mon Cala](/wiki/Mon_Cala "Mon Cala") and [Chandrila](/wiki/Chandrila "Chandrila") until the Death Star II could destroy them, permanently ending the Rebellion and all those that would oppose his rule through sheer terror.[[275]](#cite_note-Moving_Target-275)

The Emperor went to the second Death Star intending to oversee the ultimate defeat of the Rebellion and the Jedi, using himself as additional bait to draw the Alliance out. A massive amount of Imperial personnel,[[4]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-4) including two [astromech droids](/wiki/Astromech_droid "Astromech droid"), witnessed their Emperor's momentous arrival[[59]](#cite_note-CVD-59) in [Hangar 272](/wiki/Hangar_272 "Hangar 272").[[276]](#cite_note-Battle_Stations-276) Shortly before his meeting with Luke Skywalker, the Emperor sensed the existence of a mysterious, malevolent force in the farthest reaches of the unexplored regions; he suspected it to be the possible source of the dark side of the Force, but even the Emperor wasn't sure who or what he was sensing.[[79]](#cite_note-Empire's_End-79) He also sensed the death of Yoda, who appeared to him as a Force spirit, much to Sidious' surprise. All the same, he began to gloat about his coming victory until Yoda suddenly vanished.[[277]](#cite_note-Masters-277)

##### Meeting Luke Skywalker

:   "*I'm looking forward to completing your training. In time, you will call me master.*"
:   ―Darth Sidious, to Luke Skywalker[[4]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-4)

 [![Sidious and Vader made plans to crush the Rebellion at Endor, and to ensure that Skywalker turned to the dark side.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/0d/GreejatusAndFriends-ROTJ.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20120113180412) [![Sidious and Vader made plans to crush the Rebellion at Endor, and to ensure that Skywalker turned to the dark side.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/0d/GreejatusAndFriends-ROTJ.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20120113180412)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/0d/GreejatusAndFriends-ROTJ.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20120113180412) 

Sidious and Vader made plans to crush the Rebellion at Endor, and to ensure that Skywalker turned to the dark side.

 

Whilst on the Death Star, Luke Skywalker, [Han Solo](/wiki/Han_Solo "Han Solo"), Princess Leia, and [Chewbacca](/wiki/Chewbacca "Chewbacca") managed to sneak past the shield and land on the Sanctuary Moon. Vader, who had been told to dispatch the fleet to the moon and to remain on a command ship, sensed his son's arrival. Because of this, he journeyed to the Death Star, where he told the Emperor that he sensed Luke's arrival. Surprised that he himself was unable to sense it, the Emperor commanded Vader to go and wait for him, saying that he had foreseen Luke seeking Vader out and surrendering to him personally out of compassion for his father.[[4]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-4)

Shortly after Skywalker and the rebel strike team landed on Endor, the Emperor summoned his secret protégé, Admiral Gallius Rax, for a secret meeting aboard his [throne room](/wiki/Emperor%27s_Throne_Room "Emperor's Throne Room") on the second Death Star. Sensing a [shatterpoint](/wiki/Shatterpoint "Shatterpoint") approaching, Darth Sidious warned Rax that it may soon be time to implement the Contingency. He then ordered Rax to take[[79]](#cite_note-Empire's_End-79) the *Executor*-class Star Dreadnought[[128]](#cite_note-The_Rebel_Files-128) *[Ravager](/wiki/Ravager "Ravager")* into the [Vulpinus Nebula](/wiki/Vulpinus_Nebula "Vulpinus Nebula") and hide until the events of this shatter point had resolved. He also told Rax that there would be others he had to call to his side.[[79]](#cite_note-Empire's_End-79)

Once Luke surrendered, Darth Vader brought his son to the space station and his master's throne room. The Emperor greeted Luke, dismissed the guardsmen and removed his chains. Luke was told that the Emperor planned to turn Luke to the dark side and that all that has happened on the Moon was all his plan. The Emperor also managed to explain that his father was irredeemable and could never be turned from the dark side. Sidious also had a surprise in store for the Rebels. When the Alliance Fleet arrived, the Death Star's superlaser was operational, contrary to what the Rebels had been led to believe. The Death Star was able to destroy several of the command ships, but the Rebels both on the surface and in space managed to press forward with their attack, as Lando was counting on Han to destroy the Shield Generator.[[4]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-4)

 [![Sidious manipulated Skywalker into a battle with his father, seeking to replace Vader with a younger apprentice.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/03/Palpatine_saber_clash.png/revision/latest?cb=20250315235600) [![Sidious manipulated Skywalker into a battle with his father, seeking to replace Vader with a younger apprentice.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/03/Palpatine_saber_clash.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20250315235600)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/03/Palpatine_saber_clash.png/revision/latest?cb=20250315235600) 

Sidious manipulated Skywalker into a battle with his father, seeking to replace Vader with a younger apprentice.

 

Luke was then manipulated by the Emperor, who told him of his friends' impending doom and Luke was told that he would soon become his apprentice. Luke at first resisted, but as the Emperor continued to taunt him, Luke grew angrier and then grabbed his [lightsaber](/wiki/Luke_Skywalker%27s_green_lightsaber "Luke Skywalker's green lightsaber") to strike the old man down. Darth Vader intercepted Luke's strike and the two began to engage in a duel much to the Emperor's delight.[[4]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-4)

Luke was first able to calm himself, refusing several times to continue fighting his father. Luke attempted to hide from Vader as their fight became more intense but Vader was able to sense his son's thoughts and learned that Luke had a sister. With this knowledge, Vader told Luke that if he did not turn to the dark side, perhaps Leia would. The threat of losing his sister enraged Luke and drove him to angrily attack Vader.[[4]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-4)

After Luke cut off Vader's mechanical hand, Sidious betrayed Vader by instructing Luke to take Vader's place by his side, much like how he betrayed Dooku and had him replaced with Vader. However, Luke began to see what had happened and that he was dangerously close to becoming like his father was now: a slave to the dark side of the Force. Luke threw away his lightsaber and turned to face the Emperor. He told the Emperor that he would never turn to the dark side and that he was a Jedi, like his father before him.[[4]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-4)

##### Demise

:   "*If you will not be turned, you will be destroyed!*"
:   ―Darth Sidious, to Luke Skywalker[[4]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-4)

 [![Sidious punished the defiant Jedi while Vader could only watch as his son was slowly tortured to death.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/7c/TorturePalpatine2321.png/revision/latest?cb=20130421234455) [![Sidious punished the defiant Jedi while Vader could only watch as his son was slowly tortured to death.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/7c/TorturePalpatine2321.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20130421234455)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/7c/TorturePalpatine2321.png/revision/latest?cb=20130421234455) 

Sidious punished the defiant Jedi while Vader could only watch as his son was slowly tortured to death.

 

Angered by Skywalker's defiance, the Emperor unleashed a torrent of Force lightning upon him, forcing him onto the floor. The Emperor then proceeded to torment Luke, remarking that his rudimentary skills were no match for the power of the dark side. Meanwhile, Darth Vader watched his son struggle and plead for him to intervene, with Sidious threatening to kill the defenseless, young Skywalker; unbeknownst to Sidious, this was troubling Vader. Ultimately his concern and compassion for his son, caused the former Anakin Skywalker to wake up and save Luke. The redeemed Anakin grabbed the Emperor and threw him off a ledge down the Death Star's reactor shaft to his imminent death. Firing his lightning upward as he fell, the Emperor apparently could do nothing but scream as he went the long way down towards the second Death Star's reactor, causing a great explosion upon hitting it and releasing a light blue wind which encompassed the throne room before falling back down the shaft.[[4]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-4)

 [![Balance was restored to the Force through the deaths of Sidious and Vader, the last Sith Lords in the lineage of Darth Bane.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/ec/BountyHunters38-VirginVariant-Sprouse.png/revision/latest?cb=20240426002428) [![Balance was restored to the Force through the deaths of Sidious and Vader, the last Sith Lords in the lineage of Darth Bane.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/ec/BountyHunters38-VirginVariant-Sprouse.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/220?cb=20240426002428)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/ec/BountyHunters38-VirginVariant-Sprouse.png/revision/latest?cb=20240426002428) 

Balance was restored to the Force through the deaths of Sidious and Vader, the last Sith Lords in the lineage of Darth Bane.

 

The Reborn Jedi Knight Anakin Skywalker had killed Sidious and destroyed the Sith. With his armor badly damaged by the Emperor's lightning, Anakin's decision to save his son's life would cost him his own. Before passing away into the Force, a dying Anakin requested Luke to remove the helmet Sidious forced him to wear all those years so he could finally see his son's face with his own eyes. Luke tried to convince Anakin to let him be saved by him, but Anakin told Luke that he already did and that he was right about there still being good in him, despite all that he had done, before dying peacefully.[[4]](#cite_note-Episode_VI-4) By destroying Sidious and the Sith, Anakin brought balance to the Force, ultimately fulfilling the ancient prophecy of the Chosen One as Qui-Gon Jinn had believed he would thirty-five years earlier.[[1]](#cite_note-Episode_I-1) With this his nightmarish era of tyranny died with him. Or so the galaxy believed, as Sidious was not so easily destroyed.[[278]](#cite_note-Sidious_BioGal_2,_3,_and_4-278)

While he died in every natural sense of the word,[[21]](#cite_note-A_Family_at_War-21) even death wasn't the end for Sidious.[[7]](#cite_note-Episode_IX-7) When betrayed by Anakin Skywalker aboard the second Death Star, Sidious had little time to realize that his apprentice had turned on him much like he once did with Darth Plagueis, but unlike his former master, he had prepared himself for Skywalker's betrayal. Calling on all the power of the dark side of the Force, and utilizing the secret to immortality he pilfered from Plagueis, the Emperor [transferred](/wiki/Transference "Transference") his consciousness[[5]](#cite_note-TROS_Expanded_Edition-5) and spirit[[30]](#cite_note-Secrets_of_the_Sith-30) far, far away as his empty body kept falling towards the battle station's reactor to his death.[[5]](#cite_note-TROS_Expanded_Edition-5)

### Cheating death

:   "*I have died before. The dark side of the Force is a pathway to many abilities some consider to be… unnatural.*"
:   ―Darth Sidious, to Kylo Ren[[7]](#cite_note-Episode_IX-7)

 [![Darth Sidious was reborn through the science of cloning and the power of the dark side.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/0d/Palpatine_returning-TROSAdaptation1.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20250301043617) [![Darth Sidious was reborn through the science of cloning and the power of the dark side.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/0d/Palpatine_returning-TROSAdaptation1.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20250301043617)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/0d/Palpatine_returning-TROSAdaptation1.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20250301043617) 

Darth Sidious was reborn through the science of cloning and the power of the dark side.

 

Sending his consciousness[[5]](#cite_note-TROS_Expanded_Edition-5) and spirit[[30]](#cite_note-Secrets_of_the_Sith-30) towards a cloned body[[5]](#cite_note-TROS_Expanded_Edition-5) of his own creation[[21]](#cite_note-A_Family_at_War-21) designed with Clone Wars era technology by the Sith Eternal,[[5]](#cite_note-TROS_Expanded_Edition-5) a secret [cult](/wiki/Religion "Religion") of Sith loyalists who continued to follow the religious traditions of the Sith and sought to resurrect their order,[[31]](#cite_note-TROS_VD-31) Sidious took his first breath as he jolted to a new awareness, but it was one of pain, as he realized the vessel he settled in was temporary.[[5]](#cite_note-TROS_Expanded_Edition-5) This was at Sidious' Sith Citadel on Exegol, which he had planned and prepared to make his permanent seat of power during his reign as Emperor,[[8]](#cite_note-TSWB-8) and he took possession of the ancient [Throne of the Sith](/wiki/Throne_of_the_Sith "Throne of the Sith"). Sidious however did not return unscathed. Because of his timely intervention, Sidious was able to prevent his demise unlike his own master Plagueis,[[5]](#cite_note-TROS_Expanded_Edition-5) but while he was able to stave off death with the cloning technology and concentration of dark side energy on the planet, true immortality still eluded the Dark Lord.[[8]](#cite_note-TSWB-8) Additionally, his new body was insufficient for containing his spirit, due to his power in the dark side of the Force being so immense, and consequently began to decay.[[5]](#cite_note-TROS_Expanded_Edition-5)

 [![Sidious' new body was an imperfect clone of his original form that suffered from rapid deterioration.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/a0/DarthSidiousExegol-TROS.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20200116140343) [![Sidious' new body was an imperfect clone of his original form that suffered from rapid deterioration.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/a0/DarthSidiousExegol-TROS.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20200116140343)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/a0/DarthSidiousExegol-TROS.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20200116140343) 

Sidious' new body was an imperfect clone of his original form that suffered from rapid deterioration.

 

Buoyed by the faith of the Sith Eternal cultists on Exegol,[[279]](#cite_note-Sidious_BioGal_25-279) Sidious fought to survive in his rotting, weak, and temporary vessel. His body soon was unable to move on its own, and he took on a ghoulish, undead appearance with missing appendages and eyes clouded over with cataracts.[[280]](#cite_note-Sidious'_Body-280) Sidious was mobilized through the use of an [Ommin harness](/wiki/Ommin_harness "Ommin harness"), a mechanical spine once worn by [Ommin](/wiki/Ommin "Ommin"), an ancient Sith [king](/wiki/King "King"), and the decay of his body was slowed by vials of restorative fluid.[[5]](#cite_note-TROS_Expanded_Edition-5)

Due to his immobility, Sidious was unable to leave the planet[[8]](#cite_note-TSWB-8) and forced to live in exile for years,[[281]](#cite_note-Sith_Eternal_DB-281) but while his body was broken his mind and will were sharper than ever and his spirit unbound, and the fallen Emperor[[51]](#cite_note-BioGal2-51) over the ensuing decades[[8]](#cite_note-TSWB-8) patiently plotted his return to power as Emperor and a Sith Lord,[[282]](#cite_note-Sidious_BioGal5-282) forging a sinister plan to take ultimate revenge on the [Skywalker family](/wiki/Skywalker_family "Skywalker family"), halt the restoration of the Jedi Order, and decimate the New Republic.[[283]](#cite_note-Snoke_DB-283)

### Interregnum

:   "*Admiral Versio, Operation: Cinder is to begin at once. Resistance, rebellion, defiance. These are concepts that cannot be allowed to persist. You are but one of many tools by which these ideas shall be burned away. Heed my messenger. He shall relay you to your target.*"
:   ―Darth Sidious' posthumous message, to Garrick Versio[[284]](#cite_note-Battlefront_II-284)

 [![Imperial propaganda initially denied reports of the Emperor's death in the Battle of Endor.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/63/Endor_is_A_Lie.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20180131040852) [![Imperial propaganda initially denied reports of the Emperor's death in the Battle of Endor.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/63/Endor_is_A_Lie.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/200?cb=20180131040852)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/6/63/Endor_is_A_Lie.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20180131040852) 

Imperial propaganda initially denied reports of the Emperor's death in the Battle of Endor.

 

Following the Emperor's demise, the Empire attempted to suppress the true outcome of the Battle of Endor. In the [Anoat sector](/wiki/Anoat_sector "Anoat sector"), which was cut off from the rest of the galaxy by an Imperial [blockade](/wiki/Iron_Blockade "Iron Blockade") in the days following the attack, Imperial [propaganda](/wiki/Propaganda "Propaganda") claimed that the attack on the second Death Star had failed and the rebellion was no longer a threat. Rumors of the Emperor's death were dismissed as treasonous fabrications by Governor [Ubrik Adelhard](/wiki/Ubrik_Adelhard "Ubrik Adelhard").[[285]](#cite_note-Uprising-285) Although several holovids were circulated to show that the second Death Star had been destroyed, both rebels and Imperials around the galaxy discussed whether the Emperor or Darth Vader had really died or not, as no one was sure what exactly happened.[[156]](#cite_note-Aftermath-156) Many Imperial messages surrounding the Emperor's death contradicted each other; some Imperials like Grand Moff [Lozen Tolruck](/wiki/Lozen_Tolruck "Lozen Tolruck") suggested that the Emperor had escaped the second Death Star through miraculous means, others wildly claimed that the Emperor was still leading the Empire from beyond the grave and some simply refused to acknowledge for months the Emperor's demise.[[19]](#cite_note-Aftermath:_Life_Debt-19)

 [![Operation: Cinder went into effect when Sidious died, initiating a covert plan to destroy the Empire.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/05/OperationCinder.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240803052020) [![Operation: Cinder went into effect when Sidious died, initiating a covert plan to destroy the Empire.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/05/OperationCinder.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20240803052020)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/05/OperationCinder.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20240803052020) 

Operation: Cinder went into effect when Sidious died, initiating a covert plan to destroy the Empire.

 

Intending for only the most ruthless of the Empire to survive and to punish the galaxy for his death, further believing that the Empire as it existed did not deserve to survive if he could not rule it,[[286]](#cite_note-Battles_that_Changed-286) the Emperor also posthumously issued [Operation: Cinder](/wiki/Operation:_Cinder "Operation: Cinder") to a select group of Imperial officers, including Admiral [Garrick Versio](/wiki/Garrick_Versio "Garrick Versio") and Captain [Lerr Duvat](/wiki/Lerr_Duvat "Lerr Duvat"), which called for the scouring of multiple worlds, including his own homeworld of Naboo.[[287]](#cite_note-Shattered_Empire_2-287) The days following the Emperor's death were chaotic, as massive uprisings, which the Empire tried to cease, took place on thousands of planets to prove that the rebels had been right all along about public sentiment toward the Empire.[[288]](#cite_note-Alphabet_Squadron-288) Months after Endor, dark side adherents such as the [Acolytes of the Beyond](/wiki/Acolytes_of_the_Beyond "Acolytes of the Beyond") came to worship Vader and the dark side of the Force on planets across the galaxy such as the planet [Taris](/wiki/Taris "Taris").[[156]](#cite_note-Aftermath-156)

As several [New Republic soldiers](/wiki/New_Republic_soldier "New Republic soldier") were discussing what they would do if Sidious' body had been recovered, a [Mon Calamari soldier](/wiki/Unidentified_Mon_Calamari_soldier "Unidentified Mon Calamari soldier") of the [61st Mobile Infantry](/wiki/61st_Mobile_Infantry "61st Mobile Infantry") expressed his wish that the Emperor had survived Endor, as that would have allowed him to face trial for every crime.[[289]](#cite_note-Shadow_Fall-289) While searching the [Hall of Imperial Register](/wiki/Hall_of_Imperial_Register "Hall of Imperial Register") on Coruscant[[19]](#cite_note-Aftermath:_Life_Debt-19) in [5 ABY](/wiki/5_ABY "5 ABY"),[[290]](#cite_note-Life_Debt-290) Grand Admiral Rae Sloane discovered that the Emperor's personal Super Star Destroyer [*Eclipse*](/wiki/Eclipse_(Executor-class) "Eclipse (Executor-class)") had mysteriously disappeared instead of being destroyed by the [New Republic](/wiki/New_Republic "New Republic") as reported in the Imperial charts. She also found an [image crystal](/wiki/Image_crystal "Image crystal") showing a still image of Sidious and several Imperial Guards, stormtroopers, and officials including [Wullf Yularen](/wiki/Wullf_Yularen "Wullf Yularen"), Dodd Rancit, [Terrinald Screed](/wiki/Terrinald_Screed "Terrinald Screed"), Grand Vizier Mas Amedda, and Gallius Rax. Rax had since risen to the rank of [Fleet Admiral](/wiki/Fleet_Admiral "Fleet Admiral") and was Sloane's secret puppet-master. Following the [Attack on Chandrila](/wiki/Attack_on_Chandrila "Attack on Chandrila"), Rax brought the Empire to Jakku.[[19]](#cite_note-Aftermath:_Life_Debt-19)

Though Rax claimed that he was testing the resolve of the Empire before a [showdown](/wiki/Battle_of_Jakku "Battle of Jakku") with the New Republic, Rax secretly intended to carry out the Contingency. The Contingency involved orchestrating a battle between the Imperial and the New Republic fleets and destroying the two belligerents by detonating Jakku's core, leaving only the "worthy,"[[79]](#cite_note-Empire's_End-79) ruthless Imperials alive[[286]](#cite_note-Battles_that_Changed-286) to reform the Empire. The Jakku [Observatory](/wiki/Observatory "Observatory") contained a deep borehole which led to the planet's core. Rax planned to pour various Sith artifacts into the borehole in order to activate the planet's self-destruction. In secret, Rax had arranged for himself and several "worthy" Imperials including [Brendol Hux](/wiki/Brendol_Hux "Brendol Hux"), his son [Armitage Hux](/wiki/Armitage_Hux "Armitage Hux"), and a contingent of child soldiers to flee into the Unknown Regions. Sloane managed to stop Rax's plan to destroy Jakku with the help of the rebels [Norra Wexley](/wiki/Norra_Wexley "Norra Wexley") and [Brentin Lore Wexley](/wiki/Brentin_Lore_Wexley "Brentin Lore Wexley"). Despite perishing on Jakku, Rax succeeded in fulfilling his master's orders to bring about the collapse of the "Old Empire."[[79]](#cite_note-Empire's_End-79)

 [![Through the Contingency, Sidious destroyed his Empire and ensured its rebirth as the First Order.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/87/HuxAndStormtroopersAtCommandCenter-TFAOfficialTeaser.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20150418182535) [![Through the Contingency, Sidious destroyed his Empire and ensured its rebirth as the First Order.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/87/HuxAndStormtroopersAtCommandCenter-TFAOfficialTeaser.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20150418182535)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/8/87/HuxAndStormtroopersAtCommandCenter-TFAOfficialTeaser.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20150418182535) 

Through the Contingency, Sidious destroyed his Empire and ensured its rebirth as the First Order.

 

Palpatine's great power as Chancellor and then Emperor left an impact on the [New Republic Senate](/wiki/New_Republic_Senate "New Republic Senate"), which feared ever giving an executive similiar authority. As such, the [Chancellor](/wiki/Chancellor_(New_Republic) "Chancellor (New Republic)") of the New Republic was given greatly reduced power compared to the office under the Galactic Republic,[[291]](#cite_note-Bloodline-291) with the word "Supreme" even being dropped from the title.[[292]](#cite_note-TFA_VD-292) However, the Chancellor's reduced influence complicated politics in the opposite way as Palpatine's authority; instead of having a head of state with too much power, the Chancellor had too little influence to make change.[[291]](#cite_note-Bloodline-291) Eventually, the Contingency[[157]](#cite_note-TLJ_Expanded_Edition-157) and overall legacy Darth Sidious left behind ended up becoming the basis of the regime that developed into the [First Order](/wiki/First_Order "First Order"), the Empire's successor, led by the mysterious [Snoke](/wiki/Snoke "Snoke"), who took over the position of [Supreme Leader](/wiki/Supreme_Leader "Supreme Leader") of the Order.[[293]](#cite_note-Episode_VII-293) After wiping out most of what remained of the Imperial leadership, with several exceptions such as Armitage Hux, Snoke went to discover several truths about Sidious, such as the fact that Sidious' Contingency had always been a two-fold plan, one that involved ensuring the Empire's rebirth among the survivors of the Old Empire.[[157]](#cite_note-TLJ_Expanded_Edition-157)

In [34 ABY](/wiki/34_ABY "34 ABY"),[[3]](#cite_note-Galactic_Atlas-3) thirty years after the Battle of Endor, Sidious' voice was heard during a Force vision experienced by the Jakku Force-sensitive [scavenger](/wiki/Scavenger "Scavenger") [Rey](/wiki/Rey_Skywalker "Rey Skywalker") at [Takodana Castle](/wiki/Takodana_Castle "Takodana Castle").[[294]](#cite_note-Super_Graphic-294) Sometime afterward, while teaching Rey on [Ahch-To](/wiki/Ahch-To "Ahch-To"), Luke Skywalker cited the rise of Darth Sidious and the Empire he created along with his father as a failure of the Jedi Order.[[295]](#cite_note-Episode_VIII-295)

### From the shadows

#### The foundations of a new empire

:   "*With the Empire erased from existence, something new could rise in its place. And from beyond the grave, I would control its every move…*"
:   ―Darth Sidious[[30]](#cite_note-Secrets_of_the_Sith-30)

 [![Sidious envisioned the Final Order as the largest fleet in galactic history: an armada capable of imposing eternal domination upon the entire galaxy.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/1/1a/Unidentified_Star_Destroyer_fleet.png/revision/latest?cb=20190827043654) [![Sidious envisioned the Final Order as the largest fleet in galactic history: an armada capable of imposing eternal domination upon the entire galaxy.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/1/1a/Unidentified_Star_Destroyer_fleet.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20190827043654)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/1/1a/Unidentified_Star_Destroyer_fleet.png/revision/latest?cb=20190827043654) 

Sidious envisioned the Final Order as the largest fleet in galactic history: an armada capable of imposing eternal domination upon the entire galaxy.

 

On Exegol, other Sith cultists had gathered to venerate the ancient Sith Order and swear fealty to the last Sith Lord, Sidious.[[281]](#cite_note-Sith_Eternal_DB-281) These followers[[7]](#cite_note-Episode_IX-7) venerated his efforts to bring about a new Sith Empire[[31]](#cite_note-TROS_VD-31) and labored to rebuild the Empire from Exegol as a true Sith Empire. To this end, Sidious' underlings crafted a vast armada of [planet-killing warships](/wiki/Xyston-class_Star_Destroyer "Xyston-class Star Destroyer"),[[5]](#cite_note-TROS_Expanded_Edition-5) the [Final Order](/wiki/Final_Order "Final Order"). From the shadows,[[7]](#cite_note-Episode_IX-7) Sidious plotted his return to power, and forged the remnants of the Empire into the First Order while he manipulated the New Republic.[[279]](#cite_note-Sidious_BioGal_25-279) Once deployed from Exegol, the Final Order would bolster the forces of the [First Order military](/wiki/First_Order_military "First Order military"), allowing the regime to finalize its subjugation of the galaxy. The Sith Eternal labored for a generation,[[5]](#cite_note-TROS_Expanded_Edition-5) raising children in secret military camps, while building war machines in secret factories and shipyards.[[281]](#cite_note-Sith_Eternal_DB-281)

Sith loyalists served on the executive boards of corporations such as [Kuat-Entralla Engineering](/wiki/Kuat-Entralla_Engineering "Kuat-Entralla Engineering") and [Sienar-Jaemus Fleet Systems](/wiki/Sienar-Jaemus_Fleet_Systems "Sienar-Jaemus Fleet Systems"), which allowed them to funnel assets critical to their domineering machinations through subsidiaries to Exegol. Under Sidious, the children of the Sith Eternal were raised to covet the religion of the Sith, while being ingrained with the utmost loyalty to their Emperor. Their efforts yielded legions of [Sith troopers](/wiki/Sith_trooper "Sith trooper"), soldiers trained to be fanatically loyal to the Sith via flash imprinting technologies built upon the [Kaminoan](/wiki/Kaminoan "Kaminoan") techniques in the training of clone troopers. The efforts of the Sith Eternal led to the creation of a fleet and [army](/wiki/Sith_Eternal_army "Sith Eternal army") which would spell the end of freedom in the galaxy were they to escape into hyperspace.[[31]](#cite_note-TROS_VD-31)

#### Building the First Order

:   "*Through my manipulation of Snoke, I began gathering forces, building an army capable of opposing the New Republic that had risen in my absence. Through Snoke, I would make certain that the First Order would be mine to control.*"
:   ―Darth Sidious[[30]](#cite_note-Secrets_of_the_Sith-30)

 [![Sidious ruled the First Order by proxy through his genetic creation, Snoke, who rose to become Supreme Leader with his powerful connection to the dark side.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/0f/SnokeThrone-TLJ.png/revision/latest?cb=20250329003018) [![Sidious ruled the First Order by proxy through his genetic creation, Snoke, who rose to become Supreme Leader with his powerful connection to the dark side.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/0f/SnokeThrone-TLJ.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20250329003018)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/0f/SnokeThrone-TLJ.png/revision/latest?cb=20250329003018) 

Sidious ruled the First Order by proxy through his genetic creation, Snoke, who rose to become Supreme Leader with his powerful connection to the dark side.

 

Sidious utilized one of the Sith Eternal's and his genetic experiments to spread his influence across the galaxy through indirect means while he was forced to remain on Exegol due to his condition.[[30]](#cite_note-Secrets_of_the_Sith-30) This being was Snoke,[[283]](#cite_note-Snoke_DB-283) a humanoid genetic strandcast that,[[8]](#cite_note-TSWB-8) like the Emperor's cloned body,[[30]](#cite_note-Secrets_of_the_Sith-30) originated from the Sith Eternal's [experimentation](/wiki/Imperial_cloning_program "Imperial cloning program") in attempts of extending Sidious' lifespan and produce him a vessel worthy of housing the dark essence that was his spirit, during the reign of the Galactic Empire.[[8]](#cite_note-TSWB-8) Though Snoke was naturally force-sensitive, Sidious deemed his body an unworthy vessel for housing his dark essence, but still found use for him as puppet for his plans of restoring himself to power.[[30]](#cite_note-Secrets_of_the_Sith-30)

Snoke became Sidious' proxy in power over the First Order,[[8]](#cite_note-TSWB-8) a hermit state that began as the [remnants](/wiki/Imperial_Remnants "Imperial Remnants") of the Galactic Empire that escaped under the Contingency,[[31]](#cite_note-TROS_VD-31) and by extension, helped ensure the faction would be his to control.[[30]](#cite_note-Secrets_of_the_Sith-30) Snoke rose to become Supreme Leader over the faction,[[157]](#cite_note-TLJ_Expanded_Edition-157) and through manipulating his puppet, Sidious gathered the forces that would go on to form the First Order's military,[[30]](#cite_note-Secrets_of_the_Sith-30) while under Snoke's guidance, the militia developed into a technologically superior war machine over the one under the Galactic Empire.[[157]](#cite_note-TLJ_Expanded_Edition-157) In addition, while the First Order served as the military arm of the Contingency, the Sith Eternal secretly served as its hidden spiritual heart,[[31]](#cite_note-TROS_VD-31) while none were aware they were secretly controlled by the Sith.[[8]](#cite_note-TSWB-8)

Many were confused to some of Snoke's motives upon his rise to power, such as making no effort to claim the old title of Emperor held by Palpatine during the reign of the Empire, while he also delegated main control and building of the First Order to his subordinates and focused on spiritual matter instead. Nevertheless he possessed the knowledge and power to rule them, which made him the undisputed heir to the Contingency.[[31]](#cite_note-TROS_VD-31) However, even though the highest echelons of the First Order, remained unaware of Snoke's true origins[[8]](#cite_note-TSWB-8) and their ultimate purpose in the form of the Contingency, some in the Order, such as [Enric Pryde](/wiki/Enric_Pryde "Enric Pryde"), came to suspect that Snoke was subservient to some greater power.[[31]](#cite_note-TROS_VD-31)

#### The Skywalker heir

:   "*Young Ben Solo possessed what all masters live to see: raw, untamed power. But a great conflict raged within the boy as well. Not only did his inner turmoil make him heir apparent to his grandfather, Lord Vader, it also made him the perfect pawn.*"
:   ―Darth Sidious[[30]](#cite_note-Secrets_of_the_Sith-30)

 [![Sidious conspired to turn Ben Solo, the heir to the Skywalker bloodline, to the dark side as he did with Anakin Skywalker.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/7a/TalkingBehindLukesBack-TheRiseOfKyloRen2.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20200217034613) [![Sidious conspired to turn Ben Solo, the heir to the Skywalker bloodline, to the dark side as he did with Anakin Skywalker.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/7a/TalkingBehindLukesBack-TheRiseOfKyloRen2.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20200217034613)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/7a/TalkingBehindLukesBack-TheRiseOfKyloRen2.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20200217034613) 

Sidious conspired to turn Ben Solo, the heir to the Skywalker bloodline, to the dark side as he did with Anakin Skywalker.

 

In addition to restoring himself to power as Galactic Emperor, Sidious endeavored to convert the next generation of the Skywalker bloodline to the dark side of the Force.[[21]](#cite_note-A_Family_at_War-21) The Sith Lord targeted Ben Solo,[[8]](#cite_note-TSWB-8) the son of Han Solo and grandson of Anakin Skywalker through his mother, princess Leia Organa, and nephew of the last Jedi Luke Skywalker,[[31]](#cite_note-TROS_VD-31) for his prodigious strength in the Force inherited from his family's bloodline.[[8]](#cite_note-TSWB-8) Through the Force, Sidious watched over Solo throughout his life,[[296]](#cite_note-TROS_Junior_Novel-296) using telepathy to communicate with him as a variety of dark voices.[[7]](#cite_note-Episode_IX-7) The voice Solo would hear in his mind told him secrets and provided warnings of danger, comforting and guiding him, but also deceiving him with false promise that he could not survive on his own without its help,[[296]](#cite_note-TROS_Junior_Novel-296) effectively play on his insecurities and using his fears against him.[[31]](#cite_note-TROS_VD-31)

Furthermore, Sidious, in addition to using him as a placeholder for the First Order, utilized Snoke as his proxy for luring Solo to the dark side.[[30]](#cite_note-Secrets_of_the_Sith-30) In addition to Sidious,[[31]](#cite_note-TROS_VD-31) Snoke whispered to the young Jedi telepathically, cultivating a friendship with the boy as he manipulated him with deceit, encouraging his negative thoughts about his family and his impulsive tendencies,[[21]](#cite_note-A_Family_at_War-21) while utilizing his desperate need for a teacher and fascination with his family's legacy to influence him.[[283]](#cite_note-Snoke_DB-283) When Palpatine and Snoke constantly whispered to Solo,[[21]](#cite_note-A_Family_at_War-21) the Phantom Emperor also utilized this when Solo joined the new Jedi Order as a Padawan under his maternal uncle, Jedi Master Luke Skywalker, during his attempt to restore the religious faction of peacekeepers, and partially engineer the failures that would lead to its eventual destruction.[[51]](#cite_note-BioGal2-51)

#### A perfect vessel

:   "*There is no vessel in the galaxy more worthy of my infinite might than a child of my own flesh. With a slash of her lightsaber, my spirit will pass into her. We two will be reborn as one… and once more, the Sith will rule the galaxy. Eternally.*"
:   ―Darth Sidious, referring to his granddaughter Rey[[30]](#cite_note-Secrets_of_the_Sith-30)

 [![The strandcast sired a daughter, Rey, who inherited her grandfather's power in the Force.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/57/Rey_mum_and_dad-TROS.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20230116010912) [![The strandcast sired a daughter, Rey, who inherited her grandfather's power in the Force.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/57/Rey_mum_and_dad-TROS.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20230116010912)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/57/Rey_mum_and_dad-TROS.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20230116010912) 

The strandcast sired a daughter, Rey, who inherited her grandfather's power in the Force.

 

Sidious never anticipated his son's union,[[5]](#cite_note-TROS_Expanded_Edition-5) now going by the name Dathan, but the clone met a woman named [Miramir](/wiki/Miramir "Miramir")[[159]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith-159) and became intimately involved, and eventually with whom he sired a Force-sensitive daughter, Rey,[[5]](#cite_note-TROS_Expanded_Edition-5) in [15 ABY](/wiki/15_ABY "15 ABY").[[297]](#cite_note-Rey_date2-297) To the Emperor, Rey was regarded as an ideal vessel to contain his spirit and all the power of the Sith,[[5]](#cite_note-TROS_Expanded_Edition-5) and he was determined to capture his granddaughter at any cost.[[8]](#cite_note-TSWB-8) However, his son and his wife went into hiding to protect their daughter from the Sith Lord, living as junk traders on the desert planet of Jakku.[[5]](#cite_note-TROS_Expanded_Edition-5)

Sidious dispatched Ochi,[[7]](#cite_note-Episode_IX-7) now a cultist of the Sith Eternal,[[31]](#cite_note-TROS_VD-31) to track down and retrieve Rey from her parents and bring her to Exegol[[7]](#cite_note-Episode_IX-7) in [21 ABY](/wiki/21_ABY "21 ABY").[[298]](#cite_note-298) Ochi was close to discovering the location of Rey and her parents[[7]](#cite_note-Episode_IX-7) when, wanting to protect their daughter, Rey's parents gave her to Jakku junk boss [Unkar Plutt](/wiki/Unkar_Plutt "Unkar Plutt"), who was paid with a [songsteel](/wiki/Songsteel "Songsteel") [hex charm](/wiki/Sith_Eternal_crest "Sith Eternal crest")[[159]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith-159) to keep her hidden.[[299]](#cite_note-Paid_with_Songsteel-299) As Rey watched on, her parents fled Jakku on the *[Bestoon Legacy](/wiki/Bestoon_Legacy "Bestoon Legacy")*, Ochi's starship,[[293]](#cite_note-Episode_VII-293) to lead the assassin away.[[159]](#cite_note-Shadow_of_the_Sith-159) After refusing to reveal the location of their daughter, on the Emperor's order, Ochi stabbed Dathan and his wife to death[[7]](#cite_note-Episode_IX-7) aboard his ship.[[296]](#cite_note-TROS_Junior_Novel-296) Despite their deaths, their sacrifice[[5]](#cite_note-TROS_Expanded_Edition-5) allowed Rey to elude capture,[[278]](#cite_note-Sidious_BioGal_2,_3,_and_4-278) and she would remain hidden on Jakku for the next thirteen years, until 34 ABY.[[293]](#cite_note-Episode_VII-293)

#### The Rise of Kylo Ren

##### Whispering in Solo's ear

:   "*Now you will be who you are. Who you were always meant to be.*"
:   ―Darth Sidious, to Kylo Ren[[300]](#cite_note-TRoKR_4-300)

 [![Sidious whispered encouragement to Solo as he fell to the dark side of the Force and became Kylo Ren.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/e5/DarthSidious-TheRiseOfKyloRen4.png/revision/latest?cb=20240402151301) [![Sidious whispered encouragement to Solo as he fell to the dark side of the Force and became Kylo Ren.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/e5/DarthSidious-TheRiseOfKyloRen4.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20240402151301)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/e5/DarthSidious-TheRiseOfKyloRen4.png/revision/latest?cb=20240402151301) 

Sidious whispered encouragement to Solo as he fell to the dark side of the Force and became Kylo Ren.

 

Sidious' followers had designed Snoke to groom Solo, serving as the one who molded him into a master of attack and cunning, while also testing his capacity to inherit not only the legacy of his grandfather, Darth Vader, but of the entire Sith Order.[[31]](#cite_note-TROS_VD-31) Snoke came to believe that Ben Solo had the right balance of the light and dark sides of the Force in him due to his heritage as Anakin Skywalker's grandson.[[301]](#cite_note-TFA_novel-301) Snoke manipulated Solo for more than a decade, his influence proving crucial as the fledgling Jedi learned that Darth Vader was his grandfather, having been kept from such a truth by his family.[[21]](#cite_note-A_Family_at_War-21)

When Luke Skywalker sensed Solo's growing darkness, the Jedi Master approached his student as he slept and, in a brief moment of instinct, activated his lightsaber with the intention of killing his nephew. Skywalker immediately hesitated and regretted his actions, but it was too late. Solo awoke confused and scared, seeing no other recourse than to ignite his own saber and intercept Skywalker's. Though his master attempted to assuage the situation, Solo immediately used the Force to topple his room and trap his uncle beneath the rubble.[[295]](#cite_note-Episode_VIII-295) Shortly thereafter, a violent storm[[302]](#cite_note-TRoKR_1-302) caused by Solo[[31]](#cite_note-TROS_VD-31) suddenly set Skywalker's [Jedi temple](/wiki/Jedi_Temple_of_Luke_Skywalker "Jedi Temple of Luke Skywalker") ablaze, [destroying it](/wiki/Destruction_of_the_Jedi_Temple "Destruction of the Jedi Temple") and killing all the students inside.[[302]](#cite_note-TRoKR_1-302)

 [![From the shadows, Sidious manipulated affairs, his foes, and his pawns to lure Ben Solo to the dark side, bringing about the rise of the dark warrior Kylo Ren.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/ec/StarWars2020-25-variant-Sliney-textless.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20230116220529) [![From the shadows, Sidious manipulated affairs, his foes, and his pawns to lure Ben Solo to the dark side, bringing about the rise of the dark warrior Kylo Ren.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/ec/StarWars2020-25-variant-Sliney-textless.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20230116220529)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/ec/StarWars2020-25-variant-Sliney-textless.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20230116220529) 

From the shadows, Sidious manipulated affairs, his foes, and his pawns to lure Ben Solo to the dark side, bringing about the rise of the dark warrior Kylo Ren.

 

Solo fled the temple after he burned and destroyed it.[[31]](#cite_note-TROS_VD-31) At the insistence of Snoke, Solo sought to join the Knights of Ren. After being tested by the Knights, he was reluctantly accepted into the mysterious group. Although their leader [Ren](/wiki/Ren_(human) "Ren (human)") saw potential in Solo's raw power, he doubted the boy's hatred and ability to kill. Ren's suspicions were confirmed on a mission to the [Minemoon](/wiki/Minemoon "Minemoon") after Ben hesitated to kill his former friend and fellow student of Luke Skywalker, [Tai](/wiki/Tai "Tai"). Enraged and disappointed in Solo, Ren engaged him in a duel. Across the galaxy, Sidious sensed Ben's every move and emotion. Prompting the fallen Jedi through the Force, the Dark Lord of the Sith called for Ben to claim his birthright and strike down the leader of the Knights of Ren. Giving in to Sidious' manipulation, in a fit of rage Ben overpowered and stabbed Ren. Taking up the mantle of [master of the Knights of Ren](/wiki/Ren "Ren"), Solo dubbed himself "Kylo Ren."[[300]](#cite_note-TRoKR_4-300) To ensure Kylo remained on the dark side, Sidious would communicate with Ren from afar, impersonating the spirit of his grandfather and idol, Darth Vader.[[7]](#cite_note-Episode_IX-7)

##### A cunning test

:   "*Snoke. He was nothing but your test. You did well to destroy him.*"
:   ―Darth Sidious, to Kylo Ren[[5]](#cite_note-TROS_Expanded_Edition-5)

 [![Sidious regarded Snoke as nothing more than a test to determine Kylo Ren's worthiness of inheriting the Sith legacy.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/7c/Death_of_the_Supreme_Leader.png/revision/latest?cb=20180730043005) [![Sidious regarded Snoke as nothing more than a test to determine Kylo Ren's worthiness of inheriting the Sith legacy.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/7c/Death_of_the_Supreme_Leader.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20180730043005)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/7/7c/Death_of_the_Supreme_Leader.png/revision/latest?cb=20180730043005) 

Sidious regarded Snoke as nothing more than a test to determine Kylo Ren's worthiness of inheriting the Sith legacy.

 

Through Snoke, Sidious was able to indirectly oversee the young Ben Solo's training,[[5]](#cite_note-TROS_Expanded_Edition-5) thinking the humanoid taught their mutual apprentice well.[[7]](#cite_note-Episode_IX-7) Though he considered himself to be Ren's true master the whole time,[[5]](#cite_note-TROS_Expanded_Edition-5) through the dark side adept, the Emperor also planned to sidestep the tradition of a dark apprentice slaying their dark master to ascend to ultimate power,[[8]](#cite_note-TSWB-8) which Snoke's entire existence was built for in the first place.[[31]](#cite_note-TROS_VD-31)

Snoke's training of Kylo Ren proved effective, warping his understanding of his grandfather' history,[[31]](#cite_note-TROS_VD-31) conditioning him to believe the worst in people and that they would reject him and redemption would be impossible after his actions, while instructing him to pursue his impulses as a shortcut for power in the dark side when he chased his desires.[[5]](#cite_note-TROS_Expanded_Edition-5)

 [![With Snoke's death, Ren completed his final test set out by the Sith Eternal and became the new Supreme Leader of the First Order.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/d/d7/Long_Live_The_Supreme_Leader.png/revision/latest?cb=20180709191925) [![With Snoke's death, Ren completed his final test set out by the Sith Eternal and became the new Supreme Leader of the First Order.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/d/d7/Long_Live_The_Supreme_Leader.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20180709191925)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/d/d7/Long_Live_The_Supreme_Leader.png/revision/latest?cb=20180709191925) 

With Snoke's death, Ren completed his final test set out by the Sith Eternal and became the new Supreme Leader of the First Order.

 

In 34 [ABY](/wiki/%27ABY-BBY%27_dating_system "'ABY-BBY' dating system"), Rey [confronted](/wiki/Battle_of_Oetchi "Battle of Oetchi") the Supreme Leader and his dark apprentice aboard the *[Supremacy](/wiki/Supremacy "Supremacy")*, believing she could turn the former Ben Solo back to the light. Snoke overpowered Rey, and having gauged her resolve, he saw that she had the spirit of a true Jedi. Determined to see every trace of the Jedi Order eradicated, he ordered her death but left the deed to Kylo Ren. Sensing his apprentice's newfound resolve, Snoke urged Ren to complete his training and fulfill his destiny by executing Rey. Instead, Ren outmaneuvered his master by assassinating him with the [Skywalker lightsaber](/wiki/Skywalker_lightsaber "Skywalker lightsaber"). With Snoke dead, Ren asserted his claim to the title of Supreme Leader, seizing political and military control of the First Order.[[295]](#cite_note-Episode_VIII-295) By murdering his master in the name of obtaining greater power, Ren had unknowingly completed the Sith Eternal's final test and proved himself as an individual worthy of inheriting the legacy of the Sith.[[31]](#cite_note-TROS_VD-31)

Despite Snoke's unexpected death, and failure to bring Rey to Palpatine, the zombified Sith Lord continued to pull the strings from afar, manipulating both Kylo Ren and Rey, in order to lure them toward him. His granddaughter coming to Exegol was a key and vital part of his plan.[[303]](#cite_note-Inside_Intel-303)

### Resurgence

#### Phantom Ascendant

:   "*At last the work of generations is complete. The great error is corrected. The day of victory is at hand. The day of revenge. The day of the Sith.*"
:   ―Darth Sidious' message — ![20?cb=20250116042720](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/ee/Quote-audio.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/20?cb=20250116042720) [Link](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/1/12/PalpatinesBroadcast.flac/revision/latest?cb=20250308181525)▶️ ([file info](/wiki/File:PalpatinesBroadcast.flac "File:PalpatinesBroadcast.flac"))[[5]](#cite_note-TROS_Expanded_Edition-5)

 [![Sidious entreated Ren to succeed where Vader failed, destroying the last Jedi and becoming the new Emperor.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/a8/SidiousandKyloRen-TROS.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20200401232210) [![Sidious entreated Ren to succeed where Vader failed, destroying the last Jedi and becoming the new Emperor.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/a8/SidiousandKyloRen-TROS.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20200401232210)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/a8/SidiousandKyloRen-TROS.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20200401232210) 

Sidious entreated Ren to succeed where Vader failed, destroying the last Jedi and becoming the new Emperor.

 

In [35 ABY](/wiki/35_ABY "35 ABY"),[[6]](#cite_note-TROS_Date-6) a [mysterious audio broadcast](/wiki/Palpatine%27s_broadcast "Palpatine's broadcast") using the voice of Emperor Palpatine, the public identity of Darth Sidious, who was still thought to be dead by the galaxy at large, was released to the galaxy, threatening revenge. Upon this, Supreme Leader Kylo Ren began a search for the broadcast's source, deeming it a challenge to his rule. After [acquiring](/wiki/Mission_to_Mustafar_(First_Order) "Mission to Mustafar (First Order)") a Sith wayfinder on Mustafar that led him to Exegol, Ren entered the Sith Citadel on the planet's surface and confronted the decrepit Emperor, who admitted that he had created Snoke and impersonated Vader.[[31]](#cite_note-TROS_VD-31)

When the Supreme Leader threatened the decaying Emperor with death, the Dark Lord merely stated that he had already died before, and that the dark side of the Force was pathway to many abilities some considered to be unnatural, mirroring his conversation with Anakin at the opera ages ago. Sidious then revealed his creation of the Final Order, a Sith armada comprised of numerous *Xyston*-class Star Destroyers, [TIE/dg starfighters](/wiki/TIE/dg_starfighter "TIE/dg starfighter"), and an army of loyal Sith troopers. The purpose of this [new military](/wiki/Sith_Eternal_military "Sith Eternal military") was to restore Sith rule across the galaxy in the form of a new Sith Empire, which Sidious offered to Ren along with the title of Emperor,[[31]](#cite_note-TROS_VD-31) but only if he killed the Jedi apprentice Rey. To Ren's surprise, Sidious revealed that he was Rey's "grandfather."[[5]](#cite_note-TROS_Expanded_Edition-5)

 [![After Ren renounced the dark side, Sidious gave command of the Final Order to Allegiant General Enric Pryde.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/97/SidiousOrdersPryde-TROS.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20230129060904) [![After Ren renounced the dark side, Sidious gave command of the Final Order to Allegiant General Enric Pryde.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/97/SidiousOrdersPryde-TROS.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20230129060904)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/9/97/SidiousOrdersPryde-TROS.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20230129060904) 

After Ren renounced the dark side, Sidious gave command of the Final Order to Allegiant General Enric Pryde.

 

Ren shared this revelation with Rey, believing the truth of her heritage would turn her to the dark side. Rather than killing her, Ren hoped that Rey would aid him in the usurpation of her grandfather, allowing the pair to rule the galaxy as Emperor and Empress. Rey's continued survival caused Sidious to suspect treachery from Ren and as such he threatened to turn the Sith fleet against the Supreme Leader unless he killed her. Having been warned, Kylo went to the Endor system where he [dueled](/wiki/Mission_to_Kef_Bir "Mission to Kef Bir") Rey on the [remains](/wiki/Death_Star_ruins "Death Star ruins") of the second Death Star in the sea of the moon of [Kef Bir](/wiki/Kef_Bir "Kef Bir") until Rey fatally wounded him. However, upon sensing the death of Leia Organa at [Ajan Kloss](/wiki/Ajan_Kloss "Ajan Kloss"), Rey [saved](/wiki/Force_healing "Force healing") Kylo's life using Force healing and left him behind to mourn his mother. Ben would finally turn back to the light side after reflecting on Rey's act of compassion and his parents' sacrifice.[[7]](#cite_note-Episode_IX-7) Having felt Organa's passing, Sidious cursed the former Princess of Alderaan for disrupting his plans one last time by costing him Kylo Ren's loyalty.[[5]](#cite_note-TROS_Expanded_Edition-5)

Still, the Emperor remained confident that victory was at hand and asserted that Anakin Skywalker's daughter had died in vain.[[5]](#cite_note-TROS_Expanded_Edition-5) Sidious then communicated via hologram with [Allegiant General](/wiki/Allegiant_General "Allegiant General") Enric Pryde, who had previously served him during the Galactic Civil War.[[7]](#cite_note-Episode_IX-7) With the Supreme Leader gone, the First Order's command defaulted on Pryde, whose allegiance to Sidious was secured, officially combining the First Order's forces with those of the Sith Eternal's Final Order.[[5]](#cite_note-TROS_Expanded_Edition-5) Realizing that the time had come to make his return, Sidious ordered Pryde to send one of his Star Destroyers, named the *[Derriphan](/wiki/Derriphan "Derriphan")*, to [Kijimi](/wiki/Kijimi "Kijimi") and [destroy it](/wiki/Destruction_of_Kijimi "Destruction of Kijimi") in order to send a clear message to the Resistance.[[7]](#cite_note-Episode_IX-7)

 [![The clone suffered from rapid deterioration, forcing Sidious to seek out Rey as a new host for his spirit.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/d/df/ReyMeetsPalpatine-TROS.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20191226101817) [![The clone suffered from rapid deterioration, forcing Sidious to seek out Rey as a new host for his spirit.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/d/df/ReyMeetsPalpatine-TROS.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20191226101817)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/d/df/ReyMeetsPalpatine-TROS.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20191226101817) 

The clone suffered from rapid deterioration, forcing Sidious to seek out Rey as a new host for his spirit.

 

While initially intending to live out the rest of her days in exile like Luke Skywalker due to the fear of becoming a Sith herself, Rey was convinced to desist doing so by the Force spirit of Luke Skywalker himself, who encouraged her to not let her bloodline define her legacy and actions by gifting her a [lightsaber](/wiki/Leia%27s_lightsaber "Leia's lightsaber") which once belonged to Leia. After coming to terms with her past, Rey traveled to Exegol alone to face Sidious and transmitted the route to the Resistance. Upon finding her grandfather surrounded by the Sith Eternal in his [throne room](/wiki/Amphitheater_of_the_Sith_Eternal "Amphitheater of the Sith Eternal"), Rey was welcomed by Sidious, who rejected the notion that he wanted her dead, rather brought to him to succeed him as "Empress Palpatine."[[7]](#cite_note-Episode_IX-7)

 [![Sidious rejuvenated his body by drawing power from the dyad of Ben Solo and Rey.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/07/Sidious_triumphant.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20250205185007) [![Sidious rejuvenated his body by drawing power from the dyad of Ben Solo and Rey.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/07/Sidious_triumphant.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20250205185007)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/0/07/Sidious_triumphant.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20250205185007) 

Sidious rejuvenated his body by drawing power from the dyad of Ben Solo and Rey.

 

Sidious attempted to goad his granddaughter into striking him down, much like he had done to Luke Skywalker thirty-one years before, remarking that while Skywalker had his father to save him that day, he was the only family she had.[[7]](#cite_note-Episode_IX-7) In actuality, Sidious wished for Rey to strike him down in order to initiate a Sith ritual that would transfer his spirit from the decaying clone body into the youthful Rey's, where he hoped to possess her body.[[5]](#cite_note-TROS_Expanded_Edition-5) In an attempt to increase her anger and hatred of him, Sidious told Rey that by transmitting the route to Exegol to her friends, she had led the Resistance into a [trap](/wiki/Battle_of_Exegol "Battle of Exegol") that would see all of them wiped out by the Sith Eternal forces.[[7]](#cite_note-Episode_IX-7)

#### End of the Sith Eternal

:   "*Let your death be the final word in the story of rebellion!*"
:   ―Darth Sidious, to Rey[[7]](#cite_note-Episode_IX-7)

 [![No longer needing his granddaughter, Sidious declared himself Emperor once more.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/e2/DarthPalpatine-TROS.png/revision/latest?cb=20250213012138) [![No longer needing his granddaughter, Sidious declared himself Emperor once more.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/e2/DarthPalpatine-TROS.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20250213012138)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/e/e2/DarthPalpatine-TROS.png/revision/latest?cb=20250213012138) 

No longer needing his granddaughter, Sidious declared himself Emperor once more.

 

However, a glimpse of hope for Rey came when a redeemed Ben Solo, no longer Kylo Ren, arrived on Exegol to help her in her fight against Sidious.[[7]](#cite_note-Episode_IX-7) Unknown to Sidious, his granddaughter had been stalling for time upon feeling that Solo had arrived on Exegol, precluding her from succumbing to the temptations of absolute power and the dark side of the Force.[[5]](#cite_note-TROS_Expanded_Edition-5) Feigning that she was going to strike him down with the Skywalker lightsaber, Rey transferred the lightsaber to Solo through their Force-bond, allowing Solo to promptly destroy the Knights of Ren while Rey used the lightsaber of her master, Leia Organa, to defend herself against the Emperor's [Sovereign Protectors](/wiki/Sovereign_Protector "Sovereign Protector").[[7]](#cite_note-Episode_IX-7)

Astonished that his granddaughter didn't kill him like he had gleefully anticipated, Sidious realized with horror the mistake in allowing Rey and Solo to come together: their Force-bond had been forged in the fire of mutual searching, shared grief, rage, and hate, but what Sidious hadn't anticipated was that it also encompassed compassion and empathy.[[5]](#cite_note-TROS_Expanded_Edition-5)

 [![Sidious unleashed all the power of the Sith against Rey, and declared that her death would mark the end of rebellion.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/58/PalpatineIsDefeated-TROS.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20200623211657) [![Sidious unleashed all the power of the Sith against Rey, and declared that her death would mark the end of rebellion.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/58/PalpatineIsDefeated-TROS.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20200623211657)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/5/58/PalpatineIsDefeated-TROS.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20200623211657) 

Sidious unleashed all the power of the Sith against Rey, and declared that her death would mark the end of rebellion.

 

With all the Knights and Sovereign Protectors dead, Solo joined Rey and dropped into a fighting stance against Sidious, who decreed that they would perish together for their insolence, before raising his rotting hand[[7]](#cite_note-Episode_IX-7) and impaling them with the Force, pulling the two helpless warriors towards him. However, as an unforeseen consequence, their combined life force began to heal the clone vessel that was serving Sidious as his new body. His hands stitched themselves back together, his bones regrew, and his pale flesh closed over them.[[5]](#cite_note-TROS_Expanded_Edition-5) Sidious realized at once what was before him: a dyad in the Force, a [prophesied](/wiki/Doctrine_of_the_Dyad "Doctrine of the Dyad") phenomenon stronger than life itself, one which had not been seen for generations.[[7]](#cite_note-Episode_IX-7)

Realizing that their power would allow him to fully return to life, Sidious used the Force to [drain the life energy](/wiki/Force_drain "Force drain") of both Force-users in order to restore himself to full strength.[[7]](#cite_note-Episode_IX-7) As triumphant thoughts invaded his mind, Sidious harnessed the power of both the dark side and all the Sith who preceded him, continuing to pull more life energy from the dyad as if he was drawing on a flowing river of light so only he, the one true Emperor, would be restored.[[5]](#cite_note-TROS_Expanded_Edition-5) With his body and mobility fully restored and his powers amplified beyond measure, the Dark Lord released himself from the Ommin harness and declared himself the immortal Emperor of the Sith before his Sith loyalists, who praised their master's return. Having no further use of Solo and exclaiming revenge for his first death, the Emperor flung him into a pit as reinforcements brought by Lando Calrissian arrived to aid the Resistance.[[7]](#cite_note-Episode_IX-7)

 [![Rey destroyed Darth Sidious with the aid of the Jedi who came before, preventing the return of the Sith.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/a9/The_death_of_Sidious.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20200401233403) [![Rey destroyed Darth Sidious with the aid of the Jedi who came before, preventing the return of the Sith.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/a9/The_death_of_Sidious.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20200401233403)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/a/a9/The_death_of_Sidious.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20200401233403) 

Rey destroyed Darth Sidious with the aid of the Jedi who came before, preventing the return of the Sith.

 

Intending to dispose of the Resistance as well and with his powers now stronger than ever before, the Emperor claimed that nothing would stop the resurgence of the Sith before he shot an immense amount of Force lightning into the [atmosphere](/wiki/Atmosphere "Atmosphere") of Exegol, thereby disabling every Resistance ship for the time being. His attention soon returned to Rey, who was now empowered by the ghosts of the past Jedi. The Emperor, unfazed by Rey's defiance, declared her death to be the ultimate end of rebellion throughout the galaxy, during which he then unleashed a barrage of Force lightning on his granddaughter, which she blocked with the lightsaber of Leia Organa. Approaching his granddaughter, Sidious redoubled the intensity of his Force lightning to kill Rey, insisting her that she was no match to his power while declaring himself as all of the Sith. However, Rey called on the power of the Jedi of the past, ignited the Skywalker lightsaber as well as Organa's and deflected the Force lightning back onto the surprised Emperor, while declaring herself as all of the Jedi embodied. Horrified, Sidious kept unleashing his Force lightning, but Rey kept deflecting the energy and returned it to her grandfather, severely damaging him. As a result, Darth Sidious—the former Senator of Naboo, the last Supreme Chancellor of the Galactic Republic, Emperor of the galaxy, the Phantom Menace, and final Dark Lord of the Sith–was destroyed after well over a century by his very own power[[7]](#cite_note-Episode_IX-7) once and for all[[304]](#cite_note-TROS_Little_Golden_Book-304) both in body and soul,[[8]](#cite_note-TSWB-8) vaporizing his entire body and releasing a great Force wave that decimated the entire arena, along with killing all of the Sith Eternal loyalists. With the demise of Darth Sidious and the destruction of his cult, the rebirth of the Sith and establishment of the new Sith Empire was prevented.[[7]](#cite_note-Episode_IX-7)

### Legacy

:   "*You are nothing! A scavenger girl is no match for the power in me! I am* all *the Sith!*"  
    "*And I… am all the Jedi.*"
:   ―Darth Sidious and Rey[[7]](#cite_note-Episode_IX-7)

 [![The destruction of Darth Sidious and the Sith Eternal galvanized galactic opposition against the First Order.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/1/1f/The_Uprising_on_Jakku.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20200507000047) [![The destruction of Darth Sidious and the Sith Eternal galvanized galactic opposition against the First Order.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/1/1f/The_Uprising_on_Jakku.jpg/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/250?cb=20200507000047)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/1/1f/The_Uprising_on_Jakku.jpg/revision/latest?cb=20200507000047) 

The destruction of Darth Sidious and the Sith Eternal galvanized galactic opposition against the First Order.

 

Given the amount of power required to forever destroy Sidious, Rey died after vanquishing the Emperor. However, Solo emerged from the pit where the Emperor had previously flung him and gave his remaining life energy to revive Rey, whom he shared a kiss with before he vanished into the Force as the last of the Skywalker bloodline. Despite her Sith lineage as Sidious' descendant,[[7]](#cite_note-Episode_IX-7) Rey renamed herself "Rey Skywalker" to honor the family of her masters.[[284]](#cite_note-Battlefront_II-284)

Following the Battle of Exegol, the galaxy celebrated Sidious' death and the destruction of the Sith Eternal, with [uprisings](/wiki/Uprising_against_the_First_Order "Uprising against the First Order") against the weakened First Order taking place on several planets.[[7]](#cite_note-Episode_IX-7) Bespin, Jakku, [Corellia](/wiki/Corellia "Corellia"), Lothal, [Thyferra](/wiki/Thyferra "Thyferra"), [Endor](/wiki/Endor "Endor"), Coruscant and even Sidious' native Naboo were amongst the systems reported to be openly rebelling against his forces.[[296]](#cite_note-TROS_Junior_Novel-296)

During the victory celebration at the Ajan Kloss [Resistance base](/wiki/Resistance_base_(Ajan_Kloss) "Resistance base (Ajan Kloss)"), [Finn](/wiki/Finn "Finn") and [Poe Dameron](/wiki/Poe_Dameron "Poe Dameron") discussed the possibility of Sidious coming back once more, given that he came back more powerful than ever following his defeat at Endor. They concluded that while Sidious could perhaps return yet again, some other evil would arise as evil always rises, though not for a long time.[[5]](#cite_note-TROS_Expanded_Edition-5)

Resistance historian [Beaumont Kin](/wiki/Beaumont_Kin "Beaumont Kin") would extensively document Palpatine's actions and motivations in his novel, *[The Rise and Fall of the Galactic Empire](/wiki/The_Rise_and_Fall_of_the_Galactic_Empire "The Rise and Fall of the Galactic Empire")*, in an effort to separate the late Sith Lord from the Empire he created.[[305]](#cite_note-305)

## Personality and traits

:   "*If the vast and powerful forces I had gathered could not perform their sworn duty and protect their own Emperor, they did not deserve to lay claim to this galaxy in my absence. For their failures, I would see them burn. And the galaxy along with them.*"
:   ―Darth Sidious[[30]](#cite_note-Secrets_of_the_Sith-30)

 [![Darth Sidious cultivated the image of Sheev Palpatine, an honest and trustworthy politician prior to his ascension as Emperor.](data:image/gif;base64,R0lGODlhAQABAIABAAAAAP///yH5BAEAAAEALAAAAAABAAEAQAICTAEAOw%3D%3D)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/d/d4/Palpatine-TCWJH.png/revision/latest?cb=20221226065002) [![Darth Sidious cultivated the image of Sheev Palpatine, an honest and trustworthy politician prior to his ascension as Emperor.](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/d/d4/Palpatine-TCWJH.png/revision/latest/scale-to-width-down/200?cb=20221226065002)](https://static.wikia.nocookie.net/starwars/images/d/d4/Palpatine-TCWJH.png/revision/latest?cb=20221226065002)
